FVM9hc3srXoUb7ZSZHcj6A.text: Wow. Had the worst service ever last night. From the moment we walked in the door w the not friendly hostess to the waitress attending us at the bar. It had been about 25 mins after the waitress took our order that we were all thinking that the food sure was taking a long time. During that span of time, our waitress never once asked us how we were doing, um, not like she had to walk very far since she was right behind the bar. When the guys next to us received their meal before us, after sitting down well after we got there, we then inquired about our meal. Our waitress then came back and said "oh, sorry, I forgot to put the order in". Was so not contrite about it, she had the attitude, like "oh, well". We couldn't wait another 25 mins for her to be bothered w putting our order in. It's about the customer and treating them well. It's not rocket science. Jeez.

XgjriKTnDIkvuvz9WCg5Ow.text: I guess if you like burgers this is your place! They have really really great potatoes!! There veggie burger was alright but would i go back I don't know! Service was pretty good! But my partner enjoyed His!!

z_d-iW5HCEzuVN-GTwoKGA.text: Get the PB&J Burger with the pretzel bun!!! Outstanding burger. Creamy and juicy. Savory and sweet.  Super good!

Rr2wyuOVN3UXF8-q6Aj3fQ.text: This place was pretty great all around. Awesome burger selection, fun/friendly staff, and pretty timely service, especially considering we were in a group of about 12 people.  I had the pork wings to start and they were delicious. There were some rogue bones to watch out for, but they're definitely worth it over the traditional chicken wings.  For my main course, I had the 10oz hangover burger. I'm a big eater and the burger with fries was plenty filling. Really good tasting burger, although it did come out overcooked...I order medium-rare it was medium-well, but it didn't matter much.  I highly recommend trying this place out if you're in the mood for a good burger and fries!

EFwEI8g_g2Go2TlpmM_N7Q.text: good poblano chili burger, very friendly service by every one who looked at you. owner was on premise, cool scene. just around for a visit would recommend to anyone with a burger jones.

1FjEDosmuxe1UoeAKJ7sAg.text: Good burgers, not great. Sweet potato tots are super sweet, like they have sugar added, so it makes for an odd paring with the burger - imo. Service was friendly and overall I wouldn't mind going back.

qUvoIPWeiiRUL4V_7Rtgpw.text: Well just let me say:  "The food  is amazing".   Great little spot with super, super service!   The bartender, John, was the best!  The chili was the best I have ever had.  Burger was on a nice brioche roll and cooked just as ordered. Chef send out several samples to try and everything was delicious.  Chipotle aioli and pineapple sauce were delicious.  Sweet potato tots were great.  Very nice frozen margarita and margarita on the rocks.  Several other options if you are not a burger fan. Tuna salad was very good.  Will  definitely be back!

Wkjv1llDwe9JkHgwoMUqng.text: Exactly what the name says, perfect hangover food! I recommend the pretzel bun if you get the hangover burger-it will hold up with all that delicious, runny, yolk.  Great place to go for some hangover related day drinking in old town!

3yfzA-iiUYIonTpAVgu4mw.text: Service was absolutely stellar! We were seated sooner than anticipated and even though the place was packed, we were served in a timely fashion.  Having read previous reviews I was anticipating a euphoric experience with a juicy, tasty burger.  The burger itself was a little dry and was not seasoned.  French fries were frozen shoe-string and sweet potato tots (also frozen) were very tasty.  I want to give this restaurant a 3 1/2 star rating but Yelp doesn't do half-stars.

dvaU4RLYqcQ18ftRmK7fYA.text: The wife and I had dinner here tonight. The food is five star all the way.  The burgers were big, juicy, and cooked perfectly. Sides were done well. Beer Battered Onion Rings are awesome.  The only reason I take away a star is because it is a small space with horrible acoustics. This caused an almost unbearable amount of noise. However, they do have a patio area which I am sure solves this problem when the weather is nice.

-VsjnVuF31QUTe_AstwmvA.text: I wad craving a burger and didn't want the usual chain restaurant type. I found this place on yelp and I am beyond happy with the choice. From the start service was 5 star--the server sat at our table welcomes us as first time patrons, went through detail about the menu options, introduced us to the "milkshake man" and gave great recommendations! The burger was amazing, tots excellent, and to our surprise the milkshake man gave us the very first glasses of the vanilla milkshake!!! This place is an A+! I'll def be back! Thank u rehab for satisfying my burger craving

xTq1wVK4HkgxQevUxqDUfw.text: Rodrigo Da Vinci salad was amazing!  Be careful...very spicy!  Sweet poTOTs were as good as advertised.  Can't wait to come back to try something else on the menu!

BUJmzlIdNJQglkZcyb8tFw.text: 2nd visit there and wonderful again.  The burgers are great and the sweet potato tots are the best!  Highly recommend

Jh09bNhAAyJJJQbN3XUUkQ.text: Great burgers and service.  Try the pablano burger.  Outstanding.   The fries are goid as well.  Great pkace with great food at a great price.

ItUP-Q69Z7ditMUqwWJijA.text: Lovee this place! The mcgnarly burger is a tie for best burger in Scottsdale. The sweet potato tots here are amazing and it's a really place with great music and dos equis on draft.

Htpz_R06jUivdgbYPnxfZA.text: We arrived at rehab burger on a Sunday afternoon in late July- thought it would be not be crowded, but pretty much every table was taken.  We got seated right away, and the waitress came over pretty quickly.  We asked for water and some time to kook at the menu.  Took a few minutes, but got the water.  My husband ordered the hatch chile medium well with fries and I ordered the byob with mustard and pickles and onion ringsI ordered a glass of wine and my husband ordered a beer.  After a long time -10 minutes or so the waitress came back with a beer and a mixed drink- said no that's not mine and she asked could I repeat my drink order.  I did and about 5 minutes later it arrived.  And then we waited, and waited and waited.  Finally the food arrived.  Hatch burger medium RARE (not well) with sweet potato tots not regular fries.  No ketchup; aioli instead.  My hamburger arrived with lettuce, tomato, onion, mushroom and pickles, no mustard in sight.  I took it all off and asked the hostess for mustard - which she delivered quickly.  I was also given fries instead of onion rings because according to the waitress they were "still in the fryer," and would come out later.  By the time the rings came out I was full and didn't want them.  We then asked the waitress to change our tab due to the problems and she said she would send the manager over.  Well she didn't and we had to ask the hostess to send the manager over.  The manager came over quickly (guess the waitress didn't tell her) and was very sympathetic and accommodating.  She comped the whole bill, even though we were willing to pay for drinks and things that had gone ok.  I think the waitress was the problem here, not the food or the management, but it was hard to know since we didn't eat much.

Kqee11Hx_JGWGu1sqKF0Vw.text: Burgers, etc.  Sounds like run of the mill?  Definitely not.  Creative menu makes eating here a True pleasure.  Burger on pretzel roll is my husband's fave, mine in the Di Vinci salad which is more like a casserole!  Delicious onion rings, too!  Funky music and decor, as well as GREAT service with smile, round out your night!  Open late, makes it a convenient stop for apres anything!  Make sure you share a home made brownie for dessert.  We met owner's mother while she was delivering a huge pan to the kitchen!  Delicious!  Real food, real people.

t7dVA985M-Z_ScL58q7b8w.text: l love this place, it makes you feel like you are at home!! devin, ryan, cheryl are amazing!!! the food is ridiculously mouth watering amazing!!!

yGH4zl6Mt_r5MCO3s9btUA.text: Burgers were absolutely delish and were definitely worth 5 stars, but unorganized service caused me to take away 1 star. The place has a very casual, beachy look and feel to it, quite nice! There are two choices in sizes for the burgers 1: the Rehab which is 10 oz of angus beef. 2: the Relapse which is 5 oz of angus beef. But for only a couple dollars more, my husband and I decided to go "Rahab" for our burgers and take home leftovers. Well when our burgers came, mine was noticeably smaller than his and I asked the waitress. She said yes that what I received was a "relapse" and that she would go check the computer to see what size I had ordered even though I told her  .  I had ordered the "rehab". When she came back, she said that the smaller size was what was written down but that she will go and have them make me a Rehab. That was fine with me, I don't usually get upset easily. But she took away the wrong size burger so I was left staring at my husband eating his gigantic chile cheeseburger and nibbled on his yummy tater tots and my onion rings that came with the burgers. 15 minutes go by and another waiter comes by and asks if we would like boxes to take home leftovers! I told him that I have not received my burger yet due to a miscommunication. He apologized and said that he would bring my burger out as soon as he sees that it's ready. 10 more minutes go by and I my burger comes out, but by then I was not hungry anymore and my husband was done eating. So I took a bite just to taste it and to appreciate the freshness. It was so delicious!  Then our waitress came by and I asked for a box. She took a look at my almost untouched burger and actually said "Stuffed huh?" I just smiled cause it was actually quite funny how she didn't even acknowledge that my appetite and dinner were kind of ruined because of her mistake. I understand that that mistake easily happened because the place was packed and the music was loud and that "Rahab and Ralapse" can sound the same. I just wished they had tried a bit harder to make up for the mistake. Perhaps they could have left me the first burger to eat at the same time as my husband and let me take home the one I ordered? Or maybe discount my check? Idk...but we did think the burgers, tots, and onion rings were delicious and the prices are great.

EMMQCQOD-PpTCQEZV3MN1g.text: My rating is more of 3.5 than a full 4 but oh well, its still good. Rehab Burger Therapy is maybe one of the worst names for a restaurant I've heard but still it didn't stop me from going in. Decor has no relation to name. Surfer looking joint. Which is fine. Menu doesn't relate to either concept, surfing or Rehab other than the sizing of the burger being "Rehab" for bigger and "Relapse" for the smaller.  Walked in on a February afternoon, restaurant is a bit on the warmer side, air's a little thick. Maybe just the day but still not perfect setting. Who cares about setting really, lets talk about the food. First of all the main reason I leaned to the 4 instead of 3 stars is mainly due to the waitress being pretty cute. That's a plus in my book. We started out with the calamari which was a great choice. Really good. They gave a really generous portion and we devoured it right away. Waitress brought us 3 different dipping sauces not sure if thats the norm, one was medium buffalo sauce that they put on the wings which she said "one of my favorites", 2nd was a chipotle something another, and the 3rd was the marinara that they give normally. All were fantastic! The buffalo sauce worked really well with the batter on the calamari and the other two were equally great. Like i said, we devoured it. Great start. We ordered beers, decent prices but not as chilled as they should've been. The three of us ordered all burgers, one had pulled pork on the burger but we were told they didn't have any pulled pork. Not good. We eventually ordered the bbq burger, chili cheese burger and the whatever the name was that had grilled pineapple, cheese and ham on this burger. BBQ burger went over really well. Pineapple ham burger also went over splendidly. My chili burger not quiet as good. The chili is good, would've been better as a side dish then on the burger. The whole plate when brought out was covered in chili. The bottom of my pretzel bun couldn't be found as it turned to mush from sitting in chili. Not good. The burgers are large but could use some kind of seasoning, a little on the bland side. Pretzel bun was ok, I've had better. You can buy better at Costco. Maybe they should do a daily run over there every day instead. The fries sucked. Barely ate any. The sweet potato tots were ok at best. Their sides need work for sure. Service even though she's pretty she was not the most prompt and kinda didn't show up for a while even though business was rather slow at this time. So there is some negatives but there was more positives so therefore a positive rating. I like the place but it does have room to improve. Hopefully if there is a next time, and it will be.

9hw3Hcw5y8xxJk8odr9AuQ.text: I returned home here in the east last night, from visiting old friends in Scottsdale, AZ last week. One of the things I like to do is eat at local places that are recommended by local people. (They always know best!) So on Friday evening, they brought me to Rehab Burger Therapy.  I must admit, the name had me just a little worried. But my friends said "You WILL love this place!"  I am SO GLAD they brought me here. The atmosphere is exactly what I like about these local places. You could tell the people were locals who came often - because it was good! This isn't a fancy, overpriced restaurant. It's a great local establishment that is obviously busy for a reason! Even though it was busy, the service was friendly and attentive. The burgers are SUPER! I also enjoyed the sweet potatoes - heck, everything was good. If someone from the business reads these, THANK YOU! Next year when I visit again, I WILL BE BACK! After we left, I told my friends that we have to come back next year and they said they go there all the time. I'm going to recommend some Burger Therapy to anyone I know who is heading out west to Scottsdale! Thank you again!

-zYV9NzE-sQb2u4MKudhCw.text: Went to this place after RnR was too crowded, plus 45 minute wait.  Love the beach house decor, very friendly staff and great food.   Perfect place to post up for a sunday funday. I can remember what it was called, but I had a burger with an egg in it and it was Great!! I will definately be back.

tn4VrweOHtHW7LOYFiK93A.text: good food, good service, good vibe great place to eat at before a night in old town.

UbIv4pU9uV_3W8Hf9GJLLQ.text: THE BEST BURGER PLACE!!!! We went to Rehab after a hike and we were so glad we stopped.  The staff could tell we had not been there before, so our waitress took it upon herself to tell us everything there was to know.  It was wonderful to be welcomed that way.  We got our food quickly and she even brought over different sauces for our fries/ sweet tater tots that were far beyond the usual ketchup.  The sweet tater tots with pineapple sauce was to die for! Salty and sweet and it hits your tongue just right. (I don't even like pineapple and I ate it up!) The chipotle ranch is amazing and not too spicy for a wimp like me.   The burgers are giant, def order the smaller size, and the pretzel bun is a MUST. We also enjoyed some of the best calamari as an appetizer with the chipotle ranch.  The atmosphere is so fun and it seemed like a vacation within a vacation for me.  I wish there was one close to where I live, I would be a regular.

fhvZyX7MUlo91nTl2YINGw.text: I have an obsession with fish tacos and since moving here 7 months ago, I haven't been able to find one that is even tolerable. I have now, thanks to Rehab Burger Therapy!   I enjoyed every last bite of my fish tacos the other evening. We went during happy hour and they had cheap beers and pinnacle drinks. My husband had a chicken burger on a pretzel bun and he said the chicken was well seasoned. His fries were also delicious.   We will definitely be back! I'm still searching for the perfect fish taco down here but I have renewed hope now!

2AQciEdDYVNh4nNFmbyWaQ.text: This place is wonderful! I will definitely be going back. The PBJ, bacon and sirracha burger is worth the return. The sweet poToToes are also delicious. Fun atmosphere with friendly staff. What a gem in the heart of old town Scottsdale.

XHIfPVqWANFqgZ2J0MJX2g.text: HEY YALL...Thanks, but NO THANKS. I ordered the bacon burger. The worst burger that I have ever eaten. DRY DRY DRY....besides the Coolest Bartender and Worlds Best Corn on the Cob...This would just have been a waste of gas. I really really had my hopes up...oh well :-/

a139S7Bh1lSqIaSQMpdDrg.text: Great tots. Great gluten free bun.

o_GhTW2qY5szVL5wcmSy6Q.text: One word "AMAZING".....read a lot reviews and they live up to the hype. I had the hangover with sweet potato tots and it did not disappoint. I will definitely be back to try the PB&J burger. My wife had the Mac and cheese burger with green chili which was a dream burger.

dxuPv_X0HvcbTQo76bW0AQ.text: Love this place!!! We always get the chili cheese fries and the hangover burger. Amazing flavor on everything!

c2GB2wHBNJ2GeyxUDBghYw.text: The sweet potato tots were amazing! All the different sauces they have are really good too. The burger was good but nothing too special I've definitely had better being from Chicago. I'd go back again to try different burgers though, I had the hangover.

flsE6nQO4UshsW0vHJEdjQ.text: Best burger in phoenix! Love the atmosphere, service, and people too. Laid back scottsdale burger joint/bar. I had the poblano rehab burger and cajun corn. Went the extra mile to give us refill cups to go. A place that many professional locals go to lunch and will be back for happy hour!!

YnJtEW1OSQSTXR-Sjoev2A.text: I'm new in town and was looking for a good place to eat so I decided to try this place out. It was actually really good! I god the Hawaiian burger which had ham on it so it was different than any other Hawaiian burger I've ever had. I went for the smaller sized party and was still stuffed. The sauce was also delicious and our waitress was super nice. I would definitely go back.

b3H5-9ZHHsbTOB01NM032A.text: I've got to say I am quite disappointed.  I ordered a Hawaiian burger and it was pretty much tasteless. The ham must've been really poor quality because you couldn't even taste it on the burger.. I ordered it cooked medium and it came well done as did the other three burgers at my table.  They did bring us new burgers when we requested it. The waitress was very nice.

9ac1WLAGI9YGjuU2g3D54w.text: The burgers are amazing. They can make most of them vegetarian and many vegan. The beer list, while not extensive, offers a number of great deals, especially happy hour. The service is quick and friendly, even though they were very busy when we were there. Most recommended!

rhy78ELARBukATcOkg6d6g.text: We love Rehab Burger Therapy!  Excellent food, great service and fun atmosphere.  This is my favorite place to have lunch with my family and friends..

UBs5PMyEMBLcB_DMkmwKWQ.text: This is now my go to spot in Old Town! Came in for the first time today and was alone and in a hurry... Well I sat down and ordered my drink planning on just staying long enough to eat and run.. Then one server sitting down the bar from me was making jewelry, Robin. She was so nice and friendly so we meet and she gave me 2 bracelets made while I was waiting on my food and had an awesome belt she made that I bought right there!! Be sure and ask for her if you like cool and vintage inspired accessories;) she's awesome! So after I meet her I am introduced to almost everyone working tonight, which I think is really cool and makes the visit much more fun;). I met Jon, who was so nice and welcoming also, I believe he is either the owner or manager, and my server was a super cool chick named Chi Chi I believe, at least that's what my recipt said!! She helped me choose what to order and I got the Relapse or smaller version of the build your own burger with sweet potato tots!;) AMAZING! One of the best burgers I've ever had, not too big, perfect for me and those who like a thinner, smaller burger! You can get big ones too! That's the awesome thing about this place, each and every sandwich can be made as the smaller version for us light eaters or huge for those wanting more! Great idea! I hate it when I get a huge thick burger and it's falling off the bun and just feels like trying to eat a brick... Not here! You choose between 3 buns, pretzel, wheat, and I believe brioche.... Wheat was perfection! I loved the peach margarita that my bar tender made, and we talked a bit and later she brings me a glass of what looks like a milkshake with whipped cream on top and says to try this and tell her if I like it... I was a little nervous because that can either go really wrong or really right, but it was great and sweet of her to bring me free desert;). It turned out to be a Fireball milkshake!!! I hate Fireball but this was really good! It was really nice to meet so many of the staff, and they were so nice and said I need to be a regular since I live walking distance away:) I think I will do just that! My favorite place in Scottsdale for sure so far!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rehabbing from last night!!;) mimosa with pomegranate liquor;) yummy!!!;) why do oj when you can up the alcohol content?;)
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fun with the World Cup! Go Deutschland !!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flip Flops Welcome!:)

Y-onl-wahkmWdmqHkjczIg.text: My son wanted to eat at Rehab and I wasn't thrilled about going to another burger place.  I LOVED this place.  The food was amazing.  I had a poblano burger at our waiter's suggestion and didn't regret it for a second.  The sweet potato tots that my son had were awesome but those onion rings were unreal.  We watched some football while we ate which was a bonus.  Everyone that worked there was really friendly and very fast.  Our waiter brought out aioli for me without me asking because he said he thought I might like it and then brought me a lid in case I wanted to take some home with me for my left-overs.  Amazing!  It was great service and it was obvious that the people there loved their jobs.  We will definitely be going back there and I will be bringing friends.

I-g99LTJQ67LXPeKu3ME4Q.text: This is my favorite burger place! I love there bacon cheeseburger, vanilla milkshake and the sweet potato tots! This is mine and my boyfriends go to place for a date. The patio area is the best place to sit!

t-lPXmaapidQ-Vrql_HIOg.text: Came here in hopes of finding a gluten-free burger I could actually eat after being diagnosed with Celiac disease...and was pleasantly surprised! Not only was there a GF burger on their menu, but it was delicious! We had awesome service, and left completely content (and FULL)! Will definitely be visiting again soon.

Bh8hsKOPFZkTGLLNHsfjnQ.text: The burgers are this place are some of the best I have ever had. The atmosphere is really cool. The restaurant itself is pretty small, so expect a full house on the weekends and during happy hour.

nmtBnrRETIS7VFBYp2FqGg.text: Not impressed with service at all. While they were very busy and have many good reviews, the place seemed severely understaffed.  We called ahead for reservations - and were told no wait and just to come down. Well, long story short, we got there and ended up waiting another 40 minutes until we decided just to leave.  If you have three hours to kill on a Friday night, then I guess this is the place for you.

EvVBtjqTtuhexhri-k8cEw.text: Met a friend for lunch and tried Rehab Burger Therapy.  Had the bacon cheeseburger (Relapse size) with optional onion rings.  Both were really good.  The burgers are cooked to order so I got a medium rare cheeseburger just the way I like it.  I opted for a pretzel bun which was crispy on the outside and soft inside.  The onion rings were really king size with a tasty batter.  Service was as good as one could expect given most all the tables were filled.  No complaints.  The decor is sort of California surfer which is kind of weird in the middle of the desert but I guess it works.  We ate inside but Rehab has a nice outdoor patio.  Would definitely come back again.

OdCsA_-Y_K9maAXUczhmCg.text: This place is wonderful! Ask about the secret menu! I had the Jalapeno Popper Burger! It was delicious! The waitress was extremely attentive and very knowledgable of the menu. She made a few recommendations about what we were ordering and what worked well together. She right on the money! The sweet potato tots were so yummy dipped in the pesto sauce or the pineapple sauce. Best part....they have the option of a pretzel bun for all their burgers!! I can't wait to bring my husband back to try another burger and enjoy the relaxed, cool atmosphere! I live completely the other side of the valley from Scottsdale, but I think this will become a regular spot for me! It's just that good.  Oh, and the bathrooms were way cool too. Actual towels to dry your hands and real tp, not the scratchy stuff! Impressed!

FjFf1DNX3_niieuAQv5_Zw.text: Soooo good. Enjoyed our visit. Food was great and so was the service. We made modifications to our meal and our requests were met with a "can do" attitude. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Perfectly cooked!

qcEpMDrC9WcWN3uWi_ivRQ.text: Service was good, food was delicious. I never would have expected that peanut butter and jelly with sriracha could possibly work on a burger, but somehow it does. I would order it again in a second. Tater tots were great too.

UizWjoVyyEWbtZgB66LsOw.text: Get the PB&J Burger on the pretzel bun with the sweet potato tots! Seriously the best burger ever!!!! The only complaint I had was the the hostess girl, blonde, was a real bitch to us. Other than that we loved our waitress, bartender, and food!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy margarita!!!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The PB&amp;J burger and sweet potato tots!!! So damn good!!!!

wDLtPVHMw0G5Dh5LmIN1wg.text: Another great find in Arizona! We will certainly come back when in the area. Informal beach/surfer theme but great food/fun. Bring a huge appetite or share  Like: Four Peaks Pumpkin Porter! Spinach Salad! Pesto Spaccini!  Wish: I had ordered the dressing on the side They had crushed red pepper

OEbMwI_OZzDyV7F2787efQ.text: First night in Scottsdale and tried Rehab Burger on a whim.  Couldn't have picked a better place!!  Both my hubby and I thoroughly enjoyed our burgers - he had a Philly Burger and I had a turkey burger.  Both were bigger than we could eat!!  Service was excellent.  We are outside and they even had the warmers on to keep us toasty.  This will not be our last visit while we're here!!

5wGDYjPujOGGPwv0dSlmSg.text: Loved this place!  Was even able to enjoy sitting outside on a cold night.  Had one of the coupons for an appetizer, 2 entrees and dessert.  Tried: skin on fries - GOOD  Shelby's Spinach Salad - huge, beautiful and GOOD  Hatch Chili burger on Gluten Free Bun- He was in HEAVEN  Sweet Potato Tater Tots- SERIOUSLY AMAZING.  I don't even care for sweet potato french fries but something about this being mashed up in the middle and crunchy on the outside with salt.  I can't wait to have them again.  Pineapple Teriyaki Aoli - SERIOUSLY AMAZING 2.  I am slightly allergic to pineapple and don't like mayo at all so I almost never like aoli.  This dip with the tots is the bomb.    Ketchup - what's there to say?  Spicy Ketchup - okay.  what you would expect.  Chipotle Ranch - My second favorite dip.  Chocolate Lava milkshake with a shot of Bailey's - YUMMMM  They had run out of pot brownies by the time we wanted dessert and that made me really sad.  I guess it gives us a reason to return soon though.

nTZQ3REKulMxppsT9QSzpQ.text: Food (4 stars): After consuming so much food since we are on vacation, I wanted something on the lighter side, so I opt in for the Shelby's Shpinach Shalad. It is a spinach salad topped with walnuts and blue cheese and drizzled with a sweet/tangy strawberry vinaigrette dressing. My fiancee got the Chili Cheese Rehab burger. Note: the rehab burger is burger than the relapse burger. The chili cheese burger was not bad, however, I still prefer chili cheese burger from Tommy's in Los Angeles, CA just because there was nothing spectacular about the burger from this restaurant. We substitute the fries for the sweet poTOToes. The sweet poTOToes were a little under cooked so the outer shell of the tots were not crispy and the inside was soggy.   Sauces: We tried Pineapple Teryaki Aioli, Chipotle Aioli, Chipotle Ranch, and Pesto Aioli. We were not a fan of the pineapple teryaki aioli since it was too sweet but if you are looking for something interesting to try then this sauce would be it! The sauce we liked the best was the chipotle ranch.   Service (4 stars): The server checked on us every so often to see how we were doing.   Ambiance (4 stars): There is in and outdoor sitting area on high bench chairs with umbrellas to provide shade. This is a chill place for those who are looking for a place to hang out after work or on the weekends. There is a parking lot next door.   Overall, I would come back for the salad and to try the other burgers.

Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chili burger, side of sweet potato tots, and sauces: chipotle aoili, chipotle ranch, pineapple teriyaki

jfbBxEFFpaOfUjqCg13r3A.text: Came here based on a recommendation from one of our favorite Pattie's bartenders and boy was he right.  First, my biggest problem with Burgers today - a half pound burger should not be your standard size!!! When I was 10, the half pound burger was a novelty item for pigs to order and bring half of it home . Now places just assume "oh, they want a hamburger? They must want to cry from how full they are..."   Now back to Rehab - sure, they have the ten ounce patty for soft suicide, but they also have the reasonable, tasty, cooked perfectly 5 ouncer, or 1/3 pound burger that most people remember. It was cooked right, juicy and not bland. I liked it so much, I went there twice during my vacation, and everything was fantastic - the fries are fresh, and shocker - taste amazing with the skin still on them. All their sauces are home made, and their wings are great. Then the burgers - I got pretty similar ones, the second day getting what I call the breakfast burger - with Bacon and a fried egg - combine that with the pretzel roll, and it was most likely the BEST one of those I've ever had!   My friend had some fish tacos that looked screaming and I think he almost lost a finger when eating them.   I never had a Scottsdale burger place I had to stop by - I had pizza (Grimaldi's) Italian(the Italian Grotto) Sandos (Defalcos) and steak (Don and Charlies)... Looks like I now have my burger joint!   Service: 4 stars Atmosphere 5 stars (cool servers, awesome laid back music, outside couches) Food 5 stars (All Good - Burgers, Wings, Fries and Fish Tacos!) Price 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burger with an egg on it? Delicious!

X1OKVa4EROzCEYqmGqtUhQ.text: Any time I'm in town I go to this place now. Their menu selection is really awesome! I ate the PB&J with bacon burger my first time here, and don't let the description fool you, it was awesome! They usually have good beers on tap too. The wait staff was SUPER knowledgeable on everything from what extra sauce goes great with every burger, and even what dressing is best with what! A must if you're in the mood for a great burger!

CHbzLpWIdRh_hNaCbTMlyQ.text: We don't usually frequent the area, especially at night, but a meeting brought us in the area...  We searched Yelp for quite sometime trying to figure out what we wanted for dinner.... We landed here...  It was a great find.  While I don't usually find myself comfortable mingling with the Scottsdale crowd... makes me feel old... the crowd here wasn't too "typical".  The staff here was uber friendly and fun.  The decor was eclectic and amusing. They pour a mean drink and the Four Peaks Peach was the coldest I've ever had it poured. The menu was quirky and there were quite a few great choices on it.  The burger was delicious, the brownie was awesome.... definitely blow on it first... that peanut butter cup was a scorcher on my tongue.   Definitely a fun place to be and plenty of free covered parking next door is a plus!

14NUMm9d40xtDXd8zTbmGA.text: Loved the beach vibe.  Burgers were as described with creative options as well as build your own. Yummy sweet potato tots and a generous portion. Fun outdoor patio

GDa0iZAkJWrj_cvIU93bEA.text: HH very marginal.  Extremely sub-par beer selection. 8 taps. Blue moon, Coors Light, 1554, Dos X, Bud Light, Corona Light (!) and two Four Peaks. Ok, you say, they make up for the big, national, unoriginal taps with a great bottle selection. Nope. Mike's Hard Raspberry, PBR (12oz!), Red Stripe, Negro Modelo, Heineken, Corona, Corona Light (!!), Pacifico, Dos X dark, Landshark (?!). Seriously.

qy97Xx90MU0GVAyrs0oLXw.text: 3 stars aka A-OK.  A-OK is exactly how I feel about this place.   Happy hour ends early at 6:30- (Ra goes 'til 7 and they are practically next door).  Happy hour savings aren't exactly great.  $1 off an appetizer?  Thanks for covering the tax, I guess?  Decor is sort of a beachy stoner motif?  Um...cool?  There's a magazine rack between the stalls in the ladies room?  Um...awesome?   Food was good, though I only shared some appetizers (fries, tots).  These came with an amusing (and awesome) amount of interesting condiments, which I enjoyed, considering my fridge is 2/3 full of dressings and sauces instead of actual foods. The "small" burgers are ginourmous, so that's probably why they don't have such good happy hour food discounts (they can't be making a ton of money on these).  Where this place shines is the service (surprisingly good), beer selection and the music.  Could've sworn they tapped into my iTunes...  I'll probably be back sometime, if friends want to go here.

ww-NBYVY2zc4nbrEwluVbA.text: The only downfall to this spot is the location, it is small & seating is limited, and they don't allow call ahead reservations, so you can end up waiting for a very long time. Worth the wait, but still frustrating. We love the sweet potato tots & the PBJ burger...yummy!

2aGpNu1TWoFntk8w4dg6mA.text: Its been a while since I've been here so we decided to check it out since we all have had excellent experiences here. We walked in for lunch about 230 and it was pretty busy but we found a table right away. Cassie was our server and she was very busy but really nice. We got the bacon bleu burger, the cuban, the hatch burger, onion rings and mac n cheese for the little guy. They really dont have a kids menu but they can make a few things like PB and J or mac n cheese. Everything was super tasty but COLD. Everything. From the onion rings as an app, burgers, corn, mac. All of it. Cold. We all just ate it because we were truly enjoying everything. When the manager came by and asked, we just told her it was delicious but cold, her reply was.."REALLY? That never happens". This would have been a 4 star review had we not been accused of lying. They were busy, our food sat in the window...period.

KmhCXVz7k1KEU6Y6Ajat7Q.text: Omgeeee!!! The FOOD is Delish... BUT the service is THE BEST EVER... is there a better word for best?! K AND BEETLE RULE!!! Come here ALOT and show them how much you love them!

V40t5--cTicauNdXOioQww.text: Found this place on Yelp of course. What a find it is too. Easy parking, fun place as soon as you walk in. Our Server, Cathy was super friendly and made sure to explain the menu choices to us. I went with the Poblano Burger and it was one of the better burgers I've ever had. Wifey had the Mushroom Swiss and loved it. The Sweet Potato Tots are awesome. Our friend got the Hatch Burger and said it was great. We also tried the Frito Chili appetizer, so good. This is a great restaurant and can't wait to return.
