WXSSquBq1IblDyUx4IcRTw.text: This has got to be the BEST dang burger I have ever had. You have to be open to trying a new/different type of your regular lettuce/onion/tomato burger. We tried the PB&J and bacon burger and also the spicy mac-n-cheese burger! A MUST TRY!!  The staff was friendly & quick at getting your food out as well. I highly recommend this place. The only thing the could do different, is open one in Tucson, AZ next. haha

1cuDgMLjbuhWG3qlUF1Y2g.text: The service was great, refills brought without asking.  First time, it was the perfect spot to eat while waiting for plane arrivals.  Much better to skip the parking and not be waiting in the cell phone lot.  The times after were meeting friends and enjoying the food.  Come for the food and try the outdoor patio that has plenty of misters to keep the temperature down.

mI-MCPSXbesXlBTbdABhSA.text: The vibe in this place is amazing. From the music, the staff to food, this joint is the ultimate beach bar right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale...and they do they're burgers RIGHT!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Hangover burger!!!

HGp1k4Tay8giO8LvEBPaUw.text: This place is the BEST burger is Scottsdale... I'm also obsessed with the sweet potato tots!

W9lM-o4f-uyDFttv5UASBA.text: Too bad all the staff here hates their lives and pretends you don't exist. But the food is not that special either so it's a lose/lose situation.

6MbT7xKYe5Tn7BIAXaKjDA.text: This is a solid burger place. Loved their brunch selections and patio seating area. The Turkey Burger that we customized was juicy and flavorful. I don't eat Red Meat so finding a good Turkey Burger is like finding gold. Nice variation of wine, beer and cocktails. Sweet potato fries were on point too. Go here and you will not be disappointed.

iCjw8aKERWa1To35457yBA.text: This place is awesome. Craving a burger and fries spot in Scottsdale? This is it.  The atmosphere is chill, the food is always great.  I highly recommend the Backyard BBQ Burger and their sweet potato tots with the chipotle mayo - so so good. Only drawback to this spot is that service can get a little slow on a slower night - but we never cared because the staff was so nice, the food was so good, and the atmosphere was so on point we didn't want to leave.

w6qyHma01DHD6djUkgAL3w.text: Seriously you can't go wrong with anything here.. but the fish tacos and sweet potatoes tots are the bomb! Ask for marshmallow fluff with your tots and prepare for heaven.   Wait staff is always extremely friendly, too.

Q9ielxI7zft-tJnadTGU-w.text: Had a good burger here forgot the name but it was quality  A couple of friends had recommended it  Im glad They did Went there for lunch time, enjoyed the service prices were not too bad Would definitely go back anytime I'm in the area

9S9sqkzjNFPIgty33aAdsA.text: Super busy and had a wait (not much room to wait so you stand outside): burger was excellent, milk shake was awesome. Just a little too packed in to the place.

RapSAnHMHoADGctXvnEFaQ.text: Loved the poblano burger fun atmosphere and terrific wait staff. Keri had a yummy messy salad with carnitas. Langton liked the kids macaroni & cheese.

PbsQTSU6CVjDSE18Q-KM6g.text: Absolutely awful!!!!. This was my third and last visit.   First two visits everything was ok. No complaints. But this afternoon 12-6-16 the burgers were overcooked and cooked unevenly. Asked for medium and got well done to rare. Must have been frozen. Had the jalapeno burger and bit into an avacodo shell. A slab of avacodo placed on the burger was not cleaned all the way and it was suppose to be quacamole. My girlfriends burger was cooked unevenly and she could not eat it. The burgers were plain garbage for place that specializes in burgers  We informed the server several times and shortly after a cook came out and began staring at us. This made my girlfriend uncomfortable.  What is more disappointing is that i am on a diet and only have a  burger every now and then. Needless to say we will find another burger place.

NIcBweJbGnFU2mvL03RYVQ.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had.   I'm not typically a burger fan, but on whim I decided to try this joint out. I was not disappointed!  Atmosphere was a big... busy, but the burgers are to blame!

dq-LTfvRaUVgDvILO9G4RA.text: Tough week at work....had to have some rehab.....Rehab Burger that is!  Location & Aesthetics - Located on E. 2nd St. in Scottsdale which was a bit of trip for me from my usually stomping ground in the West Valley but it was worth the drive. Parking is a bit of a mystery as I couldn't figure out where I was allowed to park.  There weren't any signs where patrons was instructed to park so I just followed the crowd and parked across the street where there was a large parking lot.   The restaurant itself looks small on the outside and even the outside patio with its fans and misters was small and seemed crowded with the arrangement of the tables and chairs being in close proximity to each other.  The inside was the same - small.   Another mystery was how customers were seated.  For example, from my observations, a party of two was sometimes seated at a table with four chairs with the two other chairs being unused.  On the other hand, I noticed a party of two with a kid was seated at the long table - a long table with a slew of high chairs on either side of it, where the couple was supposed to sit opposite each other and not side-by-side. The couple with the kid had to put their kid on one of those high chairs which, in my opinion, didn't look too safe or too comfortable. The way the chairs are bunched up together at the long table, was in close proximity to each other, meaning that on a day when the place might be packed, I could envision folks sitting elbow-to-elbow at said long table which is really not comforting in my opinion!  (-1) Thankfully, when we went (on a Friday evening), there wasn't anyone sitting immediately next to us at this long table but rather a chair over from us on either side which didn't make the situation stifling.  Menus - The usual, given upon arrival and when you're seated.  Very large, self-explanatory, and easy to understand.    Service - The staff was nice, friendly, warm, welcoming, and answered any questions we had about the meals. Our waitress was prompt with introducing herself to us upon being seated, and was also prompt with the complimentary glasses of water (which tasted stale), and our drinks. Despite having folks around us and having their orders taken after our orders, we did notice that our orders came well after theirs but it wasn't unnerving.  Food - The burgers were very tasty and creative.  I like the fact the have their own names, sizes (only 2 - Rehab or Relapse), their own particular and peculiar set of ingredients which I think makes each one a unique creation and a taste unto itself. I ordered the BBQ Burger but couldn't tell if it was a Relapse size or a Rehab size as I had forgotten to mention it to the waitress but nonetheless it tasted superbly. I also like you can choose the type of bun to go along with your burger.  Unfortunately, for sides, you're only allowed fries or sweet potato tots (two dipping sauces supplied with it); the latter was very tasty.  I can see the great variety in their burger creations can possibly bring me back despite the place being small.

D9hdCPfzCSbypNI4pTDs1Q.text: Well...FINALLY...made it to Rehab! (That sounds funny) Been wanting to drop in for a while but it took my daughter and her boyfriend inviting me to actually get it done and WOW was I floored. The place is my kind of joint, beachy casual environment with friendly service.  My daughter got the Hangover (love the egg), he got the Macncheese burger (insane) and I got the Elvis....Win!  All the burgers were great but we all agreed the Elvis was the hands down favorite. Double patty with PB, chocolate, and caramelized bananas.BAM!!  Pretty sure it's only served on the weekend. Get the sweet potato tots...you won't be disappointed.

FIjdijwWrVe1ErRN6gI1jQ.text: Wanted to love this place.  Service was slow, but the place was packed.  Asked for onion rings but was told they only had enough for the burgers that had onion rings on them.    Opted for a Hawaiian burger.  It was good, but they didn't bring the aoli that was supposed to come with it.  Finished 1/2 my burger before I was able to flag down the server.  (He never came by to check to make sure everything was okay.)    While waiting to flag down the server for my aoli, the table next to us received a basket of onion rings!!  I guess they decided they had enough now.  They offered to bring us some... if we paid for them.  We were almost done with our meals by that point... we declined.  No drink refills were offered.  We were without water and soft drinks throughout most of our meal.   Overall the service was very lacking...being busy is not an excuse for virtually no service whatsoever.   Even if we lived in the area, we would not return.  Very disappointing.

oHp4OX-eboOFN18UTxEPpQ.text: Great, burgers, great waitress and great beer! The bacon burger was decent along with he chicken wings, the cute waitress was nice and the Kilt Lifter beer really hit the spot!!!

ubgkcNsdakQ4QyRp3vznQQ.text: We decided to swing by on a HOT Sunday afternoon.  When we walked in, we knew inside was the only option.  Even though they had a nice sized patio with misters, you could tell they would not help on a day like today.  It was a busy day, for sure.  We watched all the burgers being served while waiting and got pretty excited for what was in store for us.  While waiting to be seated, we noticed a long table in the middle of the room.  There were roughly 8-10 empty seats at this table.  So we were naturally wondering why we weren't being seated at this table.    There was also another couple standing next to us that had finished their meal and waiting inside.  They had commented that it was just too hot outside to wait to pay for the bill.  And the waitress was taking too long to bring their bill.  The hostess let us know our table was now ready (about 10min wait) and seated us.  So we sat down and started going over the drink menu first.  We needed to cool down!  Once our drink order was placed, we couldn't help but notice how hot it was inside the restaurant.  At first, we thought because it was a hot day and we were waiting by the front door.  But now that we were seated, it was just plain hot.  After carefully mulling over the menu, we decided on two burgers... one Turkey burger and one Spicy Mac N Cheese burger.  Both with the sweet potato tater tots.  While waiting for the food, we loved the vibe in the place.  The cool beachy decor, and 90's jammin tunes... all made for a neat chill space to hang in.  The burgers arrived in good time and looked fantastic!  The tots... perfection!  Though, I think it would be nice if they offered the various sauces in a sampler setup, to dip the tots.  Ketchup was the only sauce brought out.  The mac n cheese burger was great.  The trick is to eat all the mac n cheese first.  It's almost like an extra side meal in itself.  The lil hits of Sriracha were a great flavor adder.  The turkey burger was HUGE.  It was fresh n juicy.  Too many places serve something small and dry.  Rehab does a great job avoiding that pitfall.  So in summery, to get up in that 4-5 star range, Rehab should be offering seats when they are available and be cranking up the AC and fans on a hot summer day.

z71gAbV_q34XuBRiWMpEhg.text: Service was great.  The food was amazing. We had the spicy Mac n cheese and the hatch chili.  Both excellent!  Sweet potato tots are really good.

869ySq2VpkaEiI8a7Z0LqA.text: Kinda layer back, beach vibes place.  The food is good but my only complaint is that it can get very loud in there and is the summer time people come in to wait to be seated and they leave the front door wide open.  Like come on, totally not fair.  The staff should at least say something when the door stays open for a long time a nothing but hot air gets in.  The food is good and I guess it could be worth the hot air blowing in as long as u have a car parked outside with cold air conditioner when you leave.

v2LlADaOcOUFdLegfqANBw.text: Rehab Burger Therapy has been on my list for a few years now. Unfortunately, my girlfriend and I rarely venture into Old Town Scottsdale. And sadly, the only therapy I'm familiar with focuses more on speech than it does on meat.  Honestly, Rehab is a little different than I expected. I fully anticipated that it would be presented like all of those other "high-end" burger joints that are opening up on every street corner. I expected to be able to order a basic burger, and then proceed to have my bank account raped via upgrades, such as grass-fed beef, pretzel buns, premium ingredients, and all kinds of ridiculous tactics to raise your end price.   Surprisingly, none of that is to be found here. Rehab Burger is about showcasing both traditional and unique creations that are executed incredibly well. You can pick your bun and choose how you want your burger cooked, and at least from what I could see, there were absolutely no sneaky "upcharges" for any changes we opted to make.  The place itself is decorated in what I'd describe as a beach house. It kind of reminds me of some chain you'd find on the Las Vegas Strip or at a tourist destination. I was prepared for the stereotypical twenty/thirty-something hoity-toity crowd to be out in full force, but surprisingly, the clientele is a vast mix of different people. Everyone from bikers, families, teenagers, working professionals, and those guys that look as if they eat here on a daily basis. It was quite a buzzing, yet oddly comforting environment.  The menu itself is somewhat bloated and can be a little intimidating at first glance. I opted for a Spicy Mac and Cheese burger in a Relapse (5oz), while my girlfriend chose the Hangover in a full-blown Rehab (10oz). We did this so we could split the Hangover in half and I could sample both burgers.  Meat, which we both requested to be cooked medium well, was done perfectly! Great quality and flavor that clearly puts them right up there with the best we've tried. I was skeptical about the mac and cheese, as subpar mac could be the equivalent of dumping ketchup on a juicy steak. Thankfully, it delivered as promised. The spice was present, while not as overwhelming as I had feared. My girlfriend enjoyed her Hangover, but removed the pepper due to her dislike of spice. Realistically, the Relapse is more than enough for one (normal) individual, so after I finished mine, I was only able to have a few bites of hers. I thought it was done quite well, honestly.  Fries were good quality and while sweet potatoes are not my thing, the tots were just okay. I enjoyed the variety of dipping sauces that our server brought out for us to sample.  Overall, I thought their burgers were excellent and we fully intend to come back in the future to sample some other offerings. While my girlfriend wasn't quite as enthusiastic as I was about the food overall, I still feel that it's one of the better options you can find in the surrounding area.   A full five-star bump will require that we return to sample two other burgers and their dessert, which looks quite promising.  Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy Mac &amp; Cheese Relapse Burger
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hangover Rehab Burger
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zzM-0244B8M2zspXQ-weaA.text: Came in on spring break. Waitstaff was great, food spot on. We will definitely be back.

MOrs413Zu1Dndbf2PkTFyw.text: I've been wanting to try Burger Rehab for a while. With so many positive reviews, I was absolutely sure it won't be a disappointing experience and it was indeed a very good one.   My husband and I were in the area so we decided to finally try it for lunch. We went pretty late, it was around 3:00pm when we got there. Restaurant had some occupied tables inside and outside. The first thing you'll feel when you sit and start looking at the menu is how relaxing the atmosphere is. The laid back music & staff contribute to this feel, I like it!   I checked in on Yelp and I was happy to find out there was a free chips and salsa offer for checking in. Our waitress (who was great) asked if we'd like to add guacamole and we did. Soon after that, the drinks and chips, salsa and guacamole came out. I must say, their chips was fresh and the guacamole was great! It looked and tasted like it was just made! Great job you guys.   We took our time to look at the menu. My husband ordered their mushroom and Swiss burger, I with so many limited choices due to dietary constraints now, had to go for a less exciting option which was he build your own and I say less exciting only because of what I am allowed to pick! My burger was basically your standard burger with tomatoes, and a small twist, grilled onions. On the side both my husband and I decided to order fries and I asked for some spicy pineapple BBQ sauce on the side.   The burgers came out after a little while and we dug in. The taste of the meat was great. You could tell it's meat (vs fat!). The fries were cooked fresh and the BBQ sauce was super! Overall I enjoyed the burger but wasn't absolutely wowed and I say that and insist that it's not because their burger is not good but because I would have liked a funky burger rather than my basic one. This is how I'm impressed usually!   My husband enjoyed his meal a lot and was very pleased with his choice.   Definitely worth going to especially if you could try their mouth watering options. Oh and by the way, their salads (which a lot of ppl decided to order) looked amazing! I might try one of them next time!   Good food, great service and a relaxing atmosphere! Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hawaiian Burger - Rehab

kXOjuYh9d9tA8cSwS-BVdQ.text: I stopped into this place on a Saturday afternoon and it was pretty busy! Every table was taken but there was some room at the bar. I grabbed a seat and although the bar was pretty busy as well, Andrew promptly greeted me and made sure I was taken care of. I did a BOYB with avocado, bacon, and cheddar (lettuce wrapped) and a side of coleslaw. Their coleslaw was some of the best I've had (and I eat a ton of coleslaw). My burger was cooked to perfection, very juicy, and had great flavor. They also have some great dipping sauces as well, I'd recommend the pesto aioli. I would definitely recommend this place to someone who loves burgers. They have a couple of options for buns, great service, and the vibe inside is very casual!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ChgA5_lL7wCSLMcV6FXp8Q.text: Can we talk about these burgers for a minute?  I love a good burger place and this ranks right at the top of my list now.  They have a very wide selection of unique sounding burgers.  Their burgers come in 2 sizes and the portions are very large.  Thankfully I ordered the smaller size but even at that I couldn't finish my meal.  My husband got the pb and j burger and I had the hangover burger.  Both were awesome, as were the fries and sweet potato tots.    I love the decor and funky island vibe.  Without a doubt I will be back when in the mood for a bomb burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hangover Burger-small size!  Pretzel bun-delish!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peanut Butter and Jelly Burger-omg yum.

NdhF7U0JQWjYDBEbCRMADg.text: This place lives up to the hype for sure. Second time being here and what a great spot. Our server Brittany was super nice and relatable, she even remembered me from the last time I dined here. She was quick, made good suggestions, and was on her game.   Today I got the spicy Mac n cheese and didn't do a burger but chicken with no bun and lettuce wrap. The Mac n cheese was good and can tell it's homemade. The chicken was flavorful and cooked great. The side sauces they have are awesome and you should always try as many as you can because...sauce. I got the sweet potato tots, wonderful.   The vibe is a California/Hawaii/beach relaxing atmosphere where anyone can come in with casual or suits on. Fun and loose environment. They decorated perfectly and great branding throughout.   I will be back for sure and glad this place is close. Oh and sit on the patio whenever you can, it's so nice out this time of year.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy Mac n cheese chicken with tots
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork wings
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside

Lg6eKB8FZ-2QfVPSrJzSbw.text: Looking for lunch while roaming around Old Town Scottsdale on a recent trip the BF and I were unable to resist this 5-star burger joint. It's got a beach theme, which I guess makes sense in an area that looks like an old western town hundreds of miles from the coast?  I ordered the Spicy Mac and Cheese Burger with the Jamaican corn, he ordered the Jalapeno Popper burger with sweet poTOToes. The meat on both burgers was seasoned to perfection. The mac and cheese burger was excellent. The Jalapeno popper burger was just "eh". There was too much going on here. There is unnecessary guac on there that seemed out of place. The corn was AWESOME but the tots were kind of smushy.   Overall it was really good but not quite a 5-star.

GzpsHUCYnrPotzZdLOC2jw.text: Quick service, great patio and the flavors in the the food will blow your mind!! Don't question your curiosity, just order the PBJ and bacon burger on a pretzel bun, sweet potato tots, and side of pineapple aioli for dipping in burger and tots.  Such unique flavor that worked great together!

V0YUMhOQVYPIROy1tlxCEA.text: Kool place Lots of choices.     Arrived at 3pm.  Busy even then  I had the Poblano  burger and sweet potato tots.   Both just wonderful.     My husband had the Mac n cheese burger.   Wow.  Just great.   The service was good too. We will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rzFxj0fYhNIEAzB1YzLmTA.text: Low key, chill vibe. Get away from the old town scene/atmosphere for an awesome burger.

8K6xHe30mwlZUMyzvf_saw.text: Big burgers, clean joint. Bartenders pour a little heavy but you won't ever catch me complaining about that!

UE_ua8Zdh0EldXQIaW4p_A.text: Rehab Burger Therapy is simply one of the best burger experiences in Scottsdale. I forgot to take a picture before I dove into the Philly Steak Burger, but I can tell you that the image of this masterpiece is indelibly burned into my brain. Try it with the pineapple barbecue sauce (I know, I was a skeptic too, but I followed the waiter's suggestion and didn't regret it. Sometimes experts really are experts).   I know the fact that I don't like beer automatically makes my opinions/reviews suspect, but my burger judging ability should not be doubted (by the way, Large  selection for those who do imbibe. I'll save my money for a Strawberry Sprinkle's Cupcake on the way back to my Timeshare).   Fantastic Service.   I kind of like the neighborhood bar look, but some might find the atmosphere a little disappointing. Then again. If you want atmosphere, go to Morton's, if you want a great burger at a VERY REASONABLE price, this is the place.   We will definitely hit this place every year when we go to Scottsdale

hjuJSuqPF7JPoHDbN6qJ-Q.text: Well where to begin here , I've been wanting to stop by here for awhile and I'm glad I did. There were so many choices I wanted to try but decided to go with the PB&J bacon burger which from what the server said is there most popular burger and it was definitely good. The burger comes with nice thick bacon a 10 oz patty and pb&j with siracha sauce , The burger itself has great flavor but be prepared for the news it makes which is a lot but well worth it. I opted in for there onion rings which were really good but I think not worth it for the 1.25 up charge for only 4 onion rings , if I would've known I probably would've just stuck with regular fries. Next on the order was the hatch burger which sweet potato tater tots which are a definite must try . The burger again was a 10oz patty on pretzel bun and it had a little heat to it but overall definitely another great burger can't wait to head back and try something new. Also the server was exceptional not sure of her name but the receipt copy said server FOX so just an absolute pleasure to have you serve us.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J bacon burger with onion rings
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch Burger with sweet potato tots

BbveuQFrpNtzc1sCgM19Fw.text: Happy Hour: 11am - 6pm daily and all day Thursday HH Specials: $1 off Party Starters, Wines by-the-glass, and any Rapid Relief, $2 off Special Treatment & any Skinny Remedy, $1 off Special Treatment YELP TIP: check in for chips and salsa for $3.99   This is tucked between RNR and a pawn shop. It has both patio seating and inside. You check in at the front door and wait outside. You can also grab a drink at the bar but if it's busy then  pull have a hard time doing so. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon around 1pm and there was a 25 minute wait. The sun was kinda brutal and shade was scarce but we were lucky to find some.   Granted, I'm here during my spring break so I figured other people are too cause it's like a scene straight out of a college movie. The islander/beach decor and loud groups bring me back to Spring Break In San Diego or Florida.  We got the 10oz spicy mac and cheese burger, pig wings, and sweet poTOToes. I wish the burger lived up to its name because it wasn't spicy at all. Yes there were jalapenos but when you call something spicy I was hoping the bun would also have a kick. The mac n cheese was an interesting and yummy addition. The pig wings were really my favorite because it was tender and a good combo of savory and sweet. The sweet pototoes were crunchy but I got tired of them really quickly.   All in all, this is a great place to go for a hearty burger and to get that Spring Break vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy Hour (2/2)
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy Hour (1/2)

tJX-PxWUZhPkTK3bqrRz1A.text: Went to rehab for the first time with my dad and my two sons.  They were in the mood for hamburgers and the choices were going to be smash burger, or the usual fast food choices.  Looked on Yelp for more choices and we are glad we took a chance at Rehab.  I had the Chili burger, dad had the philly cheese steak and the boys had the Holt?!?, which was pepper type burger.  We all loved our burgers and sides.  Very tasty and filling.   The vibe is very surfer/skate hoarder and relaxed.  Friendly helpful staff.  Burgers around $10+, but comes with a side.  I will definitely come back.

hRTbwBqHEEZ6MYtzefsoHA.text: This is a teeny tiny place in downtown Scottsdale and the vibe is beach bar and very mellow.  The burgers are really good but tonight it was a little off; green Chile wasn't hot at all and kind of tough and burger was a little cold. Normally though, I would suggest the hangover burger for sure.  We ordered onion rings for the first time tonight as our side and it was only 5 rings which isn't much when you're paying $14.59 for a burger. The upside is the grilled cheese (one of very few options a picky kid will eat) is HUGE and came with a decent side of fries.  Beers are fairly pricey when it's not happy hour.  Overall I would come here again but I do think it's a bit overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5-kGYCcJzNJ-RtVlgMJ_hQ.text: My favorite burger joint in Scottsdale. It's a hole in the wall, That i try going to once a week. If you go around noon. You won't be able to walk in the place. Because of to many people in a small room. So try going after noon.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The restaurant.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A great hole in the wall to have a lunch.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Main bar. I go her every Wednesday.

MSx8vTiyCkbpzoW3JLYJcw.text: I absolutely love this place.  I've been here multiple times for work lunches and I don't know if i've ever had anything bad from here.  The staff is always super friendly and the burgers never disappoint.  One of my favorite burgers on the menu is the Peanut Butter and Jelly burger.  Don't knock it until you try it!  The sweet and salty is such a perfect balance and give this burger such a unique flavor.    Their sides are super tasty, and who doesn't love a tater tot let alone a sweet potato tot!    Super great spot for lunch or dinner and a drink!

AZ65ZKDY0ryXGxjmcyjq8w.text: Ginormous tasty burgers, good food, great service.  The other reviewers on Yelp are right.  I was looking for a good burger joint during my visit in Phoenix and this one hit the mark.  They have a huge selection that should meet most people's tastes.  For those that are not in a burger mood, they also have a few other choices like salads, fish n chips, etc.  You can also order other burger varieties such as turkey and veggie.  Tip: Unless you're super hungry or have a big appetite, the smaller size is plenty big.  The fries are OK...not bad but nothing stellar.  I thought the sweet potato taters were better.  They're not crunch like you might expect, which was just fine for me.  Price-wise, the burgers are bit on the higher end of the spectrum for burgers but that's typical for a specialty burger joint.    Overall, a recommended place if you love gourmet burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. B.Y.O.B. with just the basics. Still quite filling.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bigger Beefstro Burger - the &#34;smaller&#34; size!

BLYbJP8h0m7sbmuNKT5juA.text: Had dinner at rehab burger therapy while visiting Scottsdale. Their menu is definitely exciting, even a little exotic. However, while my burger was decent, it was pretty underwhelming. The patio area is nice and dog friendly. The service was friendly and adequate but as I said the food wasn't bad, it just wasn't that great so I doubt I would return here if I am ever in the area again.

crokMR0wfZpE20AOIAOqsA.text: This place was good.  Not the best burger I have ever had, but it was good.  I had the PB and J burger, which is what my server recommended.  It sounds funky but it actually worked out pretty well.  I liked the flavors.  I had the larger size because, why not.  It was definitely filling.

2FQz4cnPsT05tPl0CKjSmw.text: Good burgers but rude service. Overall not very responsive and didn't seem to want to serve our table because we were here with a big group.

bnycBpXEl5t8m4MI9tcF1w.text: Fantastic quality greasy gut bomb food!  When you are in the mood for that kind of thing, you cannot beat Rehab. The PB&J burger is awesome, try it. Wings are good, onion rings are good, fries and sweet potato tots are good.  You won't be disappointed as long as you aren't looking for health food.

vQ4-mDTnGtF52AUA7I_8VQ.text: You know it's the best when you wake up craving a Jalapeno Popper Burger. I'm headed there now because it is just that amazing.

dIKIsM-bmXY3HDpUf7CnEg.text: Two words: PINEAPPLE AIOLI. Also, my burger, the pulled pork burger, was DELICIOUS.  Our waiter was super friendly and attentive, atmosphere fun, casual yet still clean (read: no dive bar here!), and total bonus points for offering gluten-free buns.  Came with 3 co-workers, in town for work, but would come back again an surely recommend to people looking for a different twist on some junk food treats!

L9guYF3GRtQAHy_cm4oLkg.text: Just.....Amazing.....Big Double D-s in your face good. PB-J Sriracha burger is unreal. The taste of meat is on point, the buns are on point, good beers and vibe, unique burgers and sauces. Good waitstaff as well.

FxdRiMcW3ZPqyDYmZGX_8w.text: In town from the East Coast - trying to find the best eats in the area. Decided to try this place out after seeing the reviews and who doesn't love a good burger.? This place really fell short for me - ordered the bacon cheeseburger - burger was just dry and had no real flavor. Def disappointed.

WpVLYC-EWINSBGzZVxCCRA.text: If you are looking for a great place that has great food, then Rehab Burger is the place!  They have the friendliest staff and great happy hour specials.  I have been here several times and I have not been disappointed.  They have happy every day with fantastic specials.  I highly recommend their frozen Margaritas!  The Skinny drinks are amazing too.    They have a great menu to make any customer happy.  They have a burger menu that allows customers to sub any Rehab Burger with a turkey burger or grilled chicken breast at no additional cost.  I am a huge fan of the Turkey Burger.  I tried the Bacon Cheese Turkey Burger with Sweet Potato tots.  The server recommended Manchego cheese and I thank him for this great suggestion.  The Mushroom and Swiss Turkey Burger was full of flavor and delicious.  The sweet potato tots are the perfect size.  They offer several dipping sauces for the fries and tots.  My favorites include Pineapple Teryaki Aioli, Chipotle Aioli, and , Chipotle Ranch.    I think the secret is out about Rehab Burger.  It does get busy but it is worth the wait.  This is a great place to grab a bite to eat with friends.

IDxNrWjD054-PRuniVgQ1A.text: Be prepared to be in pain - food was good - services was good, we were in and out on a game day in a very timely manner. But my oh my,  even the small portioned burger is huge - couldn't finish even half of it. We'll split one when we go back!

PjvR4_7vBqH8MO_jaxJfmg.text: The whole experience was terrible from the food to the waitress. We sat outside and waited 15 minutes till Arrow our waitress came out to take our order. Once the food came out everything was cold so we didn't even get to enjoy. She didn't check on us one time after we finished eating so we just sat there until I went in an asked for the bill. I waited another 5 minutes till I went back in and saw her cleaning her tables. I went to the bar and had the bartender print the receipt. I wish I could of enjoyed the experience

zstppr9lsAVSZp3JrtJUyg.text: The food was delicious and not too expensive, I especially enjoyed the vibe from this place. The staff were very kind and attentive, but not too attentive to where they became annoying.  This is my second time going and I'll continue to go.

gzeoOn1Vk1LcjjIrOTnO7Q.text: Rehab is in a great location and atmosphere!  We were looking to grab some food before heading out into Scottsdale for the day and fell into here.  The patio is cute and the inside has a great beachy feel.  A girlfriend of mine got the Veggie Noogie and loved the crunch from the sprouts.  I on the other hand went with the Venice Beach Club.  Note to self: IT'S HUGE!!!  It was a double stacked sandwich that was hard for me to even bite into, but I'll be completely honest...it was DELICIOUS!  Our other friends went for the massive burgers which they both loved the pretzel buns.  Seems that's what everyone raves about so I'm not too surprised.  The only thing that I was kinda bummed about was the beer.  All of our beers were luke warm.  I like my beer so cold it hurts my teeth so it was hard to ignore that it was warm.    Other than that this place was great!  I will absolutely go back and take family/friends when they are in town from home.  How could you not love it ?!  I felt like I was on vacation. :)

d9NAN5Z4AYldzrn2qW-mWg.text: I went here for dinner with my mom and dad after seeing it earlier in the day. Our waitress Tina was amazing ask for her. We started off ordering the chicken wings (mixing 2 sauces medium/gold medal sauce) they were absolutely unbelievable! So we were pretty excited about the burgers we had ordered. I ordered a Backyard BBQ burger and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly, great flavor, piping hot, and very well played. My mom got the hangover burger and my dad got the mushroom and Swiss burger.  They absolutely loved them. We went to Cold Beers and Cheeseburgers several days ago and Rehab Burger Therapy absolutely smashes that place. If your in old town Scottsdale and you want a good little hole in the wall feeling place go to Rehab you won't regret that decision.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pot Brownie!!!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Backyard BBQ Burger with Fries instead of Onion Rings

8BcmmjHLxQKA5BntYKB9uA.text: Ben was great seeing us. The pig wings were incredible with the homemade pineapple barbecue sauce. We also shared the poblano burger. Cooked perfectly medium rare. Onion rings were crunchy. Sweet potato tots were ok. Happy Hour 11-6 every day

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour 11-6 every day
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Poblano burger
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Poblano burger with onion rings &amp; sweet potato tots

2vAhnO-mRONFwCO5tYQrVA.text: Loved this place - particularly the PB&J burger. Probably the most unique take on a burger I've seen, and not weird unique - like absolutely unexpectedly wonderful unique.   Came here with a bunch of co-workers. As usual I couldn't decide on just one thing, so I split two burgers with a co-worker/buddy of mine: the PB&J burger, and the turkey burger.  I believe we got the PB&J on a prezel bun, and the other one on a focaccia. The turkey burger was pretty good (it's main characteristic was the massive 10 oz patty), but it was the PB&J burger that really shone. It mingled sweet and savory, with the textures of tender beef, hearty but soft/moist prezel bun, light jelly and hearty peanut butter into what I can only describe as a culinary journey to another world.   It was gone before I could fully process what I was eating.   Of course the sweet potato fries and the whole host of unique dipping sauces was great.  The other star of the night was the pot brownie (no there isn't pot it in), but IT'S in a large pot... of marshmallows, brownie, caramel, ice-cream... just overwhelming delicious and excess.   Finally, there was a well rounded and delicious selection of beers.   Definitely make the trip if you can.

xZKmnD2t4rSL21tWyG9Duw.text: Thought the rating here on yelp was too high. Great service but the food was not worth the high ratings. Pretzel bun lacked that pretzel flavor (probably not enough salt in the dough) and the Jamaican corn was wrinkly and missing that plump juiciness you expect from corn. Also the mushrooms on my burger tasted like they came from a can... Pretty disappointing.

f2Q4HKkRPK50K2c83i8aKg.text: Not to be a douche, but meh. I wanted to love this place, but the fries were soggy, that was my first bite. Second bite was a cloyingly sweet tot. Not my thing.  Burger was huge. I'll say that. A Rehab, got three meals out of it. Fair is fair. But unremarkable taste.  Service was slow, if vaguely friendly. Again, not terrible, but a $14 burger? Umami it wasn't.

GTfmA3VmeEDXDVQgdvSfZw.text: Excellent delicious and more than ample serving sizes for the burger,  chicken sandwich and salad we ordered.  If you're hungry go here!

ikDkFJIRx_DLrFZ9zPGYAg.text: Really great burgers with combinations that sound strange but are AMAZING!!!  Please try the peanut butter and jelly burger.   Service was so-so - bartenders were good enough.

piFJ05XBJhViiRlFpR7VsA.text: When we travel, we want to hit up a highly rated pizza place and a highly rated burger place wherever we go.  The reviews and the menu for Rehab looked solid, so we went, and the only conclusion I can come to is that there are a lot of really crappy burger places in Scottsdale.  The food was passable.  The patties were fine and cooked correctly but unremarkable, and the toppings were varied and included some interesting choices.  The potatoes (sweet potato tots and regular fries) were more of the same.  Not bad, but nothing terribly interesting.  But the service.  My God, the service.  I don't know that I can remember all of the things that went wrong, but I can assure you this stands out in my mind as one of the top three worst service experiences I can ever remember having.  We were seated for about 10 minutes before anyone came by to say hi.  We had some salads and burgers and we were here for over an hour.  This is not a fine dining establishment, and we were not loitering.  My burger came out with no fries.  Nothing, just a burger on a plate, and no one thought "Hey, that looks funny."  And it wasn't just us!  The couple seated next to us sat down about 15 minutes after we did.  They probably sat for 15 minutes before anyone came to take their orders.  They got a couple beers about 15 minutes later, and by the time we left, they STILL had no food in front of them!  We told our waiter when we left that these poor people had been completely ignored all night, and we hoped that would maybe get some attention to them.  For all I know, they're still sitting there silently, waiting for someone to give them some food.  The food was fine, but not in a million years would I come back here to be disrespected and ignored just to have a burger and fries.

vk1MV_QbU2TgB2d4UQbl1A.text: Yum I love visiting Rehab burger! These burgers are massive and SO good. I normally do the ghost burger with fresh avocado- it's quite spicy but the taste is awesome. Sub the fries for sweet potato tots & chipotle mayo, you won't be disappointed! The staff is always great and very helpful. Will always be back!

BZD1KPgFgmF-5exC23XqWg.text: I was pretty disappointed in my burger! I had a B.Y.O.B. so maybe the key is getting something else on the menu? My burger was overcooked, the fries were nothing extraordinary. I did enjoy the atmosphere and had good customer service, it just wasn't as delicious as I'd heard. I'm always looking for a great burger and this just didn't live up to its reputation, not this time.

LEU43_P-qgiD7nZhNpO_sw.text: My wife & I stopped in for lunch the other day....been meaning to try this neighborhood gem for some time ( some of Rehab's staff hang @ our club : Karsen's Grill , right around the corner ). Totally satisfied with the burgers .....my swt. pot's were great ! Our server was totally cool; she was knowledgeable about everything in the restaurant......we're definitely coming back for the pineapple desert !

ZIEcN_UENoFTCJeej1Jn8Q.text: Went to this place because of their reviews on Yelp. Was really pleased with the service and the people were quite friendly and the food was incredible. I would totally recommend this place and hope people will give it a try.

BJEE0YuFp4wM5nSjzxtwwA.text: My 2nd time at this spot and it didn't disappoint. My husband got the peanut butter and jelly burger and I got the burger with onion rings and BBQ sauce on it. He really liked his burger. I am not a PB fan so it was weird to me. My burger was delicious! The sweet potato tots were the bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BBQ sauce burger
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J Burger

rd0Sx4IZ8gGpAb6vcFICnA.text: Rehab Burger has time and time again given me great tasting burger combinations with wacky toppings that I enjoy. Everything I've had here is flavorful yet very distinct from other burger joints - not an uncommon cuisine by any means - with reasonable pricing and a cool vibe.  I like the environment, with the chill surfer decor. With tables and high tops it doesn't feel crowded at all. Although I find it extremely difficult to fit large groups - most tables are arranged for a size of 4. I just eat here with a couple friends so not my concern.  Back to the burgers - fantastic. They have innovative toppings like the PB&J Bacon Burger with sriracha and Ghost Burger with ghost pepper jack. Ghost's my favorite, and the pepper jack is definitely elevated compared to jalapenos but not like sign-a-waiver hot.  My favorites here have been off the menu specials. They have a Mac and Cheese Burger with hatch chill M&C pouring off the patty - twice the radius of the burger itself. And the weekend burger that's essential egg's benedict on a burger.   Get me a 10 oz Rehab size of any of those with my sweet potato tots and I will always leave super satisfied.

w2NDqPC-e46_fxX3kwfsvg.text: Every time I leave Rehab Burger, I swear I'm going to check myself into Rehab... Fat Camp, actually.  Last time I was there, I managed to eat the Mac Gnarly burger, and we're not talking the "relapse" size (which is the size of a normal large fancy burger).  I'm talking the legit Rehab size.  You know, the double patty special that you stare at when it arrives, not even sure if you get get your muscles to pick up the thing.  I've also had the Jalapeno Popper burger, which is great if you're craving something fried and slightly unhealthy.  I love the Mac Gnarly, though, because the large amount of veggies makes it feel *almost* healthy...as long as you order the small size.  We've also split an order of the pig wings, which come with a BBQ sauce even better than it sounds.  I've been hoping to try the Pot Brownies sometime (no illicit drugs included - wrong state, people!) but have been too stuffed from the entree every time and haven't been able to order dessert yet.  I've made a promise to myself... next time I go to Rehab, I'll walk out a new woman, instead of being rolled out in a wheelbarrow.

A2dmHTALKNKBpZxZ5ZPEhA.text: Always great. Never just good. Excellent service, clean surroundings and best of all - amazing menu.

-pGERkSLRAUax4szJsuNlA.text: This is my second time around at this place and I must say it did not disappoint. The last time I came here was on my 40th birthday but for some reason   I remember the burger having more more flavor back then. The burger tasted a little bland so I added some salt & pepper and that fixed the problem. I ordered the Relapse Hatch burger medium well and it was Huge, juicy, and delicious.  My wife ordered the byob burger, mayo, tomato, onion, cheese, and she said it was great. I went there with my whole family and they ordered all kinds of stuff it was ridiculous. The peanut butter and jam sandwich was huge/delicious, hot wings- good and so was the Alfredo San Carlos pasta. If you go here make sure you bring your appetite because there are no small portions served. The best thing about it was the price because there was 12 of us and the bill was 110 bucks and we had 4 to go plates left over. The only thing that I can complain about here is the wait and bathrooms. Sometimes the wait is 30 mins long or more and the bathrooms are small.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0nRhNu6s2MbKMvgBNzomZw.text: OMG!!! First and last stop on our trip to Arizona. Fun environment, great staff - and crazy good burgers.  We knew we were ordering too much - but we couldn't resist. The burger combined with the ribeye, cheese and poblano chilies, accompanied bye sweet potato tarts and onion rings accompanied by a beer and a glass of wine.  Winner, winner - chicken dinner!!!

ui8foWns2fWpZNm_juAD1Q.text: Salyna was amazing! The food was just mediocre but would probably come back just to hang out with her! If you get her as your waitress you're a lucky table for sure!

NLSVE1wV-hElYe_OoyAqzg.text: This place has a ton of high ratings; therefore, I had high expectations. Unfortunately, my expectations were not met with their burgers.  I ordered the chile hatch burger with a pretzel bun with the beef cooked at medium. The pretzel bun didn't taste that special and the burger was not juicy. In fact, it tasted kinda plain. In comparison, I just went to Habit burger and their burgers had more flavor and juiciness in the burger. All in all, still a good burger, just not amazing.   However, the happy hour (before 6pm) prices for drinks were a great price. I had the Blue Moon pint for $3.50. The servers are also very attentive and nice. The sweet potato tater tots were very delicious because they are crispy on the outside and moist in the inside. The two dips also made it taste delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. chile hatch burger in relapse size

9j___ABjO-ZjIl0uIkQoOA.text: Yum!! Eclectic decor, great music and great food and beer selection. Best thing about the visit, the bartender/waitress! She was knowledgeable, upbeat and personable! And the sweet potato tater tots were the bomb!

Xootv81wbDADZ1QYTu_USg.text: Yummy food, good service, and great atmosphere. Relapse burger is a good size, Rehab is huge.

Za0lsy303GVDYrNH7T86ww.text: By far my favorite local eatery! I love the food, it's delicious!! I've tried everything there and life be it all! I recommend it to everyone.

9YL-Nu1iM_XK9O8SZYcUZg.text: Best sweet potatoe tots I have had. The PB & J plus bacon burger is infamously delightful.

AyMdSZg6wj2FfXN7iBmCIg.text: This is an intriguing place for sure. The concoctions of burgers here seem very odd when you read the menu of ten or so speciality bizzaro burger mixes. I mean a PBandJ hamburger with bacon and hot sauce? ( they insist it is great!)  A Mac and Cheese hamburger? Ha! However, our burger was pretty delish! We got the Ghost burger which has Ghost Pepper Jack Cheese on it. Pretty spicy but not burn your face off either. Not sure how a whole one would fare since the last bite of a half had my mouth pretty fiery. The serving was large enough for two people to share, which we did. The Onion Rings which came with it at an extra charge were only fair so maybe stick with the fries.   The server was pretty cool, funny and talented. The place was packed. We were a large group of over ten taking up a lot of space. He handled it all pretty well and was gracious. I would go back to try some of their other unique burgers.

xb6ujLvWGJPahR7kczcidg.text: Let's get this right off the bat, Rehab serves up one of the best burgers in AZ. The lean/fat ratio, seasoning, and cook on the burger patty is always on fleek. Your ability to choose what delicious bun is unique. Burger toppings are high quality and unrivaled. On this particular visit I ordered the PB&J Bacon Burger, and was a bit surprised how well the flavors blended together. I also had a bite of my dining partner's Hangover Burger which was also delightful.   That being said, their sides are AWFUL. French fries - so over cooked and bad that I almost broke my sobriety. Sweet potato tots - so soggy and bland that no treatment could help them. Onion rings - enough grease to fill a few shot glasses.  The service was awesome and not your typical Scottsdale vibe. Expect a 5 star burger and service but stay away from the other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing PB&amp;J burger! Fries were mehhh.

WBZW41bCzVXt-3PCi6jgrg.text: Had a chicken sandwich and was in pain for two hours after. Called-apologetically-to avoid writing a negative review to give them a head's up (on the chance it wasn't me suddenly becoming sensitive to chicken) and so nobody else needed to go through the trouble. The manager said he had had no other complaints and was quick to get off the phone. I repeated I was calling as a courtesy but it seemed like he thought I was trying to get a free meal. So yeah, according to my one chicken sandwich, you might have immediate onset stomach pain and subsequent bathroom badness. Also the manager didn't seem to care.

3DfbmBJMjXkr9VCKlKaM0w.text: Literally the best burger place in the world!  Their burger meat is very juicy and tastes amazing and they have a long list of unique burgers.  My personal favorites are the spicy Mac and cheese and the PBJ & Bacon burger (I know the latter sounds odd but it's amazing).  I always chose to have mine on a pretzel bun with a side of sweet potato tots.

f6O-3wJhwU4iW5iBztpsFw.text: Rehab is a little gem that's big on flavor. I have been here a couple of times and have always had great good and a good experience. I think the staff is very nice and tremendously accommodating.   My husband thinks the peanut butter and jelly burger is the bomb, he often talks about it in his sleep. I prefer the veggie burger and really appreciate that Rehab extended the menu to include many vegetarian items. The portions are huge... as in gargantuan. You can easily split a burger and be a happy camper.    Go here, it's totally worth it.

OAO_WygYvQpp0tBbJW9tCw.text: Rehab Burger is known for its creativity when it comes to burgers. They've got some crazy concoctions. I'm a traditionalist when it comes to burgers - just give me ketchup, pickle, tomato and lettuce. Their buns and burgers are top quality, the fries are amazing, and the service is very good.

7JacC1_qHNloATwOre_8ZA.text: Solid food with trendy vibe.  Great burger, average fries and good people watching in a convenient location.

6O_alBZxfEXc1gPcveiRvw.text: This place is awesome from The service, food, drinks, & atmosphere.  The best happy hour every day from opening til 6! Great menu options and if you are gluten-free like I am they have great tasting gluten-free items and a large variety to choose from. I ordered the byob burger on a gf bun with the pineapple bbq sauce and it was cooked exactly the way I wanted it and it tasted so good. If you are gluten-free you know how difficult eating out with your family can be and your choices can be very limited,  but not at rehab!  Definitely try the sweet potato tots, they are amazing! The service was excellent from everyone we encountered, the hostess, the manager, the server, and the bartender. My bloody mary was perfect and my husband's beers were ice cold. The decor is very relaxed beach vibe, makes you want to hang out there all day. I'm definitely going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour Bloody Mary! :)

fty9yOIWdPCyKmLZw6pIoA.text: This may just be the best burger in the city. The sauces are awesome! I come here as often as I can.

0YaQif30VBIpxCzt-yFWWQ.text: Love love love this place! Let's start with the laid back beachy vibe and the fun service. Makes me feel like I'm in some surf town not Scottsdale. The food is really yummy. I love the mushroom burger but my favorite thing on the menu is the pig wings with a side of the pineapple aioli. It's amazing. This place gets really busy on the weekends so expect a bit of a wait but in my opinion it's worth it. Their specials are usually really delicious too so don't be shy to try them!

kBScRqG0N_xlmpSFYHkqCg.text: Well, after many chances i have given up on rehab. When it opened i gave it my best burger award, sadly, no more. If my burger is cooked correctly half the time i would be lucky.  Just tired of having recooks. This is not a one-off or random occurrence, this has been the case for over a year. This burger was supposed to be no pink.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This was supposed to be med well, somebody kill it quick.

EH47-7jaixvBBT9DB-D7-w.text: Awesome calamari, awesome burgers, awesome drinks and awesome service. Loved the Reggae music and laid back atmosphere too!

eYxw_0-SbGTFCnmmchzBNQ.text: Great food.  Great service.  THIS is how a burger is supposed to be cooked and taste. If you come here and order a Veggie burger OR eat your burger cooked Well Done, please skip this place and patronize McDonald's. Had the Jalapeno Popper burger w/ sweet potato tots. Awesome.  Anyone who rated this place less than 3 stars must be a high maintenence P.I.T.A!

f2GvB5Wezi95TQ2px4_GaQ.text: The Porkster plus green chili, you'll never go back to another burger. Side note, the Sweet Serrano dressing is phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Back again, just as awesome
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The burger that changed my life: The Porkster plus green chili

kDSNnErKGN1lYfLr9daH2w.text: I got animal style fries, my husband got the southwest burger. We drank their special drinks sweet samarozjia, bochys brew and a bloody mary (it comes with bacon). Everthing was exception waiters were so helpful and friendly, food was delicious and atmosphere was great!

sbUHmx1PYlp9qt8GCXW1Kg.text: Went here last night. They didn't seem busy - however our waitress stopped by at most twice. Didn't ask how anything was, if she had, we would have showed her the medium burger that came out absolutely undercooked and mentioned that I didn't really care for my meal either. I would give 0 stars but that's not an option.

ckUcEk1nbQu0oHSUtdnHMg.text: Loved it here! Our server was very friendly and it was my first time there and didn't know they closed at 10pm and he offered us water to go after a few cocktails.

76cEwcmKSBedlboZu1c1bg.text: My husband and I love this place when going out for a burger. The mac n cheese burger is awesome as well as the Macnarley (I think that's the name) burger. We have tried several more and they've all been good.

MR3jqliVsw6JzUi_KnlfmA.text: After walking around Old Town Scottsdale, we decided on Rehab and didn't regret our choice at all. The menu of burgers is very creative. Who's ever heard of a PBJ burger? My son was curious, then went with the 10 oz. jalapeno popper burger & fries. Burger was huge & fries were crisp. My husband went with smaller Patty Melt & onion rings. Both were very good. I had the chili burger with no bun & the sweet poTOToes with chipotle aioli. The chili was very meaty & had the right amount of beans. I would have liked it with a touch more heat, but it was still tasty. The sweet potato tater tots were quite crisp & good with the aioli. The atmosphere is definitely bar-like, but I wouldn't have a problem taking young children there. While not haute cuisine, Rehab serves good burgers and a good selection of beer. The rest of the menu looked good as well. I would recommend it to someone looking for burgers in the area.

0kOlaEPX2zpmXopZ26CzxQ.text: Fantastic atmosphere. Amazing food. Well priced. Very slow service- good thing the setting was great.

7WH2jHNAMXOB8qPOd98mUQ.text: This place is fantastic. I went here a few days ago and was really blown away. It looks "ok" from the outside, a little ran down and kind of shoved back behind RnR off the corner, we weren't expecting much. Little did we know when we walked in how cool, fun and delicious this place would be. It's definitely got the Cali feel to it, with pics on the walls, bikes, surf boards, and fish tanks on the TV! It's really neat the way they gave this tiny place such a big Cali feel.  The place was packed on a Sunday early afternoon, so we sat at the bar. I ordered the chicken pesto pasta and my friend ordered the hangover burger. It didn't take long for the food to get out to us, while waiting we people watched and enjoyed our beverages! The food was AMAZING!!!! The pesto had a weird mix to it, when I ate a bite with no chicken it was meh, on the ok side, but when I added a piece of their marinated chicken in the mix my taste buds went bananas! It was crazy! I started laughing so hard because the chicken brought out so much more flavor of the pesto sauce! Man am I becoming a foodie. Their hang over burger was to die for. It sounds weird at first, but then when you think about it, you're trying to figure out why no one has combined eggs, bacon, colby jack cheese and green chili on top of some deliciously cooked hamburger before! I had one bite of my friend's hamburger and I was hooked. We both started chowing down like we hadn't eaten in days! I didn't think this lunch could get any better, until I checked in and noticed a coupon for their brownies! Ahhhhh man that did us in! The brownie came out super hot (watch your tongue ouchy) with some recess chocolate pieces in it, with of course ice cream on top.....DELICIOUS! I literally don't remember the drive home because I was in a food coma from this place! My friend was lucky they didn't have to roll me out the door!  I can't wait to go back! This place is awesome!!!! Keep it up Rehab, you definitely showed me what I have been missing out on!  PS - Staff was fantastic! Everyone was so happy, smiling, courteous, and helpful, it was awesome! Not one sad face in the whole house! You don't see that much anymore! You're staff is awesome!

48iTWEX-Hbsl6gVhpMrS_w.text: They are dog friendly on the patio and the happy hour is pretty good but unfortunately Im not a huge fan of the taste of the burgers or the heavy thick buns. I will definitely be back though as the staff and little patio is great!

JY4WVguIaPhISuVLC65mqg.text: This is a red meat lovers paradise. I could not have asked for a better meal for the price. We got the Rehab Jalapeno Popper Burger, Tony Montana, and sweet potato tots to share. Delicious!

g8o0nzxWieCGwdowwVwvBQ.text: Well, I thought I had walked into Hooters.  The waitress was showing off all her goods, as were the other two.  One was pregnant with shorts on and the other was obviously a mother.  Funky decor was fun, food was average. In Rehab people should wear more clothes. Ordered burger medium and it was rare, service was good- if you could keep your eyes off Hooters in training.

6XiPZ6bORtstMu1P1qG-nA.text: Another gem in old town I have had all but 4 of the burgers on the menu, and have had nothing but great meals and excellent service!

WR1LGydOHW5hntEvaNDBLQ.text: We stopped here after a couple drinks next door and the burgers and HUGE and delicious!!  I would strongly recommend tying it out.  Good price too!!

yozAeQHThArXJCXLvZ0fGw.text: I've never met servers who were so friendly, patient, and just overall cool people.    Burgers are excellent. I've had the chilli and mushroom swiss and they were both exquisite.   Sweet potato tots are mediocre.  I prefer the fries.

XiPM51fznpAqKEwPufpUlg.text: Amazing place....great atmosphere and incredible burger.  My son got the fettuccine with pesto and he loved it.  It's a must go to!!!!!!  I'm from NY and very picky...this is a winner

SvEuhfO14-R2qT45sB_mSA.text: Sat outside tonight. We were seated quickly but it took awhile to get our drinks. We got guacamole on the special menu for cinco De mayo and it was excellent. I had the bacon cheeseburger with a pretzel bun. The chipotle ranch tasted great with the fries. My sister had the portobello  burger with sweet potato tots and loved it! The food and atmosphere were great. Service was slow but still a solid 4 stars!

Ee2zLZiWssbI7Rbw0gnc8Q.text: Amazing sweet potato tots, and I don't even like sweet potatoes. Burger was done properly, parking can be a little bit rough during peak hours tho.

MVd-ID2Ceppowge-cCHRiQ.text: Burger quality is great and these things are massive. I ordered a 5oz but was brought, and charged for, a 10oz.  If you have a normal-person appetite, split the 10oz with someone for a reasonably priced meal.  The fries were pretty awful though. They should be hot and crispy; these were not. Sweet potato tots also seemed like they had been sitting out for a while. I like my tots with extra crunch. The beach setting was a bit forced and over-the-top...cmon you're sitting in the middle of the desert! Put some good games on the screens instead of electronic fish swimming around.

NRzvqtGTJiFSdg-fciGs5g.text: Rolled out of bed on an idle Sunday afternoon, and my head felt like someone hit it with a hammer. I must have had a few more brews than normal the night before, and I felt a hunger for something different. I worked my way through Yelp, and found this place. We drove to old town, and parking was easy to find for this location. It was busy, but we got seated right away. There are an assortment of wild burgers on the menu, and the one with "Hangover" in the title was calling my name. After ordering, the food took a good 25 minutes to come out to us. We ate, and the burgers were ok, slightly under seasoned in my opinion. Fun little place to try, but I doubt I'll make my way back again.

r3nMxizhYx5Pi8kLtEfjpA.text: I'm not too easily impressed by burger pubs, but this place was really fantastic. My grilled chicken sandwich was exceptionally delicious, the sweet potato tots in honey mustard aioli were great, the server was helpful and funny, and the atmosphere is chill with cool decor and great music that isn't too loud. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The bar

HggKzBUe4LI-tScrZhTs-Q.text: I first came here over a year ago.  I was super excited about the gluten free buns and the sweet potato tots.  It was delicious.  I've been several times since then and the past couple of times, I have been drastically disappointed.  The burger has been dry and the sweet potato tots have been sgggy and smooshy.  The fries were good, so I switched.   I have recommended this place several times, but I'm hesitant to recommend it now, especially to out of town guests.

MxEFEnq8i_PnCsHk1tpi4g.text: If you've read my reviews, you know I am in an endless search for a burger as good as Indulge Burger, which closed and broke my heart. I have heard really amazing things about this place from a lot of my friends. Although I prefer to only eat natural, antibiotic free, grass fed meat, the feedback on this place was so great I knew I had to give it a try. The location is great and parking not too bad. We didn't have to wait to be seated. Once we were seated though, it was 40 minutes before we got our food, which felt like a really long time. Our waitress was a really nice laid back lady, and the other staff seemed really nice. Sadly, my cheeseburger was good, but not amazing. I loved the bun and the meat was good, but it just kind of was like most other burgers, flavored with pepper. The fries were very good, but not quite amazing. The shake came out and was the consistency of chocolate milk, so I asked them to remake it. It came out thicker and colder, but was average, not great.   Maybe I just am holding everything up to a standard from a place that I can't have anymore :) I will have to give this place a try again another day.

OnNfPPAGtEZjv3dy2xiVGQ.text: My husband took me here for Mother's Day lunch. I have to say we almost left because of how it looked but stayed because of the reviews and DO NOT regret it at all. This place has the BEST burger I have ever tried. We had the chili fries, the chips and dip(don't remember the name), the chili cheese fries and the PBJ & bacon burger and OMG everything was perfect! I totally recommend this place!

ICFnCu6dIEFC4bhN691Kpg.text: A great True yelp find. I'm from out of state and tried this on a whim, worth every penny. Very good food - enough on the menu if you don't feel like the burger. I had the pulled pork sandwich - amazing! Fast & friendly service as well. Highly recommend.

MJfJk98PuituWnTlhlzA3Q.text: Food is decent. However the waitresses here are worse, even more rude than at Dick's Last Resort, and I don't think that's the theme here. Maybe they call this place "Rehab" because the staff is on drugs?

Gfix30rGkkVm6Tjmeom7dA.text: Heard about this place on Yelp. With all the great reviews I had to try it. Went on a Saturday after spring training. The restaurant is tiny so when it's busy you have to wait a little bit. We only waited five minutes. Got a great waitress who was very down to earth. She offered good recommendations. I ordered the PBJ burger. Kinda crazy. But believe me, it was awesome!  The blend of peanut butter, jelly, bacon, and a sauce was awesome! Messy but tasted wonderful. Then the tater tots are so wonderful. My boyfriend also got a burger of course and loved his! I recommend this highly. Awesome place and the best burgers in town.

yyriA6BtXWALFgno6gFGjw.text: Excellent service and outstanding burgers! Try the PB&J burger with sweet potato tater tots. We'll be back, but probably not on a Sunday.

QHwZm2FxD7A10FsTLIl54g.text: We came here at the tail end of our "Spring Training" trip in Scottsdale. This could not be a better meal to end the trip. My friends and I all got the PB and J Burger because it was similar to the famous Jiffy burger in Chico, Ca and we were not disappointed! It was amazing and the service was great! Wish that we had one of these in SF.

-FnqwhybhpoJ0fXkDw6V1A.text: Seriously the best burger in Phoenix. HUGE portions! It's like two meals in one, so well worth the price. Even on their busiest days the service is fast and friendly. It's in a great location in old town, lots of parking!

K6YTgYgp0Cz1AOdes7s5qA.text: Great food and service. Nicely nested at the back of the Old Town, I guess you have to be in the know to find it! Try the pulled pork. Period. Turns boys to men.

uw7GAD6Tr44HMRgXY62OFA.text: Very cute place. Not large by any means. We got there at 5pm and it was already pretty filled. There was a variety of people from seniors, to college age kids and families with kids. The burgers are AMAZING! (And beautiful to look at, lol.) Did you check out the photos? I had the onion rings as my side and I loved them. My friends and I were extremely happy to find this place and will be back. They have a small outdoor patio for seating as well, and a public parking lot next door which is convenient.

ruIdSOL8r_3cYtALjGGDkg.text: The  servers were friendly and all ,  the  chips and salsa were  pretty good  spiced up  just right,  the burger was present well  but  was very dry,  and not really tasty ,  Id probably come back for a beer or something  but won't overly  impressed with the burgers

lDgxB4LIj3HRcJ_htBaoEQ.text: Amazing burgers! I've tried about 1/2 of their burger menu and NOTHING tops the PBJ, bacon, and shirachi hot sauce! Sounds strange but is incredible. Service is also great, everyone is friendly and welcoming, especially Trisha. Go try this place!

eLSC0kwaw9jii8VCHamOSA.text: Sharyl waited on us and she was friendly and professional. Ordered blue cheese and bacon burger and my hubby ordered the special burger with tortilla bread and he was very satisfied. Will come to try different yummy looking food.

yK-w7AqcBsFNseWSrzN0oQ.text: Don't order the 5oz burger because their buns are the same ones they use for the 10oz burgers. If you like bread order this burger... The bread smothers the burger. Tried the Mushroom Swiss... The tots are good though... The 10oz burgers look good and will give it another try

l-SwDpmWioFFoddXDmeIgQ.text: Best burgers ever, my favorite place. The staff is really nice, relax get a beer order your favorite burger and must try the Jamaican corn

vdfUySEmJu4br5Wmexd6Zw.text: Excellent burgers that are very unique for the menu. Such a "Chill" atmosphere with plenty of bar tables and decent size bar. Perfect place to start and end your happy hour. Andrea is an excellent server and you can tell everyone helps out with the guests. The food is made exactly as I expected and asked the first time!

Qoaup-opQjllVGC3mHUdzw.text: Best Burger ever, and I love the pretzel bun. Great sweet potato tots. They always have great service, and great specials on beer and food.

kzjAvFj2Gl6OGOOmANH_Ww.text: Ok, I don't review often, only either very bad or very good.  I'm sorry, I wanted to like this place, very cool vibe but lets get down to the heart of the matter.  They make burgers.  If you don't care about the quality of the burger and are easily distracted by add ons like poblano peppers, chili, mac and cheese and the like than this may be for you.  For a burger purist...um... no.  This is the second time I gave them a try, I order my double relapse burger medium rare so as to have a little juice and flavor....denied!!  I don't know how they get a burger to be pink inside with absolutely no juice left whatsoever!  I'm serious, I am eating a tasteless dry ass pink burger.  I show my GF as I squeeze the burger on the plate with a fork and.......nothing.  Not a bit of juice, no frigging flavor whatsoever.  This tasteless burger is hiding behind all the bells and whistles of the toppings. If you have to go, just trust me and try a piece of the meat without all the crap and sauce.  Bland, bland, bland.  As for the sides, not terrible, but the gf tater tots came out cold and soggy.  They were replaced with hot ones on request, but really!!!  For $40 plus for a beer, hamburgers and frys for 2, you would think it would be hot and fresh the first time everytime.  If you are looking for cool place to chill have a beer and drop $40-50 bucks on very average burgers, then come on in. Otherwise, check out Cold Beer and Cheesburgers, Smashburger, Habit or any one of a dozen places where you won't feel like you just got hozed and a burger comes out like god intended, pink and juicy.

1ldxm93L9Qe29ZkEZWGMlQ.text: The mac & cheese burger is probably my favorite thing ever!!

u73sZqaFzp-ePtEEbtQuEQ.text: Needed a burger found a burger. Awesome burger and fries cooked perfectly. Full bar, TV for sports and relaxed atmosphere. Our waiter was awesome and food came quick and hot. Go for the pretzel bun!!

KqymAMeM1TBOeww825k6rw.text: Very good food, incredibly friendly, helpful staff! Love this place.

M5F769_wo9GiET1TePlAnQ.text: Live in the neighborhood and this is one of my faves that I frequent.  Burger and tot's joint with a tasty spin on burgers with sweet potatoes, dipping sauces and unbelievable portions.  I've tried the apps (wings are awesome), salads (they all taste great and are massively huge), several of the burgers (all good), and believe it or not...I can eat A LOT but I cannot ever eat the Venice Beach Club sandwich by myself.  Only drawback is they need more space because they get busy and you might have to wait a little during peak times but that's because the food is so awesome.

QQD7P5bNSvdWLPxWPrYDsA.text: This is an update to my previous post.  I strayed from Rehab and tried Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers just up the street.  MAJOR MISTAKE!  It was way over priced, crappy food and nothing special as far as ambiance.  I actually left Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers and went straight to Rehab for desert.   I'll never cheat on you again Rehab!

3dtn5Sb8FzsazCxEk4MwpA.text: Awesome burgers! Gotta try the PBJ, bacon hamburger! Staff was very friendly, manager was awesome! We live in Washington, if we are ever back we are definitely going to this place again!

a5dCuWOaqS9HPvBCKGNw-Q.text: Amazing!!! If you're in the Scottsdale area this place has really good burgers. The Mac and cheese burger with the tater tots was awesome!

-b_yv13jrvvSblxFUkfc8A.text: Great Place, lively atmosphere. I had the mushroom swiss and my date had the healthier turkey burger and salad. Our waitress Cheryl was wonderful and brought us alll the diff sauces to try...my sweet potato tots were delicious with all the diff aoili's and I snuck a taste of the pomegranite vinegarette my date had which was very tasty too.  Hurry and get to Rehab burger to try their delicious menu. Patio misters going full blast if you like to sit outside.

YzUpgDRxBB3sUdwmq1ydeg.text: This is a super fun burger joint with great burgers! There is a burger for everyone here. Atmosphere is cool too. Great location and easy parking with great service. I will be returning.

HawrNqATAfUQJNQ3m_FNSQ.text: Spicy Mac n cheese burger was the BEST ever. I chose the veggie patty option, and it still turned out to be super yummy!

PCMlQXa_gT_p6uisAssPFw.text: This is a great spot for lunch in Scottsdale. It's conveniently located with free public parking next door. We arrived a little before noon on a Friday and the place was already jammed. Definitely worth the wait . Beer at happy hour prices available at lunch was a first for me! The burgers were awesome. The small was pretty sizable and the pretzel roll fresh and delicious. A  crunchy pickle and sweet potato nuggets or fries came with. The nuggets with a pineapple teriyaki aioli were very, very tasty! And the service was great. Our waitress ( from Wisconsin ) was friendly and quick, great combo when your in a hurry!

NBvKFp9Rukia1CwTaXBwMg.text: We have been here twice and both times had really good food and decent service.  It is a small place but never has felt closed in.  When the weather permits they open the front doors to the patio to give it an open feel.  I really like the decor also.  We will be back again!

YK-YoWBXUH9kA6dffejIPw.text: Great atmosphere and great burgers! Afternoon happy hour $1 off drafts. I would highly recommend the BBQ burger and sweet potato tots.

XwKQKDTDARg-je6Af_zmYw.text: This place has a great location right in Old Scottsdale. Cool menu with lots of different options for burgers, salads, etc. Went with the porkster burger, which pretty much says everything. Burger with pulled pork. Delicious.   Really enjoyed the sweet potato tots with the different sauces. Favorite sauce I think was the pineapple teriyaki.  Overall great place to come and get some delicious food in Scottsdale.

GrG5PkK2CljCEXcNgPHCNQ.text: Loved this place ,visiting from California and wish we had one there!! Great burgers and really great service by Rian!! Highly recommend, get the mac & chez burger on pretzel bun !! Insane!!

xwudagYp2k7GUdGntWIlHg.text: What a fantastic restaurant! I am from out of town and continue to come back here as much as possible. The burgers are amazing and giant portions. The best item on the menu is the sweet potato tater tots which are truly unbelievable. Service is great, but there can be a wait unless you get there early.

fKyiNazfl23eEYrBG7jlUw.text: Pretty crappy service for us unfortunately. Came in on a work trip with a couple of my peers(4 total) on a Monday night. Service was awfully slow. We ordered and waited about 30-40 mins for our food. 2 parties came in after us and were both served before us by a large margin of time. Our waitress didn't come check on our drinks or ask how our food was, which was OK at best. She messed up a couple of our burgers by trying to memorize and not write our orders down and that was a bummer because we already waited so long. They weren't busy so I am not sure what the deal was. Maybe she didn't like that we all wanted separate checks, but its a business trip. We're from Vegas so we know how to tip, but she sort of ruined that for herself. Shame when people don't do their jobs and then will complain about a crappy tip.

rIWP185FDD9psYrrfH3Z2A.text: My friend recommended this place! Bartender was great! The Mac and cheese and burger was great! Sweet potato tots were amazing! Have to check this place out!!!

r38YazCGhsUtWHCcGAWKOw.text: Interesting Atmosphere. Good Burgers     Friends had recommended Rehab Burger Therapy some time ago, but when I reviewed the menu online, it didn't hold much appeal for me.
