Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GYucjYB1_qumYt-yypv38A.text: Food was great but the service was even better, completely kid friendly. Atmosphere was awesome food was awesome and I'll def go again!!

5Aj63KOd-0E0yVRxTZ2Zug.text: Best Burger of my life. Hangover relapse. A single patty with cheese, bacon, and fried egg on a pretzel bun.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tKAwQPGoD8yRQ5aGo-gb7w.text: We love rehab burger and eat here every couple months. The staff is nice, great, cool, on top of their game, and everything else positive you can say about a team of servers and bartenders. The food is out-of-this-world good, especially the side sauces and sweet potato tots. I try to have something different each time we go.  I don't know what else to say other than you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you didn't come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. DONUT try to get a bite of this from me!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This was no joke! That limited offer bosa burger is out of this world. Hawaiian burger needs more pineapple.

GlEFaaNY8k7wBdrubXW-YQ.text: Burgers are enormous and delicious. Service was excellent & quick. Definitely coming back. Mac n cheese burger was spectacular!

iOrp9iomU5afHuHN-IMLFg.text: Place to go if your hungry. Huge burgers that are actually cooked to perfection.  Wings were so delicious we could not stop eating them (Smoky BBQ) I love the turkey burger with side salad and rita. This place was a bit challenging to locate but defiantly worth the drive. Our server did a stellar job as we sat on the patio and enjoyed our Labor Day Weekend.  Patio with mist- Dress is casual- Kid Friendly-

xHbCrSMvgE2Yh5YnTwoPvQ.text: Great place for unique and incredibly delicious meals!  I love the jalapeno burgers and the ambience is wonderful.  Very rustic atmosphere and genuinely friendly staff.  It is a place I recommend to everyone who wants a great hearty meal to fill your appetite.   Drinks are great.  Make sure you also try the peanut butter and jelly burger. Outrageous

mQxFXFS0fRSGE2j4Bs-MXA.text: I love Burger Rehab usually. Our experience on July 6 was less than stellar however. It was after 1 when we got there and of course there was a wait. Not unusual but they have no place for you to really wait so we just kind of hovered for more than 30 minutes. We were told we could wait on the patio but it was 110 so I don't think so. The misters were on but the sun umbrellas were not open for whatever reason. The inside temp was probably 90 so I don't suggest going there on a 110 degree day. Our 89 year old friend we took had a hard time standing for that long and no one offered her a chair. After we had been there for 30 minutes someone finally offered us water.   Now for the food. I have been there many times and usually have no complaints but my turkey burger was not good. It was over spiced and the tomatoes, avocado, lettuce and sprouts all dumped in the middle. I had to take it all apart separate the 2 slices of tomato, slice the avocado and place them appropriately on the burger, I just dumped the sprouts because they and the iceberg lettuce just looked disgusting. My bun was dried out on top and sogged on the bottom so much that it was impossible to pick up. I ended up using my fork. My hubby's chicken was fine but the bun was not right on his either.  Now for the service. Definitely subpar and the waitress was rather snotty. When I asked for extra ketchup and mustard she made a sarcastic remark like she was being overburdened.  I still recommend Burger Rehab but wait until it's cooler when they are not all crabby from being too hot.

z3yCDeh1gF4QCs9j0cHqhQ.text: Went to Rehab this past Sunday around 6PM and it was PACKED! I'd been a few years back and I know the burgers were very good so when my friend told me he wanted to try for his first time I was totally IN!  When we arrived we were advised of the 35 minute wait and waited with no problem. The host was a bit snippy so I didn't really appreciate that but I let it go since he was probably overwhelmed. Once we were eventually seated I ordered the Yelp special chips and salsa right away and they took forever to come. Once they arrived we ordered our burgers since the server was often gone for long periods of time. Don't get me wrong, she was extremely nice and efficient I just feel she was too busy. They should've had more servers IMO. Anyway.. the chips and salsa were very good.  Chips tasted fresh and home made and the salsa is as mild and flavorful. I ordered the hatch burger and my friend ordered the backyard BBQ burger. Both were phenomenal and the small side of onion rings set it over the top. All in all it was a great ambiance and very good food. 4 stars for the snippy host and the Fact we had to stay there for 3 hours because the server hardly came around :/.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Backyard BBQ burger  sweet potato  tots.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch burger

BuNoqenomquFm1VGAnsNpg.text: Literally, top 5 best burgers I have ever had.  I had the macaroni and cheese burger with green chile. It was phenomenal. I go back through my pictures on my phone to glance at this burger because I am constantly craving it. Also, my first time having mac and cheese on a burger, and sweet potato tater tots.   I am from New Mexico, so I can't tell you how happy I was to hear that they use green chile from Hatch, NM! The burger was cooked perfect, the mac and cheese was amazing, and the green chile had a nice kick. I was pretty determined to finish the entire meal, but ended up only eating about half (Yes, I took the rest to-go and finished it later). Service was great, I believe our server's name was Lauren, or "Lo" - she was awesome. Probably some of the best service I have experienced in a long time. She was super attentive, always filled our water cups quick (it was hot), and made great suggestions. We didn't have to wait for a table either, and we went on a Friday night around 7pm. I think I will make the drive to Scottsdale specifically for this burger.

q3-n6iZzVeF5grw7mqcV9g.text: Holy Dirty word Batman!  These burgers were amazing.  I had the PB and J Burger and I loved it!  I wasn't sure what I was getting into but it was worth every bit. They had a great beer selection and the atmosphere was laid back Marly Style. I highly recommend it!  The guy next to me had the macaroni burger and was in heaven.  He was making A lot of obscene noises rivaling that of "when Harry Met Sally"'s famous Diner scene.  Definite stop when your hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Another view of the PB and J burger!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The PB and J Burger with Sweet Potato tots

vnihkTuJubn0mZLEM8Hppg.text: Rian the bartender ROCKS, "Serious Mike" seems cool too! My husband and I are new to the area and this was our first time here. Had a few drinks at the bar and onion rings, YUM!! will be back for sure. Thanks Rian and "Serious Mike" for a fun time!!!

tQzDwNR8ZAz7rqJuGDJXlQ.text: Like to switch up your burgers? You've come to the right place. PBNJ burger? Jalapeno popper burger? Need I say more? OK, Ghost pepper burger was my choice and let me tell you...it was superb!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ghost pepper burger and a cold IPA!!!

M_3CzpirricEl9RHUE9elQ.text: It would be silly for me NOT to give this place 5 stars!  My husband and I decided to spend the day in old town Scottsdale, when we chose to eat lunch at this local gem. We walked in and were greeted right away, and seated. The place was moderately busy. Our waiter Ryan was over right away, with a great personality and a big smile. He took our drink orders, and gave us time to look over our menus. They have two sizes of burgers to choose from Rehab is the bigger one, and relapse is the smaller one. I chose the relapse Hawaiian burger. It came with pineapple slice, ham slice, cheese, sweet mayo, and I chose a gluten-free bun. I chose the sweet potato tots for my side. Our good came out in a reasonable amount of time, and was delicious! My burger was cooked perfectly, and the sweet potato tots were very good. We started with the chips and salsa, as they were only $3.99 with the check in offer! The chips were homemade as well as the salsa and both very good. Ryan made sure our drinks were never empty. The decor is beachy, and there is ample seating inside, and outside on the patio. They have a bar. I can not wait to stop by here again to try another 5 star burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hawaiian burger with gluten free bun and sweet potato tots.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside wall decor.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade chips and salsa.

tuMTTZlnDD-NEusvM577rA.text: Great burgers in a laid back atmosphere.  The burgers are creative - we ordered the Spicy Mac-and-Cheese burger and the Jalapeno burger both of which were cooked to perfection.  The burgers come either in 5oz or 10oz sizes - we got both in the 10oz, which was a bit much for lunch - would recommend the 5oz unless your really hungry.  The fries are good - but would suggest substituting for the sweet potato tater tots.  They come with an aioli dipping sauce which is a nice combination.

NuGuHQBOHDYrHE376_gU4Q.text: Can't miss the sweet potato tots, onion rings, Mac 'n cheese & the Hawaiian burger. Definitely the best place for burgers and all the fixings

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lwrn57d_nlNl-bWDC88U_Q.text: The best burger everrrrr.... had slices of ribeye on my burger for the first time ...and it was amazing. Got my Philly cheesesteak and burger craving all in one. By far one of the best places for a burger

cVMBnqTtg8chkZJj6jZpWg.text: Thanks to a Yelp search of "fries" after drinks along 2nd Street, my fiance and I stopped in to RBT for wings and fries, and they hit the spot! We were cutting it close to when the kitchen was closing so we appreciated that they were willing and able to take a late night eats order for us :)

HnHTVdsjpefocvy0SJjPRw.text: Rehab fully embraces the idea that fried foods play a critical role in comforting society from hangovers and bad days. I showed up because Pig & Pickle had a gas leak, and quickly scanned Yelp for an alternative.  Rehab lets you throw a veggie patty, or any patty (turkey, chicken, etc.), on any burger. So the menu felt expansive. Look closely enough at the huge menu and you'll find endless puns about rehab.   The ghost burger wasn't spicy. Maybe because it used "ghost pepper jack cheese" instead ghost peppers. I'm not even sure what that is. The "relapse" (two patties) was too much patty; I'll put that one on me.   But the patties themselves were not so great, which was disappointing because the menu called it hand pressed. The guacamole was a disaster, too, emblematic of the American avocado craze gone too far. I only finished about a quarter of my burger before calling it quits.   I will say that the bun was decent and the sweet potato tots were worth the upgrade.  My favorite part of the night was when I was talking with my friend about kids while eating at the bar. A complete stranger waiting at the bar looked over and said, "Whoa man you don't want kids. See that girl over there? I knocked her up and now I gotta support her, and she isn't even that hot." I looked over at him, then down at my burger, uncertain how to respond. I guess burgers and alcohol bring out the honesty in people. It also made me realize that Rehab was probably more bar than burger.  The service was pretty slow . One bartender had to manage fifteen people's food orders, plus all the drinks for the restaurant. I felt bad for him; he was certainly overworked.  If I come back, I'll take the burger into my own hands. I expect to request some toppings combination of fresh jalapeno, onion rings, BBQ sauce, extra ghost pepper jack cheese, hot sauce, etc. Maybe that will do the trick.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ghost burger with veggie patties and sweet potato tots

XuJOOPQLSBV-0dFl5Zmpdg.text: This place was great. The burger that I had was delicious, and it was a great price for a 10 ounce burger. The fries were too lemony for me, but other people seemed to love them. Overall, the vibe was great, and the food was spectacular.

dNkVj5HaKcmsD4oCjVxPQA.text: Great is followed by burgers, sides, service, menu, and decor!!  I can't wait for the Tempe location to open near my work!!! It is called Rehab, but it is addicting!

VTNQK4unW9RZ_n91PBPVZA.text: Came here last weekend with some family and friends.  We were surprising someone who didn't know we were in town, and the staff was more than willing to help us surprise this person.  Besides the staff being really helpful and hilariously playing along with our prank, the food is soooo good.  We had a side of chips/guac for an app, we felt the side of guac was a little small, but we are all from Cali, so maybe we are just spoiled.  3 of us had the BBQ burger, which was delicious, and very very filling.  We would definitely come back if we are in town again.

E9RhQ3AuVlqht6h6yoQL7w.text: GO HERE!!!  Great vibe, great veggie bean burger you can change the toppings on to any of the regular veggie options.  I love this place, the bar is great. bartender is nice! Thanks girl

__oj05fhNsf2BMTWOTDjmw.text: I have only been here once, but will surely be back! I'd be a regular if I lived or worked in the area. I can't remember what my burger was called, but it was the one with blue cheese. When someone orders a blue cheese burger, it's because they LOVE blue cheese and lots of it. This one did not disappoint in any way, shape or form! I wanted to cry over not being able to finish it from lack of stomach space (I tried really hard though). The sweet potato tots were really good with the pineapple sauce. I also had a VERY generous "Mike Tai" (their spin on the Mai Tai). I love it when a place gives you a drink you can feel! The service was outstanding and it seemed the owners were there working too (I can usually tell). They clearly have a lot of pride in their restaurant.  Now that the review of MY awesome experience is over with, I will say that my boyfriend's burger wasn't as good. He was a huge fan of this place already, so it's no big deal, BUT... the waitress that talks up the PB&J burger really should stop (I'm not the only Yelper who thinks so). Some things are an aquired taste. I love Braunschweiger but that doesn't mean I'd recommend it to everyone. The PB&J burger SOUNDED intriguing, but it just did not work for him. He really didn't like it at all and neither did I (of course I tried it!). It was also incredibly messy.

ft4RWgHSPnfP-dEXkBOTbw.text: Love this place!!!!!! awesome food especially if youre hungover...

P_4lIm-vDBtyfaqdOLmWvw.text: Great atmosphere, you just feel cool when you're there. Must get the PB&J, bacon burger on pretzel bun. BEST BURGER EVER! just go for it.

sxtw4ux4s35ahxJQUW2ZEg.text: I love this burger place. When I tell people about the menu they give me a look like I'm somewhat crazy but I have tried at least 6 of the specialty burgers on the menu and they have not failed me at all. Especially the PB&J burger. From the peanut butter n jelly to the Sriracha sauce. It just works. The service is always good, beer n alcohol choices are good and the bucket of jawbreakers on the way out is just an added plus. Definitely a good spot to grab a burger n a beer

T754t0HCVNK_Z5XMF_XSPg.text: Truly the best restaurant i've been to thus far since moving out to AZ two months ago. I got the pulled pork sandwich & it was not a normal pulled pork. The flavoring/sauce was SO GOOD. And the portions are huge! My boyfriend got the barbecue burger and he said it was one of the best burgers he's ever had.  The decor, music, & overall vibe was what really got me hooked though. I'm into the whole surfing/beach life so finding a place like this in the middle of the desert is beyond perfect. I will definitely be back!

1p_lsYeGgp81sMf6NPFb8Q.text: Ghost burger all the way. Hit the spot. Onion rings are deceivingly filling. This place belongs in Tempe, but I'm not complaining. Good food, friendly staff and chill atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vtM3m-sxLq3A2HF4ysiToA.text: Great food but the ac must not work. Sweating while eating is no bueno. Wont go back till winter for sure. Veggie burger was ok should not deep fry it. Corn on the cob was super but that's about all

CL5D13_IVYwoQS3Otyh9xQ.text: I went there for dinner with a coworker.  The waitress was very friendly and got use hooked up with her favorite items on menu.    I highly recommed the burger with pineapple abd my coworker recommends the pablano pepper burger.  Fries and tots were really good.    They even disclaimer that their portions are large.  They were right.  Highly recommend this place to anyone.  Save room for dessert.

OG9SnnhzVRkWw6AP_VnuRQ.text: Loaded drinks, great service,  super friendly staff... burger hit the spot... stop by for some R&R

PwBDYvJau5PihJZqcFsbTQ.text: A good burger is hard to find - Flannery O'Connor  Okay, O'Connor didn't say this. . . but if she had Rehab Burger then I am pretty sure literature would be a bit different.  A co-worker and I decided to give Rehab a try after I read a few reviews. One thing about me: burgers are something I crave, not necessarily a frequent on my to-eat list.  My friend ordered the Porkster and I ordered the Hangover.      1)  Each burger patty was seasoned to perfection.      2)  The chef understood what a medium burger should be and it was perfect     3)  The Porkster was great if you really enjoy meats. To be honest, I could have had             the pulled pork alone. The burger patty was just more awesome under a bun      4) The Hangover was devoured by my co-worker (we split our burger in halves and              shared) but I felt like something was missing. I would have preferred to have                 some sort of spicy...something on it . . .or a bit more cheese. Next time, I'll think               about the sauces they provide and request something different.        5) Order the sweet potato fries and make sure they give this white sauce to dip            'em. I am pretty sure that sauce is made from love and a dash of Heaven.  We arrived before the restaurant started pouring in with customers (around noon) so if you're wanting a quick in and out lunch, I am not so sure this is the place.  All around you get what you pay for. I couldn't finish half of my Rehab burger and had a lot of Tots left over. Go there and expect to be satisfied!

MZx2EfUGtVcZQtvDEuAIhw.text: Delicious!! Back yard  BBQ burger , bloody  Mary was on point! And the Jalapeno Popper Burger!! Mmm..

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. And I finished the whole thing!!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Back Yard BBQ Burger!! Delicious!! Every 10oz. Of it!!

ZHYz_os_oUi11vka30B8Cw.text: Great service! They seated our party of 8 with care. Took our toddler's order first. Great service! We ordered a different burger and all were great. Hit of the table was the PBJ, which was delicious. I have no idea why it works... But it does. Order with tots and Chipotle sauce and you won't be disappointed! Only downside was the crowd noise. You literally cannot hear what the people on the other side of the table are saying. Probably best for younger crowds as we had varied generations with us. Overall great food and good service.

7sRsqNgTZo3C-FOesBal4w.text: Best burgers in town.  PB&J burger is outstanding - you've gotta try it!!  Always busy and for good reason.

tZ7g8wYb_giaxmySZ5VFaw.text: This place is bomb.com! So good and so many varieties. I never thought a burger with peanut butter and jelly would be a good thing but it is absolutely delish! Great service as well. It is always packed so there is sometimes a little wait but nothing too crazy. The spicy Mac and cheese burger is to die for....best, creamy, cheesey mac and cheese I have ever eaten.

apzgMUR798BGnLOyI7J5Ag.text: Went on a Thursday at lunch. Place was busy and it's not that big. Service started out a little slow, but our waiter fixed that by the end of the meal. The Chili con Fritos was a good start. All the burgers were good and the hot dog my daughter got was the best hot dog my wife had ever tasted. Overall a good place to go and get adventurous with your burger.

iTC95-98E-PT66ZSBYc5KA.text: The service was great. Our server Caylee was very pleasant and really knew the menu well. You could really tell she loved her workplace.  The food was fantastic. All 3 of my friends were really happy with their food also. I will definitely be coming back soon.  Best burger ive had in a long time!

xZWiK_7h05EZzJ8p-XUqjA.text: In town for a conference and a coworker had this place recommended to them. All I can say is I was glad we went!!  Had a choice between 5oz and 10oz burger. Went with 10oz cheddar hickory bacon burger and loved every bite. 5oz would have been enough but double the size for a few pennies more  And our server, Lauren, was the best!!  Ask for Lauren and make your stay in Scottsdale worth the time away from home!

WicZF-1z6lpjF-8fPSA4Pw.text: Got the hatch chili burger on a pretzel bun. SO GOOD. It's all about their pretzel buns for sure.

b3MlfzMZPdksoZ5Li9LYwg.text: Needed a "dog friendly" restaurant in the area after a vet appointment and they certainly did not disappoint!  Easy parking right next door, fun and quirky atmosphere, and EXCELLENT food with huge servings.  The pulled pork burger was amazing- even with us both working on it there was no finishing that sucker!  The service was very friendly and went above and beyond to make my pup feel welcome.  My boyfriend and I will be adding this place to our regular date night rotation!

oAvFRr0NsxcOhE6Sw1CBjw.text: You probably have to be a lover of red meat to fully appreciate all that Rehab Burger Therapy offers.  I do not fit into that category but I'm a fan, nonetheless.  They have a pretty tasty turkey burger.  When you add all the 'fixin's', some fries and an ice cold beer; it makes for a darn good meal!  What stands out even more than the food, in my opinion, is the service.  I can't recall having more genuinely friendly service.  John is awesome and made sure I was well taken care of during my visit; however, everyone in the vicinity greeted me warmly and chatted me up as I ate.  I appreciated that, as I dined alone at the bar.    The menu has a variety of items that sound tempting.  It is definitely worth a return visit.

W8XZzp1EbKErg_9NOQIW-g.text: Great sized burgers, large Dr. Pepper drinks, and pretty good fries.

3qsDUXtsXnP1w8DdXP57XQ.text: Gotta tell ya....every single time I go to Rehab Burger Therapy, I'm thrilled with my decision to go back.  From the laid-back and welcoming atmosphere; to the delicious burgers (can't find one that my friends or I don't like), to the great wait-staff (Megan was our awesome waitress on my most recent visit).....RBT is the kind of gastronomic and dining therapy I want over and over again.    IMHO: this is the best burger place in the Valley of the Sun.

BXK44URryB-yJXPsGRufWQ.text: Great service but we were unhappy that the burgers did not live up to the Yelp hype.  They were dry and dense, you could tell they took the meat and used a machine to compress it into shape rather than hand forming the patties. Also practically had a whole head of lettuce on my burger. Beer choices were pretty pathetic and dominated by the big brands while ignoring local craft beers (sorry Four Peaks does not qualify as craft anymore since they are owned by Budweiser.)

eOy8Im-_8JV6DI9UKZ4tMA.text: Really good burger joints are few and far between and sometimes places try to mask their food quality with great service and a cool atmosphere experience. Old town Scottsdale has a gem in their midst that delivers on all three! These guys are not posers! They know burgers! I had the relapse (5oz party) hangover burger with bacon, fried egg and green chili peppers and a side of sweet potato tater tots. Almost worth killing for! Can't wait to go back into Rehab!

cPxHlzI7npWb9X7TljO7vw.text: My boyfriend and I are regulars here and we LOVE it!!! Denise, one of the owners, is amazeballs! She's always smiling and making sure everyone's experience is a perfect one. I love the vibe! I forget that I'm in the middle of the desert when I step indoors because it feels like I'm on a vacation at the beach. Rumor has it they're opening another location on Mill Ave in Tempe... I wish them all the success there that they've seen in Scottsdale. The place is always packed and I love seeing small, creative business owners succeed! Oh yah, almost forgot... The food is awesome!

M-FF6jWNzAyraVOBmQqk_A.text: Where to start? The food is absolutely incredible. Pig wings and calamari are my faves from the ap menu. Chili is the name of the game of the burgers whether its the chili cheese burger, poblano, or hatch you can't go wrong. Fish tacos (not on the menu) are huge and tasty! Milkshakes (virgin or not) will hit that sweet spot.  What really separates this place from any other spot around town is the level of service. Ownership roams the floor greeting and conversing with customers. Nothing fake about it either. Wait staff is highly personable and the bartenders are friendly, knowledgeable and quick with a suggestion.  If you haven't checked out Rehab Burger Therapy yet, you are missing out!

fHGMaIUjVEZlY1qSnHa-pQ.text: Was looking for a place to eat, since we were in town for a baseball tournament. Stopped here because of the Yelp reviews. I liked the decor of the place, laid back, surf atmosphere. We got a table rather quickly outside, with heat lamps. The guy that helped us was really nice kept checking on us to make sure we were ok.  Our waitress came and was telling us since it was Sunday they were out of alot of stuff. Not a big deal. We ordered 2 appetizers and only received one. We didn't say anything figured food will be out soon so we'll just wait. WRONG! Don't get me wrong she was nice but slow as dirt! The place wasn't crowded at all. She never came to refill our drinks, the nice man that sat us down was the one checking on us. He even said good burgers but the customer service was crap.  The Burgers were just ok, nothing that would make me want to come back. Maybe if we came back when they had everything in stock, but the customer service tells me otherwise thanks but no thanks.

MHavWytr4z3_BzusT98VoA.text: The service was a little slow at first. I wasn't impressed with the burger. I was disappointed we drove 40 mins when we have better burgers closer to home. Will not be returning.

bZyfvbv-aUxmaWTSGSS5zA.text: As far as California surf town joints go, I am a fan!  This location creates the complete surf town ambiance with its beach cruisers, surf boards, and flat panels with aquariums and beach scenes.  You can expect to find bar food here such as chicken wings and chili cheese fries.  And of course there are the burgers.  You can choose from about a dozen burgers, as well as the ability to build your own.  You also have the option of a "rehab" and "relapse" size.  The smaller of the two, happens to be the perfect size and portion.  Rehab offers a variety of unique dipping sauces, such as their pineapple aoli, chipotle ranch, habanero ketchup, sweet habanero, and their stone ground mustard.  The pineapple aoli is perfect with the sweet potato tots, the mustard outstanding with the burgers because it has a very mellow sweet and tart flavor.  I ordered my burger medium rare, and it was cooked to perfection.  Despite the restaurant being quite busy, food and drink orders were delivered very quickly.  All food tasted fresh and made to order, and temperatures of the cooked foods were perfect.  There were other options on the menu such as sandwiches and pasta, even smaller portions for kiddos - but this definitely is a burger joint.  With the average burger costing $7.50 for a small and $10.50 for a larger version, the prices are very competitive with other burger joints.  This place can become your local hangout with weekly specials such as thirsty Thursdays where domestic pints are $2 and premiums are $3 as well as $4 drink specials and a dollar off on appetizers.  Furthermore, Happy Hour is 7 days week, until 6p.  You don't get huge savings on the appetizers, but you can definitely drink on a budget here.

MbzjBKeVZXHoojwoS5g9iA.text: Great food! Love this place!!!i i do not eat meat but my family does! The veggie burger is amazing! The dipping sauces are amazing. The sweet potato tater tots are amazing! We all love our food every time we eat here.

ceRPNMy8myBMY93QxK58Nw.text: I've been to Rehab (the restaurant!) several times since they opened and have left happy and full each time. The place is very cute and relaxed with a beach and surfing theme. Every server we've ever had was excellent and attentive.  I've tried a variety of items of the menu:  * Hawaiian Burger  - It was tasty, but the slab of Ham on the burger was a bit much for me. Personal preference thing.  * Veggie Noogie Sammy - I incorrectly thought this would be similar to Oregano's Veggie Wedgie. It is not, but that doesn't mean it isn't good.   * Shelby's Shpinach Salad - This is my favorite with or without the grilled chicken breast on top. I love that you can get the mini size of this salad w/o chicken for only $5. It is a steal!  I've also tried the onion rings, french fries, and sweet potato tots. The tots are where it is at!  Most everything on the menu comes in two sizes - Rehab (small) and Relapse (huge). Even the small size is really big if you don't normally eat big portions. Be forewarned!

ZM8Iyul1ubFlI6p8mFv5ZA.text: Met a friend there early evening. The margarita I had was  great, but a bit sweet. Similar to the Belini at Oregano's.  Great veggie burger. Got part of my order wrong but i didn't mention that as it was only the bread and I didn't care. Was very warm and dark inside. Temperature outside was 110 so the AC might have been strained. Hard to find home made veggie burgers so for that reason I would go back if i were in the area. Server was great and did not hover. Fun place to go in cooler weather to sit on patio. We got there early so there was no wait, but by the time we left, the line was out the door. Not sure it would be worth the wait but it was definitely good enough to try again.

2PJVoW6AjFZE7LMITJ4w7Q.text: We went to Rehab for a late lunch today and while it started out with good intentions, in the end we were extremely disappointed. On the bright side, I loved the decor. It's very well done with the surfer vibe and the sweet potato tots are some of the best I've had.   The real issues were coming out of the kitchen. As I was people watching, I noticed tables coming in. I also noticed table by table, food was coming out for them before ours. Shortly after we ordered our second round of drinks smoke did fill the small restaurant and we made jokes about our food being on fire, so we chalked it up to our order actually being the cause of the smoke. It was a late lunch so by this time it was past well past 1 p.m. Our server cruised by and said we were waiting on the wings one of us ordered.  Finally the food arrived and it couldn't have been the wings, since they were cold. Both burgers had burned pretzel buns, and one side of tots was half a serving of cold tots. The server said he would bring more, then never returned. The restaurant was quite busy, so we took matter in our own hands and asked someone to bring the tots and fill our drinks, but the burgers weren't great. We ate them anyway because at this point we were just so hungry!  Finally we were waiting for our check to be split and who I assumed is the manager came by our table and asked how it was. We were honest and told him it wasn't great. He arrogantly replied "Not great? But you ate all your food" I looked at him and said "Yeah because I waited a long time for my food while all these tables who came in after us were served their meals" It was ridiculous, I watched many of those tables leave as well while we were dealing with our tab.   He pressed the issue, even though we didn't want to get into it because a) it seemed petty and b) we just wanted to leave, but he insisted . We told him our issues with the meal and 10 min later he returned with the food removed off the menu. The weirdest thing was his delivery. He pinned the checks on the table facing us so we could read it, and goes, "How are we doing this" holding our cards in his hand. I  pointed to my check and said "I'm the blue card, so that's mine" He just stared at me. I repeated, "I'm the blue card" and reached over to pull the card out of his grip, and he goes, "Okay, so the $2 on the blue card and the $6 on the red card"   It was sooo rude. His demeanor was that we were being ungrateful, when we honestly just wanted to leave. When he returned he was full of excuses, (we're a new restaurant, we are very busy, etc.) which is FINE. I eat out all the time, and new restaurants all the time, and I expect growing pains, so I told him I liked the place, I would be back to watch a game, grab a drink. He replied, "Well we are not a bar with good food. We are a restaurant with good drinks."   What the hell? First of all, I wasn't even drinking, so I was just trying to be NICE. Thanks for not taking our constructive criticism YOU ASKED FOR then making us feel BAD about the discount you gave us that we weren't looking for. It was such a turn off, we talked about it the whole ride home and all day I've been telling people what a nightmare it was when they asked me about it due to me checking in on social media  So I lied to the manager... I won't be back. There are plenty of other mediocre burger shops around town that I can give my business to, and if I do end up there again, I'll be ordering the wings and tots. Their burgers are average. For a place with BURGER in the name, there is just absolutely nothing special about their signature menu item. Shoulda gone to In N Out.

VJS1TA7Zpj_ib3AoBv0jPw.text: Rehab is reliable and consistent. Great, tenured staff, always delicious food, and the most relaxed, fun atmosphere. Definitely our favorite burger place in Arizona. Try the PB&J burger-- you won't be disappointed!

VmpD8DKWca2dUbw7ozMA3Q.text: This is my husband favorite place to eat when we fly into AZ. This visit didn't disappoint. The place was packed mid afternoon but the wait wasn't long. Took a while for our server to actually get to us but the sun was shining and we soaked up the heat from our seats on the patio. We had the mac and cheese with our P&J burger: delicious!

XdfC7x5OvKnhzNnzIlHoWw.text: Amazing burgers!! Saw this place on yelp and went there for date night and it was awesome! I got the bacon cheeseburger and my boyfriend got the porkster burger and they were both phenomenal! The bacon was so good & the pork on his burger was absolutely delicious and the perfect hint of spicy! Can't wait to go back soon! Definitely recommend this place!!!!

mcfihZF-UuT6DXibhZyNrg.text: Not impressed. I ordered the turkey burger - which I guess, who does that at a burger joint - but I was looking for something semi-healthy, and a good turkey burger done right is pretty good! This patty was rubbery, garbage meat from Frozen Foods of America straight off the truck. To cover it up, they used a pound of shredded cafeteria iceberg lettuce. Woof. Although the portions are big, I'd rather have smaller, better quality. In addition to the crappy food, we had a crappy service. We were a party of 8, so larger table and I get that. But it took an hour (literally) for the server to take our order- after I had to go tell the hostess we were ready to order (also, they weren't busy on a Tuesday night at 7pm). And it took an hour (literally) for our food to come to the table. The atmosphere is fun, and the menu items sounded good, but I don't know that I'd go back. Not even to try the PB&J burger!

YpaFP9JmdbpX812ZCXYNXQ.text: Came here for the first time. Service wasn't that great.   They do have happy hour everyday from 11am-6pm & Thursday from 11am-close.   If you check in on yelp you can get chips & salsa for $3.99. The salsa was spicy. Not the greatest chips & salsa.   I also got onion rings and they are pretty huge, I think there's about 9 pieces. They were okay. Also we got 2 order of wings with 12 pieces medium style. The wings were amazing! They were huge & delicious! Also it comes with carrots.   We mostly got build your own burger. They put the mayo, mustard & bacon on the side so you need to put it on yourself. The burgers you can choose 5oz(relapse) or 10oz(rehab). I got the 5oz and it's pretty thick. Also don't forget to add cheese, it's really good and delicious. They also have sweet potato tater tots or fries to choose from. Also you get to choose your bun either white, wheat, pretzel bun or lettuce wrap.

Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

n-NLcAPrJeKO6OjGlxWCTg.text: We arrived around 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday evening to an understandably very busy restaurant.  We waited about 20 minutes for a table for three, which we thought was acceptable.  We were seated on the patio, which was okay for a couple of minutes.  There is a large "waiting for a table" area on the patio that became a major pain for us.  The first large group to invade our space was a posse of drunk young ladies.  They were loud, obnoxious, and annoying.  They finally move on after 15-20 minutes.  We greatly enjoyed the next three minutes without big mouths.  Next up is a large group of rather intense individuals who made the inebriated girls look like a group of librarians.  At least 30+ minutes of this pretty much ruined our meal as well as many others on the patio.  Obvious suggestion to this establishment's management: get this waiting area off the patio where people are trying to dine.  People who are hungry and are waiting on a table are oil and water with people who are trying to enjoy their food.  Our waitress, who may have been the best waitress I have had (no kidding) shows up promptly and takes our order.  We go with the following items: -Chips and salsa.  Ssssoooo very, very good.  The seasoning on the chips was killer. -My wife had a turkey burger that was similar to a Big Mac, I believe it was called the "Mac Gnarly Burger".  She didn't find it "gnarly" at all, and stated it was just okay.  She also had sweet potato tater tots, which she absolutely loved and a margarita which she thought was solid. -I wasn't very hungry and just had some chili cheese fries, which were about what you would expect (just average). -My son had the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese burger (he was a fan).  The burger had pepper jack cheese, mac-n-cheese, several different peppers, and bacon.    The restaurant felt very touristy to me, which I didn't care for.  The food was a mixed bag - some very good, some very average.  Our waitress was the high point of our meal, and damned if I can't remember her name.  She deserves a serious shoutout that I am unable to provide (what a loser I am).  Not a terrible experience, but not a place I would visit again when in the area this coming winter.  As packed as they were, and all the stellar Yelp reviews, I'm sure they will get along just fine with my $50.  Worth checking out if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The spicy mac-n-cheese burger - very good
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The not gnarly &#34;Mac Gnarly Burger&#34;
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chili Cheese Fries - Okay

02135fQ4U95D8UtSeNZL0g.text: If you just want a good burger, this is the place to go. I like the Mac Gnarly (their version of a big mac). Be prepared to make a mess, but it's so worth it.

N2xXoORe3fLP0qDawb3-AQ.text: This is still one of my favorite burger bars!  We forgot it was spring training season, so it was packed and the servers were hustling.   My husband and I are hooked on the pig wings - small, meaty riblets with yummy sauce.  Makes a great appetizer when you are hungry.   I love that they offer two size patties for your burger. I got the big patty on the Backyard bbq burger and shared with my sister. The variety of burgers is amazing and you can customize anything. I love their pretzel buns, sweet potato tots, and sauces!   They know how to prepare burgers, but their sandwiches and salads are fabulous!  And tots - you must get the tots!

y974D7eZjSpwO2EDN9YSsQ.text: Went here for dinner day before yesterday because to be honest - we really wanted some burgers!! This place was a lot smaller than I expected & when we arrived it was very packed. We were told to wait or go to the bar. Since we didn't feel like waiting we ended up sitting at the bar.  Once seated we tried the following:  * spicy Mac n cheese burger - definitely a burger I haven't tried before, and I liked it. The interesting thing about this burger was the Mac n cheese which I noticed wasn't made of the normal cheddar cheese but more like a jalapeno cheddar cheese  * poblano burger - if you like a kick of spicy but not something TOO spicy then this is a burger that's good for you! Overall I enjoyed this burger thoroughly. This dish came with a side of the sweet potato tots and gosh those were amazing!!  * Beer - I cant remember which beer we got but it was one of the four peaks one. Also really enjoyed this as well!  Overall good place to grab some burgers

NUeaxncr05jdN1xiETWLtg.text: Like so many other reviewers, the burgers here are bomb! The burgers definitely stand out and are memorable. We love the spicy Mac and cheese burger on the pretzel bun. It's super tasty but it's the kind of burger you have to eat with a fork and knife, lol (not a problem for me).   The reason I'm giving the Scottsdale location 4 stars is because EVERY time we've ever gone it seems like they have the AC set to 85 degrees or maybe it's off completely. There's fans but I don't think they do anything other than look good. To me, the environment in which I'm eating has to be comfortable and this one is VERY warm. It's pretty annoying trying to eat a hot meal and feeling all sweaty at the same time.

0Y85TGgzDSh0n04n9YgxTw.text: Definitely good and a place I want to come back to for my burger cravings! The highlight was the PB& J burger. HOLY COW. I couldn't commit to it when the menu was crawling w other delicious options, but when I tried a bite of my friend's, I immediately regret not getting it myself. Highly recommend if you like peanut butter and meat. If you've not tried the combo but meet the aforementioned sentence requirement, do it.   I got the hangover burger and it was ok. Definitely yummy but nothing mind blowing. If I'm not getting the PB &J burger, I wanna try the Mac n cheese burger! This place has got a lot going on, making it a fun place to come back to!  Oh and the sauces are BOMB! try a bunch! And mix your tots and fries for more variety. You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EPcVgU4ZbZodsriVHaDknQ.text: WOW! The review is already good on Yelp but to actually experience it yourself....AMAZE-BALLS!! I got the PB & J burger so prepare to get messy but it's so juicy. The jelly doesn't over power the burger with its sweetness. The sriracha gives it a little kick and bacon on any burger makes it 10x better. We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J burger with sweet potato tots.

CgbztdmiwbKImIVvpFDG4g.text: I have been to Scottsdale a few times before and my family always raves about this place. After seeing that they offered veggie burgers my girlfriend and I decided to go while we were in AZ for the weekend. We went in the late afternoon and there was a 15 minute wait. From what I've heard a wait here is almost always the case. We sat down and were served quickly. We ordered two coronaritas which were awesome and refreshing. I had the Mac gnarly burger and she had the spicy Mac burger with a veggie Patty. Words cannot describe these burgers so let the pics speak for themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac gnarly
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy mac w/ sweet potato tots

r8OsNr9iPtzSGUwZlWXTaQ.text: Friendly environment  Service and food amazing!  I loved how they can adjust your food options  The burgers are amazing creations, a lot to chose from.  Don't forget to try The sweet potatoes tots with the variety of dressings. The pineapple dressing it's delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. DELICIOUS! Salad WARNING it&#39;s spicy - Rodrigo Da Vinci-  Spicy chicken- tortilla chips, Cream, Cheese, roasted chipotle peppers.

jpqcCcXR0d6L_ORIIRhFlw.text: Food was DELICIOUS and price was definitely reasonable. My only complaint is on the employees.  Immediately after making our orders, we wanted to make one adjustment and so I approached the cashiers area which had like 4 girls working and asked them that I need to make an adjustment to an order that was already made. None of these 4 employees offered to help me or even asked what my request was which was so small and could've been so quickly and easily. Instead, one of them said she would go find my waiter. 10 minutes after, I approached the same woman again and asked if anyone was going to help us and verbally explained to her that I'm hoping to make this adjustment before our orders are already completed for both our and the kitchen's convenience. Without any drop of consideration, she rishingly said "Yeah, he's coming." Another 10 minutes later, we see our waiter finally coming out with our PREPARED ORDERS. I questioned whether he was told that I requested to make an adjustment and he said no one told him anything. I was so thrown off. Even though this guys was nice and approachable, he himself did not show any understanding or apology for his coworker who lied to us and made us wait for no reason. Instead, he nonchalantly said he will be back with the adjusted order, which only made us wait longer and made the rest of our food get colder. Afterwards, we both realized that our orders were made incorrectly - they had out incorrect toppings in our burgers. When we brought this to his attention, he simply got a side of the correct tipping and put it in a sauce cup for us. This was just annoying because it resulted in us fingering the wrong toppings out of our already prepared burgers, then refilling them with the right ones that were later given us a side instead. Definitely didn't pay to do that and neither were WE getting paid to do these workers' jobs. It sucks that at restaurants where food is so great, you actually end up having a negative experience because of the poor customer service provided by employees representing these places.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BYOB with sweet potato tots

tkw1eVqONDDzAQEI2-GQtQ.text: I'm selecting a 1 star because I'm a regular, I come in all the time, you are charging me 2 bucks to use my card?!? Absolutely not!! This is so dumb! I understand for a tab or something like that, but I ain't opening no tab. This is needs to stop ASAP! You don't even warn people it's just on my bill. Also I had a horrible interaction with Kass I believe is her name, she doesn't know I'm a regular but you should treat everyone like a regular.

50zdO3-_9BZu6K-KP0IkeQ.text: My burger was the bomb! Fries were tasty, beer was cold. Service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was comfortable. Will definitely go back!

BZcwl8-D1oUxvGg3ZuSNhA.text: Nothing like we thought! Disappointed! We got the Mac and cheese burger and it was completely BLAND!! Zero taste won't be going back.  Gave it a 2 star because the sweet potato tots and dipping sauce was pretty tasty.  Wanted to slather my burger in the tot sauce so it could have some taste buttttt didn't nearly have enough and they charge for sauces (sucked). Damn did it look good (pic) but tasted mmmmm didn't taste like anything lol who screws up Mac and cheese????

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Looks yum but it&#39;s really deceiving lol

WTFItqGPrcgBVGAUB6HvFQ.text: We highly recommend Rehab Burger Scottsdale. The service was excellent. The happy hour for beer was good. We LOVED the corn on the cob. Definitely splurge for it. We ordered the hatch chile burgers with no cheese. We highly recommend them. The fries had a unique seasoning that made them delicious. They have all kinds of funky burgers and wings. Their top seller is the peanut butter and jelly burger. Put this place on your must stop list if in Old Town Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch Chile burger with seasoned fries sans cheese.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch Chile burger with corn on the cob.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior of Rehab Burger Therapy.

Y6stUaZMAsqKBaVMG4mxRg.text: Great burgers! Lots of choices. Service was excellent. Casual atmosphere. Would definitely recommend.

ddoM1xTW1q2Mdyr2MxY5cQ.text: Got a burger with bacon, avo, and a fried egg.  Very good burger and tasty.  Brian my server was awesome.  My bacon was not a crisp as I like it and he took it back no problem and had them cook it longer.  My ice tea never got empty and was constantly refilled.  Amazing service from Brian.

-jGtxAm9t_bsZZtcfKOBBw.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would.  We arrived at lunch time and people were waiting.  I know why.  Loved my mushroom swiss burger with sweet potato tots; I also ordered the Jamaican corn which had great flavor.  We sat at the bar and so glad we did because the nice girl working had to be one if the sharpest waitresses I have had in a long time!  She was kind, helpful and very efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Bar
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fat Tire Ale Bike
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rehab Menu

kpvIHYfske8nYN7NmLZ9Rw.text: I have a feeling all the 5 star reviews were done by 20 somethings who had a few drinks and would eat anything or perhaps they are finally busting out from eating ramen and Totinos  pizza? I dunno. As a 35 year old who has had good food, this place did not live up to the hype. First off it is hot inside. We were outside under the misters and I believe it felt better than inside. I was about to order philly cheese fries until I read they had cheez whiz on top. Ummm ok, gross. Splurge and buy real cheese people. Way to ruin a philly cheese anything. Then the waitress tried to carry 6 drinks in her hands and almost dumped a Coke in my lap. Thank god for good reflexes I was able to catch it. I got a BLT and fries. The bread was spongy and the bacon chewy. The fries were cold and the seasoning was lime and salt? I dunno. My husband got a burger and onion rings. The rings were cold. He asked for a chilled glass for his beer and it was barely cool. So warm beer. Not impressed. Save your money if you actually like good food. If you are in your 20s and like the bar scene and bar food this will be your thing.

oPqSbMGxJUhOP7_wTZXnZg.text: Screaming Delicious!!! You Must Visit this place. I was convinced to try the PB and J burger and I was absolutely Wowed!!  At first I was skeptical about the combination but boy was I shocked!!  My husband and I demolished this burger. My other family members enjoyed the wings and the fries. The sweet potatoes tots were no so tasty.  Even the salads were good. The burgers are definitely shareable.  A must visit for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build a Burger
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wings
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB and J Burger on the Pretzel Bun

ANNIhLJTeEzmzN13cpLKPw.text: This place is amazing! I got the peanut butter and jelly burger after the waitress told me it was a must try and I ate the whole thing! The sweet potato tots are also killer!

XGITY8a3-Djlv5pYyRg1DA.text: Service and food are excellent! Nice place to drink a few cold ones after shopping all day!

6DwZfsJIQQ5txcmTQr1BmQ.text: Burger lacked seasoning - very plain. Had to Ask for condiments to spice it up.  Fries were seasoned with something similar to lemon pepper. They weren't good either. Parking was difficult. Place was loud and it was just 430.  Not a fan - next time I say I want to go to Hop Doddy please listen.

S1EKfkN8iTYcUSWEusMuBg.text: The place us pretty cool.  The food was good and the service was good.  I do feel the buns are too big for the 5oz burger.  There are two things that are poor with Rehab Burger. One bathroom and no kids menu!  My son just about had an accident while having to wait.  Otherwise reccomended!

b5p4zgSzaPgPVm8Md-_xUQ.text: Very cool atmosphere and laid back crowd.  The food was good and the T-shirts' were great.

hf2aMGj5n9IVKe5lY8Zurw.text: This is one of my favorite places to grab a burger in scottsdale. I have been several times and it never disappoints. They burgers are always cooked to perfection. There are a number of very creative choices.   The atmosphere is a little loud during busy times but well worth it. Especially if you can grab a seat in the patio on a nice day.

SUY_5zCQzCgOwq4RadvJjA.text: Burgers were amazing, service was fantastic, atmosphere was laid back - I honestly couldn't ask for more.  We were seated the moment we walked in the door and our waiter (oh I wish I got his name!) gave us the rundown of the menu since it was our first time there. Crowd favorite: PB & J, his personal favorite: spicy mac n cheese. I love that he offered up his recommendations so of course, I went for the spicy mac n cheese, with sweet potato tots and say what, it comes with a fancy sauce too? I couldn't decide for the life of me, so he offered to give me three different sauces, which was greatly appreciated. The hubby got the bigger beefstro and fries and I believe, chipotle ranch.  Both burgers were phenomenal, cooked to a juicy medium. Not to be biased, I preferred my spicy mac n cheese. Let's be realistic here, this burger is overflowing with mac n cheese and unless you're some sort of burger magician (what am I saying) you're not going to get any mac n cheese on that burger. So dig in with that fork and eat up all that mac n cheese. It was so cheesy, and this is an understatement, but I am a fan of cheese, so this was right up my alley. I was really hungry going in, and as much as I wanted to wolf down my burger, I had to stop myself and just savor each bite. It was that good.  I'm just going to stop myself there, I'm getting too hungry thinking about it to continue. But a word of advice: Get yourself that spicy mac n cheese burger, and no sharing!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. If you love a ton of red meat, the bigger beefstro is for you!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy mac and cheese with sweet potato tots - I have no regrets.

GEX9ydk5yOopPynD6o6sKA.text: Ok so I was reluctant to try the peanut butter and jelly burger but I pulled the trigger and did it. It was soooo good. It had schiracha on it and everything about it worked. My roommate ordered the one with pork on it and we shared. I am ready for a nap. This was worth the trip and the wait. Burgers are phenomenal.

oigLzfF22iElguHfUhu3sg.text: Awesome burgers with some interesting combinations. Great happy hour! It does get rather crowded, but we got lucky with some seats at the bar. The place was busy but the service was still great. The waitresses that we interacted with were friendly and made the experience enjoyable.

Gua_9m-ER7LRi3sAlGMT_Q.text: Great Burger, Great Sweet Potato Totts. Sat at the bar and the service was excellent even though it was a zoo in here.

E35HqhFZTcGYzY8fzK7fSg.text: We were driving around in Scottsdale and very hungry after a 4 hour flight. This place had a cute patio but was too full for us. The inside was ok and feels kind of tropical. I had the backyard BBQ burger (rehab) and the sweet potato tater tots. The burger was juicy and very saucy. Not the best burgers I've had but nonetheless very good! The rehab (10 oz I believe) burgers are bigger than my face and I had to take some tater tots home with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TdyZyo6-FmekesPX6czMKA.text: My family was in town for spring training this weekend and when I read the menu for this restaurant online we HAD to stop in.  The wait for a table was about 15-20 minutes so we decided to just sit at the bar and eat. The bartender/server was super nice, attentive and had a great sense of humor!!  I love all the TVs in the place. Very fun tropical atmosphere. The bar area was just super cute.  I had the chili cheese fries for my meal and wow the chili is amazing!! I believe they said it was their own recipe and it was soooo good. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in town!

s_Gc4k-hdiryecQdxoqSIg.text: Burger was ok. Bit dry.  Fries had special seasoning on them that had an off flavor.  Found out it was lime.  Not my best meal.  Service was however  % great!  Backyard bbq burger and mushroom Swiss burger. Menu listings are very creative.

bkQHl6mPtUn-Rq4PToJ1gA.text: I love this place. They have annoying quirks (such as not taking to go orders when they are super busy), but it doesn't keep me from going back. Their burgers are amazing and they have something for everyone. I love their pastas too. Especially the pesto spa-chini. That dish is soooo good. My kid loves the pbj and bacon burger, and after trying it I have to admit it just works somehow. My favorite is the spicy mac and cheese burger. I've had just the mac and cheese and the mac and cheese burger, and I think the burger is the way to go. The appetizers are good, the fish tacos are good, I really haven't ever had anything from there that hasn't been consistently exceptional. One of my favorite places to eat.

VvfwiMgnwfXeFJZhvyHqqw.text: Burger rehab, has such a great vibe in such an exciting feeling inside I'd rather eat inside and out.  The staff is wonderful. And I do mean wonderful. They are very efficient and fast paced and yes I'm sure they get lost in the weed sometimes but I've been here twice and I've had a great time both times.  The first burger I ordered was the gnarly burger and I guess it could be best described as your regular ordinary double Dekker burger but it's huge. Next I ordered the spicy macaroni and cheese burger it was smaller than the gnarly burger but it was very good, and you get macaroni and cheese all over the place and it's actually tasty macaroni and cheese.  This is going to become a regular spot for me is I really like the vibe it's adult yet fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pig wings mmmmmmm
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

aloSZq7vBvjaWNTXXH0Eyw.text: Amazing! So much food and unique choices. Wish we lived in Scottsdale just for this restaurant.

GN0Z6HYZ20mHIllYhAJe3Q.text: I don't give a 5 star but this place rocked. Waitress was the best I ever had. All the food was good and I have to say when I need rehab again I am calling my sponsor aka the wife and heading down.

2gBFPwcb93iL45D1rqSqXw.text: I was super excited to check this place out thanks to their creative list of burgers with crazy toppings. Our service was fine and food quality was fine, but it was mostly just that - fine. The burgers and toppings were average. The fries were average. I'd say the most fun I had was with their sauces! The sweet potato tots tasted great with all three that I tried (pesto mayo, teriyaki and chipotle ranch).   Again, definitely not a bad place at all. It was laid back and is probably a great place to meet friends

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Y-4lGxq6GrOpA3wEU41Tkg.text: We brought the Boys' Burger Club here today. I ordered the Ghost Burger with bacon and a side of onion rings. We've been doing the BBC for a while and I can tell you this is the best burger yet. Maybe one of the best I've ever had. Also, the service was magnificent. Looking forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zEkrcCXYextYEqmhB_-zSw.text: This joint is off the chain! We ordered to go at the bar and the service and knowledge she had about ALL the burgers was mind blowing. Anyway, the burger was so damn good it put me to SLEEP!!! For reels!!! No need to for any other burger joint if you are visiting Scottsdale. We were, we did and we were extremely happy!

hIc8gz4s747z-lhHqxv-0A.text: Rehab Burger Therapy, located in downtown Scottsdale, goes for a beachy, laid-back surfer vibe  - there are surfboards mounted on the walls, reggae music playing on the intercom and employees dressed in shorts and trucker hats. For seating, there's a small bar area as well as both inside and outside seating.   A friend and I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger Relapse size (4oz of meat) on a traditional Brioche bun with a side of fries and an order of their Onion Ring appetizer. The burger was just alright, nothing spectacular. BUT their onion rings were so good and massive too. The beer batter makes for an extra thick and crispy crunch. It comes with a yummy chipotle ranch sauce for dipping. Yum!   As for service, our waitress was nice but a little slow in checking up on us periodically, so it took a little longer than expected to get our check and pay. This didn't bother me though because I assumed service would match the informal, laid-back atmosphere Rehab is going for.   Overall, OK experience. I might come back for a beer and their onion rings but probably not to have a full meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Onion Ring Starter

QC3clJX8emqH3GTwe8xIcw.text: I had the jalapeno popper burger (relapse size!)-- the flavors were pretty good, but the meat itself was ordinary.  I think this place depends on its toppings to provide flavor, and they aren't wrong, but I really prefer it when I can't get enough of the meat itself.  The sweet potato taters were just okay- I'd stick to the fries next time.  All in all, I wouldn't go out of my way for this place but I wouldn't be opposed to eating here again.  Its a cute place to hang out too and the wait/bar staff were really nice!

nzp0F8U0dTqDoF42Bfqyzw.text: Pretty darn good burgers with the not to be missed sweet potato tots! Happy hour will get you some nice cheap beer too :-) Friendly service, great ambiance, stop in and you won't be disappointed!

Of4yBQ7w5Z34VlLhck2dFQ.text: Fantastic.  If you can put up with the typical Scottsdale vibe in the area, this place is a must! Awesome burgers, fries, and service. This little place does it right.   The BBQ burger is amazing, but I get the onion rings on the side. It's the perfect setup.

gDw6ZlOwDJ1hvvAnyGPM4A.text: I don't write reviews often. I really need to either be wowed or angry for me to find the motivation to do this. Having said that, I was wowed by my entire experience at Rehab Burger. The food was amazing. We were celebrating a birthday as a group of 7. The staff provided us with service that would make you think you were in a 5 star restaurant. The menu was diverse enough for everyone to choose something that appeals to their tastes and from the chicken wings to the sweet potato tots to the burger itself everything was done perfectly. I had the BYOB burger. I added avocado, havarti cheese, and a fried egg. It was delicious. To the staff at Rehab thank you for treating us like kings. Thank you for the excellent service (especially during the Friday night dinner rush no less) and thanks for the burger therapy!

r2vAowKnZqKjTdrnbKP__Q.text: Here's the deal: I only went for happy hour and thoroughly enjoyed my Mai Tai. The menu had many selections and a wide variety of burgers. My friend ordered the Hangover Burger and it looked amazing.   The chips & salsa/guac were not my favorite but overall I loved the fun, vibrant west coast ambiance. It's a great place of your looking for something casual, laid back and satisfying.

vIMPeLyjfGUTywYUVsFtZA.text: Being from SoCal, we found it humorous to have a beach themed restaurant in Scottsdale!  Great relaxed atmosphere, casual dress. Staff was friendly and quick to serve. My husband had the 'pig wings' which were pork riblets that he said were amazing. They were tender, almost fell off the bone tender and the sauce was incredible--sweet with a bit of heat on the backside.   I was extremely please to find a burger joint with gluten free buns!  My first time ever--usually have to order protein style. Kudos for this wise choice!  I ordered the hatch burger but with a turkey burger instead of beef with the Jamaican style corn on the cob. The flavored were absolutely fabulous. But that heat on the chile...wow, I need ice cream!    We are planning a return trip before we go home.  I highly recommend this place. Great for our picky teenagers as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch turkey burger with Jamaican corn on the cob.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pig Wings

Ouvwzto6L5iy0u15_P5mHQ.text: I'd give this place a four star review, with the deductions coming from service and partially the food. This time I ordered the ghost burger rehab style which is only one patty. The burger was plenty spicy and I enjoyed it, however, the burger was not well done as I requested. There was some link in the burger and the fries were cold. Aside from that it was a great experience, although I anticipate Wait staff to be a little more attentive and bring out hot sides. I personally  convinced a friend of mine to come and he was pleased except for the service. Gentlemen serving us seemed complacent or Like he was ready to go. I understand as we've all been there, although if you want to attract repeat customers you have to show them attention. Just a thought....

4qzHFo87iwrrN_8Puc4qFQ.text: Amazing food. Will be back again. Had the sweet potato fries, onion rings, and regular fries. All we do good. Pulled pork sandwich huge and so great.

QNBD62XFqh6_yuF_MfBsfg.text: Rehab Burger reminds me of Hooters with more modern outfits. The food is ok, the waitresses are friendly, and the ambiance is sorta sports bar ish.  Service was fast, location was great. No complaints on those fronts.  I ordered a burger, but just when I remembered we had reservations for a steakhouse that evening, I quickly changed it to a grilled cheese sandwich. Unfortunately, the sandwich was pretty disappointing. The bread was 90% of the entree: huge one-inch thick slices that contained a couple slices of barely warmed (let alone melted) cheese. The sweet potato tater tots were fine.

w-pM0vFMHuXd9QseYInKqA.text: This is a really goid place to bring friends and travelers for many types of burgers. I can't wait to try the drinks!

p92cs5eDak7U0UjRtfAxqQ.text: These burgers are the freakin BUSINESS. I love everything about this place, the building in itself is like a neat on the beach burger shack. It's very close, kinda loud, and very tasty. The chips and salsa changed my life, not sure what type of chips they used but I was funneling that junk in my mouth nonstop. It took a very long time for the burgers to come out but it was well worth it. On a busy day, if you have like 2 hours to spare, definitely come here and enjoy your much needed rehab!

4HQ9DBAVs0t6vTDcGzoM6Q.text: Our GO TO place for awesome incredible burgers!  So many options, and all that of them in big or ridiculous big size!  Get there early, very popular and the wait gets long quick, but if you have to wait, it's worth it!!

0RDh8STbZYxXkR4Iw_vxeQ.text: While they have fantastic happy hour deals, I have been both pleased and unimpressed by my food. The first time I had a breakfast burrito and sweet potato tater tots (fantastic) and the second time I had an overcooked, dry veggie burger. Their drinks are extremely well priced on happy hour (which is practically all of the time). My friend had a burger that she was pleased with.   The atmosphere was fantastic! I highly recommend this for day drinking or meeting a friend. Great for both family and a good time.

FnO7H5IjNl0P0mDC5UoXuQ.text: The. Best. Burger. I've ever had. In. My. LIFE! The boyfriend and I were in Phoenix for a vacation over Memorial Day weekend. Burgers are our thing so I looked into what Arizona had to offer. I came across Rehab on Yelp and saw it was the highest rated place around us -- of course we decided to come.  We sat outside on the patio, it has a laid back and welcoming ambiance. For starters, we ordered the Chili Con Fritos and Nelson's Verde Con Pollo. Both to die for! The Chili Con Fritos is a dream for anyone experiencing an oh-so-unfortunate hangover. Nelson's Verde Con Pollo is SPICY! But the flavor that comes with it is well worth it!  I ordered the Spicy Mac & Cheese burger on a brioche bun. I forget the name of my boyfriend's burger but in addition to the 10-ounce beef patty, it was topped with shaved rib-eye and a wasabi ranch dressing. He ordered his burger on the pretzel bun. And as I mentioned before, both burgers came with a 10-ounce beefy patty. You can choose a 5-ounce patty, "the relapse" if you prefer a smaller portion.  As soon as I took a bite of my burger, I looked at my boyfriend and said "This is the best burger I've ever had in my life." Something I never thought I'd say, just because I eat so many burgers! But man, this burger had everything. The flavor, the texture, the crunch, the bursting spice of the poblano peppers --- I couldn't ask for more!  Each burger comes with a side --- sweet potato tots or fries are included in the burger price. You can upgrade to various other options if you wish. I chose the sweet potato tots and I am SO GLAD I did. I also had the pesto aioli and chipotle aioli for dipping. They tasted best dipped in the pesto aioli...or maybe the chipotle aioli...I can't decide! It was all just so good!  We topped off the night with the Pot Brownie. It was made with both Hershey's chocolate and Reese's peanut butter cups, topped with marshmallow fluff and ice cream. Oh my goodness. Who came up with this?! Genius, I tell you.  Later on that night, as I was doing my own random burger research (yes, that's how much I love burgers) I came across an article that listed the best burger joint in every state in America. Funny enough, Rehab was the best in Arizona. :)  Needless to say... I WILL BE BACK! I will refer anyone and everyone, and I will gladly speak HIGHLY about my experience at Rehab.

-qTuJqx99ZZFjXtvHPxHqA.text: Seriously one of the best burgers I have ever tried! I had the Hawaiian Burger, it was perfection! Also, their sweet potato tots- amazing, again the best ever!

6-Dwl3xfAJGcylR7X7Lm6Q.text: I was there last night with a group of 5 other ladies.  The burgers were very good and cooked just the way we asked BUT several of the orders were not done right.  I asked for lettuce, tomato and raw onion with my burger and got sauteed onions with no lettuce or tomato and then I was charged for those onions.  Another of our diners did not get the avocado on her build your own burger and had an extremely long wait for her drink.  A third diner received her French fries ice cold.  She did get some that were nice and hot but that took over 15 minutes to receive.  I'm not sure what was going on last night that contributed to so many errors being made.  I hope they get their act together because I would like to give them a second chance.

mILVOKDdJUniyuGYXLyQwA.text: Burgers are soo good, especially their pulled pork. But lately the service has been slow... I think they're just short staffed. For the most part though defintely a good bang for your buck.

JMvnoZagKb4RsMnNK_kARg.text: This is my 3rd time at Rehab in 1 week. The ambience, staff, food & location all add up to AMAZING!!!  I could go on & on about this place, but I will try to sum it up succinctly: If you want a comfy environment, people to interact with that also serve food/drinks, sports on the big screen, a central location, full satisfied stomach/liver...this is your place. Locals & tourists align perfectly. Come here. You'll be back.  Big shout out to CW, Kate, Stefi, Robin & the rest of the team.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. One of the Incredible burgers!

N2TVFQex9Q-dbzZXj9K5mw.text: This is an perfect place to burger and chill. The Tots rule! The chili, Mac and chz, and hangover burgers were very very good. The ambiance is also what makes the place. This place is on the small side so the wait my be long. The larger burger is the way to go, the smaller one has a tendency to get lost.

u1iumGsEZmlYafLy6NNobA.text: This one place I've seen & heard about for some time. I was nervous that the experience would not live up to the hype... But they definitely did.   The rather small space made for an awkward wait in the door way... But the hostess was insanely friendly and answered any questions we had while waiting.   There were 3 different meals ordered. First mine was the PB&J bacon burger with sweet potato tots. I have to say that the tots were awesome, and dipped in their teriyaki pineapple aoli made them a perfect side. I highly recommend that combo. The burger was delicious. Sweet, spicy, salty & nutty. I personally loved it... But I know not all will step out of their box for this kind of burger. It was juicy and messy just like a burger should be. I ordered the small which was a 5oz patty and couldn't even eat half. The Ghost burger (10oz) & regular fries were yummy... The best part about the Ghost burger was the generous melted gooey cheese & avocado. I don't know what sorcery they used to make the huge burger stay together & stacked when eating.. But that was great. The fries good, but nothing special in my opinion. The last meal a large Mac Gnarly burger and Jamaican corn. The corn was delicious... But for me it needed more of the seasoning blend & salt. The burger had a great 1000 island dressing, messy, delicious.. And again stayed together very well for a huge burger.   I'm definitely going back and if you're looking for a great burger check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Mac Gnarly burger &amp; Jamaican corn.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The PB&amp;J bacon burger (small size) with sweet potato tots &amp; Jamaican corn.

BHC3iluBMScJW80YC7voiw.text: Sitting at the bar. Courtney is the best bar tender ever! Loving the service and the food and the happy was great. We come every year for spring training... hope to see Courtney again

37Pej2dLT1kA-sVR6OG08g.text: Great food, pig wings and spicy mac and cheese burger are fantastic. Next time I have to do the pb&j burger.

rEMJ7Pu2qcy0Moq7VLIHfg.text: Went here while in Scottsdale for the Goodguys hot rod show and it lives up to its yelp ratings no doubt!!! This is a damn good piece of meat stuffed inside a bun! Don't skip this joint! Stuff your face!!!

Z_Rk64zzmtDDFcAmXI4QRg.text: Second time coming in to visit Rehab Burger Therapy.  During the first visit we were largely ignored by the server - he only stopped by our table after we had been sitting there for 10 minutes, didn't check on us after food was delivered, didn't refill our drinks, and only came back to drop the check.  The fries came out cold so we had to flag down another server to get fresh fries.  To their credit the manager/owner ended up comping the meal for us.  She asked that we give them another try to correct their shortcomings.  The second visit the fries came out cold again (I even tried a fry right when the plate hit the table).  The same manager replaced the fries for us, but again this server didn't check on how we were doing after the food was delivered.  The burgers themselves were okay, but for the price I expected something special.  I've had better at other burger joints in the area.  Burgers: 6/10 Fries: 3/10 Service: 3/10  I wanted to like this place because of all the other positive reviews, but I can't say that I'll be back.

1ET_wdwQEKBpxPuuQSZ22g.text: The food is delicious! My husband had the ghost burger and I forgot what I had but it had pineapple, onion ring and barbecue sauce - both were fantastic! And yes they came with fries and a pickle. For sure on next years visit we're coming back. Both service & food were fantastic! Thanks for a great meal.

uJ3jcGr44y-CykyEY54LpQ.text: Being from outbid town we try as many places as we can when we visit. This place was fantastic.  My gf and I ordered blue cheese infused burgers that were out of this world. Add that to a yummy CaronaRita and cheerful service and you're well on your way to a great meal.  We visited early early for dinner but when we left the place was packed. Looks like a great spot for tourists and locals alike!

dqLz5_MYNj7FG0gQ9thMhw.text: Average spot in my opinion.  Have been 3 times within the last year and normally order a fairly straight forward burger with some fries.  All 3 times the burger has been over cooked with not a lot of flavor.  2 times the fries were cold and limp.  It's not a terrible spot to put some food in your stomach if you're in old town, but there are several burger places well ahead of this one.

8cyrzYE10ybcFt40QicQdg.text: This place offers a variety of different styled burgers, but just because they're unique looking doesn't make the taste any better.  I loved the atmosphere, customer service, and appetizers. Although this specialty burger joint doesn't deserve 5 stars... the burgers were just "okay"
