Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. With my bestie Drea &amp; her hunny Glenn

GPtCUMW7paynj3CECgJj2Q.text: Perfect. Great atmosphere. Spectacular service, at least at the bar where we ate. Outdoor seating with heaters. Fantastic burgers. Every option you ca think of or make your own. Location is nice. Right next to free public parking. The bartender even rings up an extra drink to get in on happy hour but delivers it later when you are ready. Music not too loud so you can talk. If you are in the area and want a burger, GO!  I think it was well worth the trip

EE7eavvw0fQxCgGxNDaV2Q.text: The atmosphere and service were excellent. I had the Hawaiian burger which was OK but the mac & cheese burger looked awesome so I'll be having that next time. Definitely worth checking out.

ow4CXJIGqKDt3IBmEgzdjw.text: Best Burgers in town. They are HUGE!!  they have some funky options but all are good. The pretzel buns are great. Fun atmosphere, great service and awesome food. Try it out you will be back!

KMuyQ9wxWf34XWgHdigxnA.text: Wow. So happy we tried this place out! New favorite! After some convincing, my husband ordered the PB&J burger. I ordered the Hangover burger. We both got the sweet potato tots. The PB&J burger was so different and SO delicious! I liked it more than the Hangover, but mine was good as well. Our service was amazing and the vibe is super chill. We will definitely be returning with all our friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The bar
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside

xo9iJGpm-MzYRt58b2A38g.text: I had been meaning to check out this spot for a while before finally getting to it tonight. Having tasted many great burgers over the years, I have very high expectations, and I can honestly say, they were met with flying colors!  First, the service was absolutely pleasurable. Our server was super chill, nice guy and did not bug us every five minutes. He was friendly and helpful.  The food: I tried the PBJ and Bacon burger after some hesitation and man, it was a real great treat! I think everyone should be adventurous enough to give this one a try...be dangerous and live a little! Sweet and spicy, the peanut butter jelly and chili really had a surprising twist - a very much BBQ like taste...very delicious. Instant favorite. I had a bite of my friend's cheese burger and it was great, but of course not as adventurous as mine haha!  The sweet potato and skin-on fries were both delicious, rounding out for a great epic burger dinner. Will definitely be back!

9Y2qxgi86qX0JhykVhrtjg.text: Great place. Amazing service. I just saw a waiter literally run after someone who left their food.   This place has it dialed in. Xtra crispy bacon was delivered as asked, which normally is s risky bet. Great quality

lpAX7jMBhyqvC_iV8T02Aw.text: This was a surprising find...newly opened in a location of several other restaurants, this place has great food at reasonable prices. Offering both 10oz and 6oz burgers, along with a complete menu. The burgers were great. Prepared exactly as ordered, mine med-rare. They offer set burgers, plus, a build your own option. The fries were first rate, fresh and hot. The atmosphere is fun. The staff was efficient and friendly. They offer both patio and inside dining. I would definitely go back...

S5VjHOL5w6gTkyY9hPkqNQ.text: Great place! Obviously all the burgers are top notch. The Rehab burger is over a half pound of juicy deliciousness. You can also get a half size burger thst is still plenty big.  They cook the burgers the way you order them. Too many places ask how you want your burger cooked than completely ignore your choice. Plenty of non burger choices too, delicious salads, yummy sandwiches and wonderful pastas. Awesome milkshakes, fries, sweet potato tots and pig wings (just try it). Great drink specials and happy hour for the cocktail and beer drinkers. Last but not least is a friendly and knowledgeable staff eager to please. Run, don't walk over to Rehab today!

_mVpnrUujg4Y6WfJI86IIg.text: I wish I could have loved this place because it has a great location and inviting atmosphere.  I was too disappointed that when we ate there (on a Sunday) they were out of quite of a few items.  No avocado or gluten-free bun today?!?  I tried to look past that an ordered a protein-style burger instead.  It was good, not anything to write home about.

F7aEJcjaJ1Z7aUwxoIvy7A.text: Great vibe, pleasantly surprised by how busy it was. Robyn was our server and although she was busy, she hustled hard to take care of us. Hostess did a great job getting us watered before our server came over. Mushroom Swiss Burger with sweet potato tots was awesome.  Great Happy Hour specials, Thursdays all day HH.  Patron bucket is one of the best deals in town if you like Patron.  Bucket of ice comes with 4 Coronitas (the little ones) and a bottle w/ 4 shots of Patron for $28.  I don't know anywhere else you can get four Patron shots for that cheap, plus the added bonus of the Coronitas.  Definitely recommend.

6jrgsUM0CDOGoCTRn9WbfQ.text: It was hot and humid inside and the communal bar top seating may it awkward to catch up with friends on a Sunday afternoon. The food was alright, but I will try another place before I return to Rehab for a burger fix.

GLDBQ49KlzENKeO_jbO3TQ.text: We love going to this place.  The burgers are phenomenal. If you can't be in a surf shack on the beach listening to Caribbean tunes, this is a great alternative.

ygkA2kUGjGskpcgr7WhQZQ.text: Great burgers at this joint in Scottsdale. The beef patty was cooked to perfection and they offer a nice selection of specialty burgers to choose from or just the traditional. Staff was friendly and the prices are fair. Like the sweet potato tots... Definitely try this place out if you are hungry and in mood for a burger!

h1ZdRt10JqnJKJJuzBfDSQ.text: Best place ever. We try and eat here once a week. Love sitting out on the patio. Food is great and the service is even better. The owner is there often and you can truly tell they care. Really fun place.

fkCz-g4z1KLL6zSnFUOseg.text: Lots of great burger options! I had the BBQ Burger and Fries. Great lunch spot for a tasty burger!

mA2zj6FPMpAg4U32aMmgXw.text: I have nothing bad to say about this place. We found it because o the yelp deal. We had the calamari and the quesdaillio which were both delicious! For our entrees I had a Caesar salad and my friend had the chicken sandwich. Huge servings perfect for left overs.  I also have to give a shoutout to our waitress Cheryl from jersey. She was hilarious and always kept my diet coke filled.  The atmosphere is great and the place has awesome positive energy. Will be back soon.

WN3wTBZohLwWr8Okzsz_UA.text: I was looking forward to eating here, then at the end of the night I immediately regretted my decision to even show up here. It had nothing to do with the food... the burger was good... It all had to do with the terrible service my friends and I received. We sat down and waited a little longer than we really should have to place our drink order. She then returned with our waters only to tell us she had forgotten what we had ordered for our drinks. We then had to repeat the various drinks we all ordered 5 minutes before. We put in our order and sat and waited for over 45 minutes for our food. While we sat there waiting... And waiting... And waiting... We watched as table after table who ordered after we had get their food. She also came by and tried to force another beer on me. She then brought my friend his burger, then went to check on the table next to us while the rest of us sat there for another 5 minutes waiting on our food. My friend told her just to cancel his order (I believe he has also written a review). The burger was good... But would have been way better had I gotten it about 25 minutes earlier than I actually did.  I forget my servers name, but she was an older woman, a lot older than the other waitresses there. P.S. They were out of Mac and Cheese!!!!! Ridiculous!!!!

PSz7jV6rD2pL27aNRdazww.text: The food was Awesome the staff was awesome; In fact just about every waitress and waiter stopped by our table to say hi and ask how the food was. We had the Hawaiian burger  and the Bacon cheese burger, fries and the sweet poToTos. all of their Aioli sauces served with the burgers and sides were really tasty. Did i mention how great the staff was? We gave it 12 stars and will be going back for more!!!!!! I recommend it to any one.

CXP7CvreyW4F2crYJmviHw.text: Came in here on a random mid-week night with a few friends. When we got there, we were greeted and seated immediately. Our server was very bubbly and explained every aspect of the restaurant and menu to us. I was incredibly impressed. We all order our food. I got the Rehab BBQ burger (11 oz) and our server recommended the pretzel bun. Food came out quickly and it was soooo good. Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had. They also had a bunch of awesome dipping sauces and another bottled sauce that's to die for. Everyone I was with loved their food. I was only able to finish half my burger, and I have a big appetite. The fries were great too. It's so nice to find a nicely priced restaurant and bar in Old Town that also has great service and great food. I've already brought friends in again to try it out and they loved it too. Can't wait to go back.

eBLDWvuNBR1ho22YOfEV6w.text: I went out with some friends and most of us had burgers, but all of us had fun! Even though the night we went there was a big group of people having fun too and it was a little loud at times, we were still taken care of. I saw all ages there.  Burgers are GOOD and could SHARE, but why would you want to??  David our server was absolutely great, especially for us newbies to Rehab. I had the BBQ burger with wheat bun, another had the Mushroom with pretzel bun. The "outlier" had fish tacos, which to them were just okay.  I prefer the wheat and it was great but I did try the pretzel bun and it was good.  Everyone LOVED LOVED LOVED the sweet potato tater tots!!! I was quite full after eating just the burger.  One tip I have to share is there are 2 types of burges, the regular sized rehab and the smaller "relapse". The bun comes in one size (the big rehab size) so the relapse can look kinda odd being small on a huge bun.  Parking is, I agree, kinda weird, but you still gotta go here!  All in all, the burgers, atmosphere and busy yet attentive waitstaff are worth it. I would definitely go back!

D8__F_0UB-Cj2j50fe4eaQ.text: love rehab.  Found this place a couple years ago with a "group" dinner.  We have beenn going back ever since.  We love the burgers..and to be honest..the calamari is EXCELLENT..didn't think I would ever say that about a hamburger joint.  LOVE IT

GUK6qKi1UcyLisaPO2QYEA.text: I love Rehab burger. I had my birthday party there and it was the best. The staff was the best!!!! Only 15 people said they were coming, but 38 people showed up. The staff went with the flow and had no problems seating everyone. I was really impressed when the staff brought the right food to the right people! There wan't any confusion of who ordered what. The staff is super friendly, personable and  take time to help you order when you're unsure of what will crunch your hunger. The food is amazing too!!!! I would eat there any day of the week. I love burgers and they are on the top of my list of places to eat. If anyone has a large group of people and not sure where to go, this is the place to go!

zO9QhOEj7m_MHHQ_s5CeoA.text: Great inventive burgers and love the casual laid back vibe. Customer service was great too. The tropical theme made me want to plan our next beach vacation!

R6ufZR9anDjOs-EPwBAMLg.text: YUMMM! Was craving a burger and decided to take the 20 minute drive to Scottsdale to try this place and I am glad we did! Hubby got the PB&J burger which he says the flavors melded really well together and didn't taste like a straight up PB&J. I had the Poblano burger With their spicy onions on the side...so good! Atmosphere was fun and inviting. For sure will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J burger.

GtEzuPnamTkLQ6NsFHj7VA.text: Had the Veggie Noogie was really good and the Sweet Potato Tots were good as well. Food was a little slow getting out, but I would come back and try more off the menu.

-Zg8zyB8XNdEVMU4sGQPog.text: Nice location. We enjoyed sitting on the patio.  Our burgers were cooked to our liking ( well done). My friend got the burger with peanut butter and jelly and said it was delicious. It sure looked good!   My main reason for writing this review is for others with celiacs disease- I decided to try rehab burger after discovering that they had a gf bun and was able to access a list of their gluten free offerings online. I was excited to try! Unfortunately the waiter we had knew very very little about what was offered and that right off the bat made me nervous. All  he knew is that the burger patty wasn't spiced with anything with gluten in it. Otherwise I read off the online list- really the only options turned out to be the build a burger or salad.  I got the build your own burger...Fries were not gf so I subbed a side salad with my burger...after extensive conversation with the server the salad still came out with croutons on it :/ The burger was decent. Not something that would make me return in and of itself.  At the end of the meal and my salad was pushed to the side untouched the the server gave me a funny look then apparently realized that I ordered it without croutons. He was a nice enough guy so I just said don't worry about it (I was a little disappointed to see that he hadn't subtracted it from the bill however as it was an additional charge to have the salad instead or fries for a side).  Overall this seems like nice enough place, just not for those looking for gf options. It's curious to me that they offer a gf bun but are not very gf friendly otherwise.

tMhziclArS_BIYn4MnRIXA.text: Have been seeing posts online for a while, and have wanted to give the place a try.  Disappointed to drive from across town to find out their specialty burger has sold out the day before, sounds like poor planning to me.  Anyway, we had the PB&J, Spicy Mac and Cheese and the Calamari.  Wife really enjoyed the PB&J burger, I wasn't as impressed with the Spicy Mac & Cheese.  The mac had a gritty taste, and was served lukewarm, and not the least bit spicy.  The flavor wasn't bad, but it wasn't a $14 burger either.  The calamari was surprisingly good, which is funny because it would seem the burger should be the star and not the appetizer.   Two burgers and a appetizer for $38, to me seems a little steep, but I'm cheap.  Kicker to the whole visit is when I check my bank statement the next day, the upped the bill by $3.  I guess someone wanted a little larger tip than the 20% we paid.  Not sure it's worth driving across town to not get what you want, but I can now say I have been there.  UPDATE: After calling and speaking to the manager, the entire tip amount is being refunded as this was an error on the part of the server.

g1vdAB8Hx69fO1Kgb2xlfw.text: Omg this place was awesome!!! Their poblano burger and sweet potatoes tator tots were delicious!  Service was great and the waitress Selena was very personable and informative!  We are from California and will definitely recommend this to our friends that will come and visit!!

XLbVPe5E974YMGOl1cwSNA.text: Great place.  Been there twice and will go back again.  Try the peanut butter and jelly hamburger.

Q33h4c4p85X6b8tOt0E7_A.text: They got it right!  This burger joint would fit in with the many Gulf Coast towns and cities in Texas.     Felt like I was back home on the Third Coast kicking back with a burger, beer, and good company jamming to reggae on the sound system.     Bugers were stellar, both the vegan and the Hatch Chile burger.  I grew up 30 miles north of Hatch NM and can say they did it right.    The Red Stripe beer was fresh!!!  Something you don't see on a regular basis here in AZ  The real surprise was the sweet potato tots!  Usually not a fan of them, but their version just made me a convert!!!  The only thing lacking was the beach, so, barring California sliding into the Pacific,  it is something I will just have to deal with.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RKm9mUxQmwK_M0htNFPaRg.text: Pretty good food but always a long wait to sit and a long wait to receive your food. Limited seating is expected.

BEDZ0tTUQ9Klx6VHuEEBMA.text: The food is very fun and creative.  Portions are large but perfect for when you have that hankering for a nice hardy American meal.

st_CfN7Kc4C9ltpuF0A1Zw.text: Do not hesitate to order the PB&J burger! And our mushroom Swiss burger was perfect too. Service was awesome...can't wait to come back next time I'm in Scottsdale!

OsZ9FsnnNy2RBxEtnk98ew.text: I love the casual beach ambience and the huge selection of the  burgers to choose from. You can select the type of buns you want, and pick fries, sweet potato tater tots, or do like I do and get half and half. Burgers are huge so we always end up taking leftovers or I'll split one with my daughter. My favorite is the PBJ bacon Sriracha burger on a pretzel bun. Today i had the beefstro burger which was humongous, greasy and messy to eat. Just the way a burger is meant to be. I'm in a food coma now.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beefstro burger was huge &amp; greasy, but tasty.

2EmTLt-yxxIQEJp8CHG0dA.text: Ahhhh, the burger craze. New burger joints seem to be popping up on every corner and at some point the beef frenzy will subside and we'll be left with empty restaurants. However, I think Rehab has staying power that would even keep Linsey Lohan here!  The patty and condiment combinations aren't that unique but the ingredients are fresh and the sauces are good enough to eat with a spoon. In fact, I really think it is the sauces that make the burgers here. I ordered a classic cheddar cheese burger which I know sounds boring but it was a great choice as it highlighted the yumminess of the chipotle aioli sauce. As many other reviewers have said, the "sweet poTOTatos" (sweet potato tater tots) are good but for me, it was once again the sauce, this time the pineapple teriyaki that made the dish.  This rehab center has patio seating complete with a zillion umbrellas, fans and misters. But vampires need not worry, as there is a great interior too that is dim and cool. Also, despite being a super casual place, the bathrooms were neat and nice.

CWQPPP2mYCeMmpPAn24hhw.text: Another one of my favorite places to bring guests from out of town. They have great appetizers, beer and food! I got their wings with golden sauce. Everybody LOVED them. The atmosphere is like going to and island. It's awesome. There is lots of free parking nearby too.

wU0Pg_qv4WzhOJZiEvv58A.text: Oh my goodness! I visited Arizona and on my last week there I ate at Rehab Burger Therapy twice... it is that delicious. My favorites are the PB&J burger and the Spicy Mac 'N' Cheese Burger. Service is exceptional and the atmosphere reminds me of a burger joint near the beach.

_1CsZgXH0lm4qmacC0FRdw.text: Excellent burgers are the standout attraction for Rehab.  PROS: the best thing about the burgers was the quality beef--very tasty and just the right balance of lean/fat to make for an excellent flavor. Brioche bun was fresh and lightly toasted. Service was friendly and efficient.  CONS: for me, a good burger must be complimented w/ good french fries.  Regrettably, the spuds came to the table barely warm, and they sure didn't improve as the meal progressed. This cost a star from my rating . . . Side salad came to the table looking like it had been stacked under 5 other similar plates when it was pre-made several hours before. The cheese and croutons didn't help hide the "pressed" salad, nor did they inspire the bland taste.  I'd definitely return to Rehab . . . the burgers are worth it. However, I'll be sure to ask for fresh and hot fries . . .   Cheers! RS

tF5hn0J6RLTbmNoH5UqsyA.text: I came thinking I would get one of the unique burgers offered on the menu. Well I decided to have a "relapse" portion of the Mac & cheese and slowly decided to try the Cantina TaCODos (fish tacos). Everything was delicious. I even got a to go order of the fish tacos as well as the chicken wings with spicy pineapple BBQ sauce. I would definitely go if in town again.

XtneaHFAM3sTWCOxu6YtzA.text: We stumbled on this place after going to a museum.  It was delicious!  I had the tacos with pulled pork, the pork was tender, moist and soooo good!  My husband tried the Philly burger..he did end up eating the philly cheese steak portion separate from the burger as it got a bit messy, but told me it was delicious all the same.  Would definitely go again. They had an extensive burger menu with lots of interesting choices.

ITDn03Zct0KB-VW9aOsjOw.text: One of the places I miss in Scottsdale. Very good burgers, typically friendly service.

Qgox4Hl9Dvx-K3Mpoanspw.text: Last Sunday I went here for the 2nd time. This place seems always busy. The burger was so good and the sweet potato tots was absolutely amazing!!! Rocco was our server. He is the best. He was really nice to us and I usually have specific order but he got it right. Definitely come back to this place !!!

Xk0eLKFAr5pPpTvvlrSTJw.text: It's my son's birthday and he wanted a great but unconventional burger. The Peanut Butter, Jelly and Bacon is the top seller. If it wasn't for Serena's awesome customer service he wouldn't have been open to it. He loved it! We all loved what we chose.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YNPn4zDE4ODVh7iR2kz0rQ.text: Good service. Always accommodate my being vegan. Love the roasted corn option instead of French fries. Although the sweet potato tots with the spicy ketchup are hard to beat.

pnGmk0oiU4BikSBT9dh-Cw.text: We sat outside & had a really fun & tasty experience. They were very busy & managed the crowd very well. We ordered the specialty burger that's prepared with 5 oz of beef & another 5 oz of taco meat, Doritos, cheese & burger dressings on a pretzel bun!!!! Yum. We shared it & still had 1/2 left, it was huge! We also ordered the specialty corona/margarita, which was perfect. The staff was friendly. Onion rings are huge & wonderful!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. You should be in REHAB
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crazy-great! Enjoy the food, enjoy the experience!!! Get your self in REHAB

zeD8N-pBI6ND553KloideQ.text: You need rehab, admit it, go get rehab.  Worth the wait for a table!  This place is not too big, real casual, friendly and busy.  Started with the Pig Wings.  Sooooo good!  Crisp outside and moist inside.  The sauce was incredible with just enough heat.  Two person portion size.  For a burger I settled on the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese Burger at my son's recommendation.  I was not disappointed.  The homemade Mac with the peppers made the burger explode with flavor.  Very filling.  Go there now.

NvIW9eLB-SzT-sT2a8i46A.text: Only bad think I can mention about this place is the single bathroom. One for Men/Women and one for Women so if you have to go on a busy Friday night, you'll need to get in line. But not a big deal.  Service was quick and friendly. Burgers are great. Big and juicy with your choice of different buns. The fires are good and plentiful. My wife like the sweet potato tots.  Get there early on the weekend as there is usually a line but it moves quick. Been here 8+  times and never disappointed. I like the McNarley burger. Be prepared, the Rehab burger is two patties, hugh and messy. Ask for extra napkins.

FtPXuX3SeB3eP1Q0jwpU8g.text: I give 5 stars for a reason. Everything I've ever had at Rehab is like a party in my mouth.

2twZ3un67kSZ4-ipTp_aiA.text: Since moving to LA I have rekindled my love affair with the hamburger.  We were in Scottsdale for vacation and I came across this place on Yelp - so we went.  The good: - decor is great - prices are reasonable - food is great (side note - I tried the Sriracha PB&J bacon burger.  Yep, you read that right.  It was ok.  I thought the PB took over the taste of the burger but it was definitely a different taste.  My wife loved her bacon cheese burger) - sweet potato tots are a refreshingly different option - tasty  The not so good: - I wouldn't say our server was overly attentive.  When she came by she was very friendly and attentive but she rarely came by.  I had finished my water (prob a 26oz cup) and waited for a while to get a refill.  Most other restaurants you barely get through 1/2 of your drink before a refill is offered.    The service wasn't a deal breaker and I would probably go back.  I think you should give it a try!

UjIhUCYHasHdietbTzJbsQ.text: Our waiter Rian went above and beyond to accommodate us and the entire staff provided amazing service. I never leave reviews but we are so impressed and satisfied! We are visiting from California and have our puppy with us. We asked to be seated outside but it began to rain.. we were invited in--and even given bacon for our dog. Thanks for the hospitality and excellent food!

5jbgiB8ePm7ar1Nv6J74zg.text: Excellent food, the burgers were huge, the small pasta was a very full plate. Great atmosphere, a great beachy feel right here in Scottsdale. The prices seem a bit high but for the amount of food you get it's not bad. The pot browny was huge. Really a great meal, so large we ate half and are saving the other half for later. Definitely a good value and great tastes.

qAQjYyLzzl453hEIl4SOxQ.text: The fiance and I had planned for a bike ride from Arcadia to Old Town and was searching Yelp for a good happy hour that ran on weekends too. So we came across Rehab Burger Therapy and we were sold since I had been wanting to try this place since its opened. The happy hour is pretty awesome, you can get domestic for $2 and premium beers for $3!! So we got a round of Blue Moons and I tried the Four Peak Peach ale while the fiance got the 8th street. OMG the peach ale was so good! We got hungry and decided to split a burger since we saw a bunch of appetizing looking burgers pass us to other tables. We agreed on trying the hatch chili burger and it was cooked perfectly. They had a lot of interesting sauces like spicy ketchup, teriyaki aoili and chipotle aoili. I smeared chipotle aoili on the burger and it was the perfect compliment to the charred taste of the burger. The fries were okay, we got half regular fries and half sweet potato tots. I will definitely return for more burgers, I am especially interested in trying their hangover burger since I love me some breakfast foods (it has a fried egg and bacon), and of course I'll be back for more happy hours!

RARQvtO_mG9KFffu2d_11A.text: Seriously wicked burger for carnivores and vegans alike! Who knew going to Rehab to be awesome?!?!  Lindsay Lohan would have stayed stayed all 60 days if she would have made it to Scottsdale.

gXL1YzPDmw128FS_KBwpxg.text: First time I haven't finished off a late of food in a long time and it was sooooo good!!

16bw6P6vjgY22ZGH_IqfYA.text: Based on the yelp reviews, I had to check this place out during spring training.  Place looked like an awesome joint to have a burger and hang out. I ended up ordering the bacon cheeseburger on a brioche bun with jamaican corn. Definitely one of my top 5 burgers I ever had, the only regret is that I ordred a small patty instead of a large. (I felt that the bread to meat ratio was a little off.)  My friend ordered a swiss and mushroom burger on a pretzel bun.  The pretzel bun isn't really my thing, but tasted delicious otherwise. Would and will definitely come back here if I'm in town!!

f2n1pqQe5I5w_5mghExuhQ.text: Fogo's De Chao in Scottsdale is a great place to dine if you are a meal lover!  They serve varieties of beef, chicken, pork, leg of lamb, lamb chops, prime rib, filet, sausage, ribs and an extensive salad bar!  Dinner meals are $50 which includes the salad bar.  They also serve one fish entry if someone in your party prefers it.  Wine bottles start at plus $40.  The service is great, food in delicious and restrooms are very clean.  Do make reservations because they are busy on weekends. If you are celebrating a special occasion, do mention it during your reservation.  There is a surprise for the Birthday person that you can share. Can't wait to return.

SEpeGZwIJ7co1VbF8CGI3A.text: Okay i've only been twice but everytime has been awesome! Right behind RNR and everytime I go they have an awesome bar and waiting staff! You can't go wrong with their burgers or sweet potatoe tots! Warning Rodrigo Da Vinci salad is the most unique and awesome tasting salad i've ever had! It is always busy which tells you something and the people are all around my age also seen some pi phi shirts inside that I had no complaints about haha definitely a must go!

TPb2x-p4ZO9D7-1ZIet0pA.text: We loved it. A lot of food.  The pb & j burger was delicious   I would stick to sweet potato tots. Onion rings nothing to speak about

VA0YanCbUZgPFmuwAd0CZQ.text: I remembered why I quit coming here just now.  Food has always been great, this is my third time with terrible service here.  I wish I could say I was able to enjoy the food this time but after waiting 8 mins to get acknowledged by an employee( over 4 employees walked by and looked at me didn't say a word) I decided to just sit my self hoping a server would acknowledge me.  The server came up 4 mins later telling me I couldn't sit there and that there was a wait with 4 open tables in restaurant. The only wait was 2 people that were waiting behind me and never sat down. Once I asked for a manager they said I was fine to sit and she would return for my drink order.  8 MINUTES goes by and not one single employee comes to ask if we want a drink.  I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN. I can understand if it is busy but it was a Wednesday night with multiple open tables everywhere and no SPORTS playing.  I am 100% about customer service and this is the third time in a row I have had terrible service.

8xlZclBsWw-7AcUeKuTdbQ.text: Dog friendly and chill patio. Burgers are awesome and they have pretzel buns.

cuhdDs8ze_eY3GOXT3BPIg.text: We waited an hour to get in to this joint the other night but the wait was worth it. The burgers were excellent. Our server, Shawn, was friendly, funny, and very capable of dealing with a hungry crew of 10. The restaurant was packed so the service was a bit slow, but the food was worth the wait. We recommend the PBJ burger. I had the chicken sandwich which was excellent. Another friend said the Caesar salad was AWESOME. Lots of choices for even the most finicky of eaters. I wouldn't recommend it for the kids though. We bought our 3 year old and although the choices on the menu were ok for him, there is no kid menu. The restaurant is loud and raucous which is great for a night with friends, but not really for kids. Outside where we sat is mostly high tops so it's hard for kids to sit on chairs that high without worrying they are going to fall off. It's like constantly worrying about your drunk friend falling off the chair, except they aren't drunk..and is 3. LOL. Anyway, we are looking forward to going back for a grown-ups night soon! :)

QBzoLQgCfaX7XD7rpk9-oQ.text: Not only the best damn burger in Arizona, yes they were rated the #1 burger in the whole state, and it's in our backyard, but they have one of the best chefs who always has more than just burgers for options that are equally amazing. I eat here at least once a week, even though I live 30 mins away. The owners are always nice and striking up conversations, and the staff gives off a vibe of relaxation as soon as you arrive. And if the PB&J burger sounds too weird, it's definitely not. It's my favorite burger and I've had nearly everything on the menu, including weekend special burgers. Go get you some now!

ycCjYuKdypnqxq2LrVbgtA.text: Overall I was not impressed with this restaurant.  The Burgers we had were decent but they were all lacking something to make them amazing.  Maybe I have just been spoiled at other burger bars but attentive service here and decent food.  I probably wouldn't go back here when visiting the area.

p1HW2ji8UJz3RabmJit1wQ.text: Rehab is the best burger bar in Scottsdale.  Service is great, and the food always comes out perfect.  The only doeskin is the wait.  Typically it runs 10-20 minutes to get a seat.  Off-hours, tables are always available.

z324MdyoSPkosYZq2bT0GA.text: Favorite Burger Joint!! The poblano mac and cheese burger makes my arteries cringe and my tummy rejoice!

kb-OvKFO7kWAR1--T71nFg.text: Awesome!  You can tell they really thought about the different burger combinations and dressings.  The sweet potato tots were awesome!  Our server recommended the pineapple aioli with the tots and it was delicious.  I had the Poblano burger.  Great flavors and just the right amount of spiciness!  The restaurant looks like a beach side bar.  the service was great and our server was full of great suggestions and was very polite.  They have options for people that don't eat red meat or need a vegetarian option.   I am definitely going back to try the other burgers!

Ypub5PrVjZ3Phpmy4iRYYA.text: I love this place. The chicken chili verde appetizer is crazy good. They make their own tortilla chips, probably some of the best I have ever had!  I have tried their salads and burgers both are fresh and HUGE! I got a half salad and could not believe it was half! The large must feed an army.  Great drinks and service to boot!

bumrEX_T3Xt3E8WGhUqDaA.text: This was great!  I got the PB&J on a pretzel bun which was everything promised and more.  I'm not used to the siracha heat, so the sweet potato tots were a good pairing to take down the heat in the first few bites.  We sat outside on a very chilly night so we were alternately frozen and then thawed by the heaters.  The server, Kassie, was really nice and ran the whole patio very easily.  We had the brownie to finish off the night, which was a mess (too many layers) and not very good in the end.  But it didn't ruin our night and the whole meal for 3 people was very reasonable.  We'll be back!

EqeKQLhDBCCVZJSI_igznQ.text: First visit on Saturday. Great burger and good service. Arrived at 11 and glad we did. Was mobbed by noon.

Jyfsr7pY9Qp0gJ9kYYfiEA.text: A great place with an outstanding atmosphere, BUT unfortunately the staff and food need to be improved upon! I ordered a bacon burger cooked medium which I apparently didn't know medium means different things in different restaurants. My food was delivered and looked great , sadly my fries had been cooked too many times and there was no potato left in the middle. I explained to the waitress who wasn't very impressed and grudgingly bought me fresh fries. My burger was raw not medium ( before everyone shouts I eat blue steak) when I  explained this to my waitress she advised me that this is how they cooked their medium burgers and I should have been more specific on how I wanted my medium burger cooked!,,,, Really explain and be more specific! Surely medium means medium. Needless to say I won be going back

OmeAB1BLDzUZGiK2RCuJ4g.text: Rehab burger was an enjoyable atmosphere. The music featured rock ranging from The Eagles to Sublime. I enjoy the warm feeling and concept they are going for. I thoroughly enjoy a good burger. I was not particularly blown away from the meal. The French fries tasted like the oil needed to be changed in the fryer. In all fairness we didn't go out until 8pm at night: the burger was not bad just not something I was happy paying $14 bucks for. I'll attach some pics. We had the honey medium wings and they were better then the burger. The wings were not fatty, had plenty of meat on them, cooked perfectly, and tossed in a great flavor sauce. It's possible the wings set the bar too high. I chose the rehab hangover burger. This included, bacon, fried egg, 10oz patty, Colby cheese, chipotle mayo, and a very fresh flavorful hatch chili. The idea behind the burger was perfect. The execution was not there. The patty was cooked medium but had an over char to it, giving it a burnt taste, the fried egg was over cooked, I was really looking forward to bursting the yoke! The bacon was over cooked. The bun had good flavor but should have been toasted longer and was a bit tough like it had lost some of its freshness. The hatch chili had great flavor! Ultimately, I will go back on another day perhaps when it's slower to see if the execution is better. The servers and bartenders were polite and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Byob burger.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The hangover burger.

rxFPnTeHELDgbFvYObGYBg.text: Great atmosphere!! The service was phenomenal!!  Good beer selection and the food was awesome!! Sweet potato tater tots and the burger with pulled pork on top was great!  Can't wait to come back!

zgS7xO-K7MbDPL3vHpaaQw.text: Great patio, food, beer selection and service staff.

3K0fT6WYx1Q4P2fmsGEHNw.text: Excellent combos and beef. The brioche bun is the only way to go! Service is great and the place is nicely decorated with cool music. Patio is nice. Sweet potato tots are great alternative to fries.

1ppddRQ_CATyY5A6pE95ig.text: PUT. THAT. BURGER. IN. YOUR.MOUTH! Lost a * for no guac on the menu.. but I ordered the BYO (build your own) Hot Dog w chili, cheese n chicago relish; hubby got the Hash Burger on a pretzel bun. Did I mention the Sweet PotaterTots and Adult Milkshakes?! Get your discerning Snobsdale ass over there!!

Miid4j_aNRFQ3VwksCxp3g.text: Loved the beach-themed interior decor. Even on a busy, Fathers' Day lunch there was room at the bar and plenty of time to order. I absolutely loved what I saw on the menu; specialty burgers topped with mac and cheese, or peanut butter and jelly and all sorts of other crazy stuff that people must go wild for! Though we were apprehensive to try those ones, we did grab a BBQ/Onion Ring Burger and the Hatch Chile Burger (not sure if that's what they're actually called). The flavor was outstanding in both, but neither burger was cooked the way they were ordered. In fact, one of them was so dry it was difficult to eat. I am pretty confident that our overdone burger was an uncommon incident, so this place deserves a second chance. I'll certainly be back, and hope to dive deeper into the menu when I return.  Sunday was a memorable experience, for sure, however I wish we'd left the place with more in our stomachs than in the take-home containers.

hWI6l-la5wLImF0kCryjiA.text: One of my favorite burger joints in the valley. Love the vibe that I get when I walk into this place, the great service and the wonderful selection of beers. FINALLY got my first pumpkin beer of the season being that everyone has been out!! I have been here several times and bring someone new every time. I will continue to come back and support this lovely, laid back, local eatery. Keep doing what you're doing Rehab, you guys are amazing!!

8-QN1Ji5LSUvsdM3nudUKg.text: I meant to go here a few weekends ago but because parking in Old Town is occasionally horrible, we passed and went somewhere else. I was back in the area a few nights ago and decided to get dinner here with a friend after manicures. The super friendly server seated us and was very attentive throughout the meal. We didn't get any appetizers, but we both had the Backyard BBQ burger with regular fries. The restaurant has a very low-key relaxing vibe, my only (minor) complaint was that for a Wed night when it wasn't brimming, the music was pretty loud. We got our burgers and they were very good. I had the spicy ketchup and if you have your doubts, it is most certainly spicy, but I loved it. Since Old Town isn't really my scene I'm not sure how often I'll be back, but I'd definitely return.

mASvere6rchaNMGETtjNzw.text: Stuffed Bacon and blue burger ALL DAY.  One of the best burgers I have ever had.  Oh, and the sweet potato tots.. get them.

AnpYHG17N6EpVC-dTwAKWQ.text: Believe the hype, this place is 2 legit to quit! Went here New Years day, with my massive hangover in tow,  because LOLO's had a 45 min wait. Lucky for me we were sat immediately.  Our server was pleasant and quickly brought all our drinks. The most notable of drinks were the chocolate milk shake and bloody mary; both were exceptional.  Our table ordered a Poblano burger (relapse size), Hatch chili burger (turkey patty) and hangover (rehab).  All burgers came cooked to order and were A-mazing. I had the relapse size Poblano burger with onion rings and couldn't finish it so don't worry about not having enough food!  I had a bite of my husbands Hatch turkey burger that was equally as good! He said he didn't miss the beef one bit because the turkey burger was just as juicy and flavorful. If I had to complain it would be about the onion rings and lemon pepper on the fries.  The onion rings are thick with more batter than I prefer as I like a crispier onion ring that is more about the onion than batter.  The actual fries are great but they sprinkle lemon pepper on them. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either.  Both of these complaints are just a personal preferences and have nothing to do with the way they were cooked or quality of the food.  Next time I will just get the fries without the lemon pepper : ) I would love to see them add regular tots to the menu for those who are not a fan of sweet potato tots. All in all, it was a great meal and I will definitely go back.

yQmD9eKc1D3nPawS2_btZA.text: My boyfriend  and I checked this place out for the first time today. We ordered the Pig Wings- GREAT DECISION! I would come back just for those alone! Most of the places we check out have happy hour that ends at four, but we were pleasantly surprised theirs was until six. The staff was friendly, the food was great. Definitely ask for the pretzel bun, they are delicious.

meGPyAxIUdTDpnBWDtXsyw.text: LONG wait that really wasn't worth it. I liked the idea of the pretzel bun but it wasn't executed well. Poor service.

_DPxCM3G-X7F1uHtabdmJA.text: This place knows burgers at least while I was there they cooked mine perfect I like it still medium rare and it was exactly that portions are big for a good price brought family from out of town and first time myself and it was quick service and waitress was on point with ordering and getting food to table will be bringing my husband

resLA0__zpyk3pXElSsyAw.text: I needed a cigarette after the No Poblano burger it was that good.

nYKPYoeYX0JE9okhU0GfYw.text: I have only been here once but that was enough to ensure that I never go back again.  The location and atmosphere were fine and a chirpy waitress provided hope of a good experience when she suggested the day's special of some kind of thinly sliced tri-tip burger.  The outcome however was disappointing as I bit in to my first mouthful of gloopy bits of meat with what I think were peppers, causing a river of grease to descend on to my plate.  The whole thing tasted of something soaked in oil and when I informed the waitress she simply smiled and replied with 'yea', as though I was simply stating the obvious and that was the intended result.  If you're normally a healthy eater and feel like treating yourself to a burger, you might as well buy one from a roadside burger truck and save the disappointment.

wC0dnlIkoTXj0bpGqgwr1w.text: We went here to try something different and we love it!!  The food was fantastic but our server was a little slow.  She kept on forgetting to refill our drinks when we ask, but it was also busy, so I am not to upset about it.  This atmosphere is really fun and laid back.  The decor is fun also.  My kids are already asking when can we go back.

enhPBm5shgvLz9pE0VibXA.text: One of the best burgers I have ever had. And fantastic frozen margaritas I could easily drink  alllllllllllllllll night long! Staff are excellent and good fun, if you need some therapy from the stresses of life, come here and feel rejuvenated!

xQQmwcmW073T1BEqo-zKeA.text: Whoa! PBJ and Bacon burger was unreal. Service was fantastic and the servers were extremely pleasant and helpful. I will definitely be coming back.

8tYE372YYn9WCY6xR7rLnA.text: The service was TERRIBLE!! Our servers name was Ben and he was awful! He basically ignored us the entire time we were there. All he did was set our food down and walk away. The food looks good in pictures and even in person but the taste is just ok... My husband got the Bosa burger (Bosa doughnuts as buns) the bottom doughnut was literally sitting in liquid when it arrived and as my husband picked it up it disintegrated in his hands. I got the burger with pulled pork on top and it was swimming in spicy bbq sauce which, if you like spicy bbq sauce probably would have been really good however, I don't like spicy food and it said nothing about it being spicy on the menu. If it did I wouldn't have ordered it. As the manager walked by and asked how everything was I explained that I didn't really like spicy food and was unable to really eat any of the burger she said "Aw, I feel bad" and walked away. So we paid $14 for 2 bites of a burger. I live in north Phoenix and would never drive all the way back to this place. It's not worth the time out of my day.

jM8JWMCk9zXEmaa2lyCdkw.text: Based on reviews I was excited to try this place out. You can't really go terribly wrong with a burger. The menu is great. I like when places think outside the box with their food. My man ordered the Mac N Cheese Burger... He was less than thrilled the Mac N Chz was cold and the burger just was. I ordered the PBJ & bacon burger. You have to be adventurous but I like that stuff. It was again just ok. Nothing spectacular. Maybe because it was cold or maybe because they messed up our buns. The chips and salsa were pretty good. I can't get overly thrilled about it. Would I come back? Possibly just to try something else but I would split it with someone because the price is not worth the food.

ENh9jBMRQzjLHCQiQ_-XgA.text: If happiness is derived from a great meal, then I am the happiest man in the world. This place was awesome. The BYOB with lettuce and bacon was mouthwatering. The service was quick to respond and very friendly. The atmosphere was relaxing and I will be a valued customer from now on. Burger please, I do believe. I am now an avid fan of this great little nook in Scottsdale.

sRpItEwhi0zNuhqNRy1Yrg.text: Fun atmosphere with great food. You can't go wrong with any of the burgers. Good happy hour. Don't eat at a chain of this is nearby.

M2lPeDmAaXDCSdJkJeWB6g.text: pig wings - gots some kick to it. chile verde con pollo - good. hatch chile burger - good. sweet poTOToes - good, on the sweet side. the atmosphere was really nice.

OGqmKT0W7MKMEyunF5mnMg.text: My burger was tasty but not spectacular. The pretzel roll was actually the best part of the burger. The decor and vibe were cool.

LsWsEtGFp1uE2k4Mc3ukbg.text: Love this place!   Laid back vibe, lots of options on different burgers & sauces, and great happy hour that starts at 11 AM on Fridays!   I love that they have an option of sweet potato tater tots as a side......try them with the Pineapple Teriyaki sauce!  So good!

0n7mppOeRdExJdsOhT5P6g.text: My co-worker and I came here during our lunch break. We decided to check it out since it just opened. Their burgers were amazing and their fries have this mermaid dust (which tasted exactly like Lucas). I got the burger with the onion rings and BBQ sauce! I had their smaller burger and it was more than enough! The service was good and atmosphere felt like we were at the beach. There was a TV monitor that looked like they had an aquarium! It was so cute and probably low maintenance. Just remember they are closed on Monday!

LZ7NybWA5LFR7cHigF6tGA.text: Best burgers I've had in Phoenix! And a very very fair priced. This will be my burger spot every time I am in Scottsdale. Can't wait to come back!

uczX-WWosEVgfWrfpAOq-w.text: Skip RnR and walk 10 feet for a better burger, service and atmosphere! Hangover burger is insane! Actor/Comedian Brian Posehn was walking in as we were leaving.

FHdC5T7b-iUt3xEqnhbu0Q.text: tried this new joint craving a good burger and it delivered! I had the turkey island burger and my girlfriend had the mushroom swiss burger. Both were juicy and cooked perfectly. It offers two sizes and the even the smaller portion is enough. The service was great and friendly and the decor had an "island feel". The bar had any and every spirit possible. Try the spicy ketchup with your amazing sweet potato tots. We are definitely going back to try something new!

d4zbcg9dqb29PiEcCIIc8A.text: This place is really chill.. the servers are all pretty casual, but attentive and helpful.  I've been twice now; the first time I had the Hawaiian burger which was reeeally good.  If you're a fan of pineapple, give it a go.  The sweet potato tots are a great side.. I haven't tried their fries yet but I hear good things.  Last time I went, I had the special, which was a burger with PB&J, bacon and sriracha.. WHAT.  It was a combo that I had to try--when else would I have the opportunity?  It sounds crazy but something about peanut butter and beef was magical.. haha.  They also had this Jamaican jerk-covered cob of corn that was excellent.  Seems like they have a pretty solid happy hour.. all around, good experience!

s3qO_1GdXyOBGeO1TjdR9w.text: Yummy burgers, fries & huge onion rings. Fun beach type decor. Glad to have found them on Yelp!

YmH8ZhKPwPnCHVrEj8Ff9w.text: Oreganos is missing out!   Rehab has one of the best burgers I've ever tasted and the sweet potato tots are incredible!

nKdkZMuRW-Hj0MavcoE1zg.text: great place, love the atmosphere. Great food, only bad thing was they forgot the cheese on our Bacon Cheeseburgers. The waitress needs to relax a little and have fun. Would definately go back.

RfMP6qBk-3DrQbg3z3dTGQ.text: Ok so I'm from out of town and wanted a big juicy burger !!! And I came to the right place. As soon and we walked in  we were greeted by both owners with smiles and hellos. It felt very mom and pop as soon as we sat down. We chose the the bar to sit at because the bartender looked like he was having fun with customers and a SHAKEWeIGHT !!!! Haha oh and it was happy hour!! He did not disappoint ..walking us through the menu and keeping our beers ice cold!!  We got the wings!! Yummy and split the BBQ burger with bacon!! Both fantastic.  This will be a great spot for spring training. Ask for Reno behind the bar. He will turn your day around!!!

qoAsPAU56jlPRMKx7eHyCw.text: Simply put - A GREAT PLACE. The hardest decision is what to order. My fav's are the burgers, wings, sweet potato tots with pineapple aoli and the cobb salad. Great owners and staff. Don't miss Happy Hour. There's parking along side, across the street and in the parking ramp behind. :-)Greg

udwDd6O3AR0T21YQ76nSjw.text: it rained and we were outside was put into another table with another couple; but overall food was good and experience and interaction with a different couple was good... So over all was a great eating experience and the food was good!

i4-ikhXN-edsuI-8OYO43A.text: Not Bad, not great.  Typical trendy burger place.  It was a lot of food, I'll give them that.  Our server was a standard Scottsdale waitress with little patience and crappy customer service.  I could take or leave this place.

9xfv4ubtgSZEXKSJvp9t1g.text: Excellent service and food! It took a bit to seat us as a bunch of friends went together but they were very friendly and accommodating. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and did not make 1 mistake. His suggestions were simple - get the pretzel bun and add a fried egg on top of whatever you get. Needless to say, his suggestions were on point and we all had a wonderful experience! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

G4eUbAJPLS_8PbIRbKv5mw.text: Great spot for AMAZING burgers. You can dress super casual, even wear flip flops. Thanks Dave for such good service

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Heaven
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mmmmn

aRahaOibKkk7HKrjj0JvlQ.text: Only come here if you want a good pickle.   I was really excited to try this place after its 4.5 star review from over 1000 people; however, it didn't live up to my expectations at all.   We ordered chips and salsa and for an extra $2 you can get guac, but don't do it, it was bland, the chips needed salt and the salsa had no real heat.  I ordered the hatch burger which came with a hatch chili on it and cheese. That's it. No lettuce or veggies or even a spread (menu said chipotle aioli but that came with my tots, not the burger). The burger and the tots were luke warm at best.   Service was mediocre at best.

QIKvX2k6WzKDYMVxrOMzOA.text: Need a good quick dinner and did not want to pay exuberant prices.  This burger joint filled the spot.  Lots of varieties on a classic burger.  Awesome fries and great drinks.  It was super busy when I was here but I sat rather quickly at the bar and made some new acquaintances.  I had a very delicious burger.  I do not recommend the sweet tater tots...too sweet, not sure how that happened since I love sweet potato fries.  I will likely be back next time I am in the area.

TqxOnMVZxxKKtUe9RnE7hA.text: so full it hurts I come not stop eating the burgers are so good I got the ghost pepper it 10oz meat perfectly cook medium super juicy   two slices of ghost pepper cheese and so much guacamole the onion rings are some of the best crunchy and think now the milk shakes are just OK had the orange sickle to sour and and crystals of sugar or something tried the strawberry one the the wife had just OK too tasted like nest quick the server was grate but she had to be super blazed because every thing was super good to her will definitely go back

nwsuRFS_rxGTFM55IvHqXA.text: Visited again and again. Rehab Burger is my favorite.  Had the PB&J burger and as weird as it sounds... It is perfect. The sweet and savory complimented each other perfectly.   I also tried for pesto sauce for my tots and it was amazing. Another plea... Sell your sauces by the bottle! I'll be your number one customer.

tJ3RP40ZjMNPY_MBEUfGVw.text: I know it's trendy now to make a burger that has everything but the kitchen sink on it. Too big to pick up and makes a mess of everything to try, (Thanks Guy Fieri) but it just isn't for me. I ordered a burger with Thousand Island and it looked like a 55 gallon drum of Thousand Island dressinf was dumped on it. "We go big here" is what the waiter told me as I sent the inedible mess back. The service was good and staff helpful and courteous but it's a burger not a construction project.

YVgGz5EYnHOaFwNuhxm_ug.text: Awesome chips and salsa, although the yelp 'deal' is only one dollar off or regular happy hour price...but I guess when food is as bomb as it is at this place they don't need to offer a great deal to get people in here. Due to the overwhelmingly fantastic reviews of the PB&J bacon burger, I gave it a (apprehensive) try. The reviews were definitely accurate. It was delish!! A little sweet/salty kinda deal...really great! Fun place to watch a game too!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J bacon burger

RYTOl2MEZXfmfp06XCDJNA.text: Cool atmosphere, thick/juicy/tastey burger, delicious sweet potato tots, and my bartender/server/possibly-owner ended up being a pretty nice fella who supports both Uber and Lyft (a wise choice since many people leave here intoxicated). Rehab definitely has a San Diego, beachy vibe, reminiscent of Hodads. I'll return to try another of their wide array of burgers for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Now that&#39;s a burger! The tots are good too...

bR_K3d6bqbFijAiXoX9kSA.text: This place is so good! Great food great vibe. Overall a super enjoyable experience, servers are great super friendly and helpful. Food is delicious, burgers are grilled and delicious, fries crisp and addictive, and the best onion rings I've ever had! 10/10 would come again!

hdDFRzxXrqQdi-sq5vsMUQ.text: Food was great..but the wait for those burgers was long!! Our taters were cold, but the waitress did bring us hot and fresh ones upon request. Overall everyone enjoyed the food and would definitely return...but bring your patience.

AoKeJ0sevT2uy53oCf54Aw.text: Yum yum yum! Fantastic burgers, delicious sides, and great service! Heard a fair bit about this place and I'm happy to say it did not disappoint. Will return without question :)

sgfJEHjx-rgq53-ql6JVVg.text: Happy hour 7 days a week from 11-6 ToDays visit is for a rehab burger Saturday nights can be tuff in the desert

Qi5QQMwey0UQHUcgDO8nxQ.text: Great staff and great burgers. Try the peanut butter and jelly burger. It sounds weird but it's delicious. Perfect hangover cure.

4dF7nY0x_SQFJtlXzKds1Q.text: I had heard such good things about Rehab, but with expensive, mediocre food and dismal service I was very disappointed with my visit.  My friend and I decided to stop here before a Giants game at nearby Scottsdale Stadium. It was totally packed and there was an estimated 20 minute wait. Not bad, we had about an hour before the game started. Once seated, we all decided on our food quickly, but no waitress was to be found. It had to be at least 15 minutes of sitting alone in our little corner table before the waitress came. I ordered the smaller relapse backyard BBQ burger. 20 minutes later we finally had our food. By the time we had finished our meal and paid the check, we were late to the game.   The food was bleh. No flavor, my burger was cooked well-done when I had asked for medium. The spicy pineapple BBQ sauce was gross. Whoever thought of that flavor combo should be fired. It just didn't work. The onion ring on the burger was soggy. The fries were bland as well. My friend wasn't happy with his bacon cheeseburger either. His burger too was overcooked and flavorless. For the quality of food we were served, we way overpaid. Our total was around $35 for two people.   We came to Rehab thinking we could: A. Save some money, by eating before the game. and B. Have a great burger. Neither of those things happened. We should've just had eaten at the game. Maybe they had an off day, but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

3YwumWpbTqD1HOaP1ou8Lw.text: This place is all hype!  I waited over hour for the driest burger I've ever had.  Service was marginal, they had nba on tv during March madness just shows how out of touch they are. I don't get it???? Why such a high rating when this place blows! Don't waste your time!  It's just hype. Say it with me...I ain't going to rehab, l say no no no....

0_QYc3W5xpqF1i_vNS0_jA.text: To start with,  the hostess and server were very attentive.  Server knew his beer list well. I ordered the jalapeno popper burger and it was delicious.  I'm loyal to a burger place back home so it's difficult for me to order burgers elsewhere.  This was worth it. Burger was cooked perfectly, spiced well and delicious.  The sweet potato tots were very good too. Fast service and great food.  Would definitely recommend to others.

454LCi0mLwaRfVLzUhC1Dg.text: I'm shocked that I have to give this place two stars. My husband and I were so excited to try it out but we were extremely let down. The drink I had -the margarita/Martini was not good at all and both of our burgers were extremely overcooked. We honestly could make a better burger at home! The vibe and the whole idea behind the restaurant is awesome but they really need to work on the burgers! We really wanted to enjoy this place but it fell very short :/

LJo6ZlYrwm11zkgpR_fMDA.text: Holy Schnikees this place ROCKS!!! The burgers are a dream, the atmosphere was fun and they have a great beer selection. The manager checked in and made sure we had a good time. Servings, sauces and selection give this 5 stars! Solid!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Front entrance.

P6cg69IBCZTNYwzZKwKGgA.text: Overall, less than impressed. Having been to great places in Chicago, NY, ATL, LA, basically everywhere, my expectations are always high. Food was overcooked and dry. Sauces were all over the place and weren't anything special. The one with pineapple was just weird.   Highlight of my meal was sweet potato tots. I'm a fan of tots and sweet potatoes. Not sure if they made them in house, but they were good. Beer selection was not focused on quality micros, mostly all main stream junk. Had a Four Peaks that was decent, but that was literally the only microbrew that they carried. Disappointing.   Overall, would definitely not be back unless I had no choice. Pick another place. Underwhelmed.

Yy6eoVAAeDET5p1SxJ0OAg.text: Oh burger heaven, how can I ever repay you?  I love my burgers.... and what can I say?? I am impressed...   The Burger... the POBLANO buger.... man oh man, that burger has the right amount of kick, and the burger itself melts in your mouth... just typing this review makes me want to drive over there and get one. But they have a HUGE selection of burgers you can try, and the option to make your own burger. Get the pretzel bun, you won't be disappointed.   The Fries... I believe they're called "Skin-On fries," well let me tell you about these fries... They're the perfect balance of soft and crispy, and that mermaid dust... I only dream about it. You're probably asking yourself, "What's mermaid dust?" Well my friends let me tell you, its this magical dust that they put on their fries... and it's best flavor you'll ever taste... I can't even describe how perfect it is. Not to mention that it goes great with the spicy ketchup. YUM The Drink- I got a Dos Equis... and that was only because I was craving it. But I do know that they have a decent selection of beers, and other drinks. They have excellent daily drink specials... and that  is number one in my book.   The Staff... I would have to agree with some of the previous reviewers, they're not in your face... but they're attentive. And they're up for recommending burgers for you. The service overall was impressive, and VERY quick. Super friendly.   Will I come back? HECK YES. I might actually head over there right now. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great happy hour, and good burgers!

CvgxNfqIPNk0i8rq5Ic1ng.text: Best sweet potato tots in the world and the burger with Mac and cheese on it? Epic! Great bar and patio seating that's pup friendly!

7ChkI9tRFCfkLQYSOFN6PQ.text: Decent burgers.  Long wait.  Pretzel bun was good. Chili cheese fries was pretty good as well.  Cool concept and nice variety but the meat could use some improvement... Maybe five guys is just hard to beat.

onekjBtzbw4iUV30qEmeXA.text: Hit the spot on so many levels,  fresh ground chuck and delicious pretzel bun yummmm.  Great ambiance, great service.  Really  feel the therapy working. Can't wait to relapse and come back :) Good job.

zTwxF1tVW07PMZ-zoUN0pA.text: I love the burgers here. Always make my burger right, medium well. Great fun atmosphere. sevice is never lacking. the servers are attentive and quick. they are always smiling. manager always checks on each table. restaurant is clean as well as the bathrooms. easy to find parking. overall excellent experience every single time.

0k5SqPuJI7UoqjYP4Fh4tA.text: I recently went on a trip to Scottsdale and hit this place up again.  I can't even say enough about this place it seriously is so good.  Everytime I go to Arizona the family wants to go here.  This time I got the pbj&bacon burger.  I know it may sound gross but it is so good I crave this burger.  My hubby got the Mac Gnarly burger and he absolutely loved it.  My boys got classic bacon cheeseburgers and they were in heaven.  Trust me this place is so so so so amazing!!!!

xgM8x1xF5G8Ej40exfZDZA.text: I had the PB and J burger with sriracha and bacon - GREAT!!!!  I have to go back now to try the sweet potato fries!  The bacon was high quality and cooked just right!!  I wish I could have had a beer with this, but had to hit the road back to Tucson.  The burger was cooked just right, and it the oozing pb and j ran onto my fries for dipping.  It had the perfect combo of sweet and spice.  Good service, nice ambiance - I kinda felt like I was on vacation on the beach - a nice desert oasis.  I want to go back and try more of the burgers - there are so many to choose from!

t-MnunNWbbjIJmN2iO26dg.text: I'm so sad! Everyone - literally everyone - raves about this place. We've tried to check it out several times, but it's always been packed. Fortunately one day we got off of work a little early and were able to beat the dinner rush. I got the Jalapeno Popper burger and it was such a disappointment. I was expecting fresh fried jalapenos, but they were the frozen/pickled peppers with no taste and to top it off the burger was dry and bland. And then the final straw was the soda was flat and not enough syrup. I mentioned that to the server and she replaced it with a different selection, and even that was flat. We were super hoping to love this place like everyone else, but just didn't meet par with what we'd expect from a burger place. However, the music selection was great - and if we were craving the SoCal vibes and there's not a long line, we might try it again, but I'll just stick with the basic burger next time.

f2A2_nqwo1pUcukZEwfVcQ.text: So a friend introduced me to Rehab. burger when I came to visit Scottsdale and she couldn't stop talking about the PB&J burger and sweet potato tots. At first I was skeptical at the sound of such a burger but then decided since I love beef and also love PB and J and let's be real, who doesn't love sweet potato tots, that I would give this burger a try. The Burger was Amazing! It was cooked to perfection and blended well with the PB and J and oh I forgot to mention, Siracha! The burgers we ordered were ready in a timely fashion and the service there was great. The menu had many great options, and was very fairly priced. Would definitely recommended Rehab Burger to all my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB and J and Siracha burger

JOO88knU7XzygrLB1kG4Dg.text: Our first visit here. Staff was very friendly. Salyna (pronounced Selena) was extremely nice, efficient, and checked back frequently to refill tea and water. Ordered the MacNCheese burger on pretzel bun. Since I am retired from a national restaurant chain that specializes in hamburgers, I'm discriminating in my opinion. It was an excellent hamburger - we order the relapse size and my wife had a little of it, and I was still full with my portion. The meat - cooked medium - had a little pink, which is what we wanted, and the MacNCheese was flavorful with a good kick from the sirachi sauce. Toppings were fresh, fries were tasty. The fry portion that came with the burger wasn't huge, so if you are a big fry eater you may want to add an extra order. Saw the onion rings go by to another table and they looked large and fresh. Had a frozen margarita which was well blended (probably a machine which we like) with a tasty margarita mix, lots of salt on the rim, and a large portion. We arrived at 11:15AM  on a Thursday morning and by noon they were on a wait. Just a note: we had a small medical service dog with us  and they were very accommodating and didn't hassle us. We will definitely go back and try other burgers and sides.

eYxr_LJ7FU_jtRPFAevP6w.text: I have been here twice, both times we sat at the bar.  Both times not stupid busy but busy enough.  Our burgers are always amazing and I love that they have so many other options to choose from for people who do not eat burgers and such (like my vegetarian sister)  So if I were to come I could get my burger as usual and they could have all the time in the world to read up on the rest of the menu.  I like the hangover burger the best because I love eggs especially over easy on my burgers.  Kind of a constant staple for me lately.  I have to go and try their shakes and pot brownies still. so once I try more and the desserts I will add more to this review. But if you are looking for a great burger spot in Scottsdale this is my first choice for this city!  As far as service goes, nothing worth raving about but its never horrible. Consistent is the word for their service but not persistent if that makes any sense. So if you need a refill...Speak up.

yQnypUu_BEaBXOtVlFV6nA.text: Crazy good!  We love bringing family and friends here.  Service, employees, quality of food are all fantastic.

KKHnkhIFEm2PxbisoL7INA.text: Very good food! Sweet potato tots are to die for! I was looking forward to trying a burger that I has seen on yelp in a picture, to find out that it is a Sunday special only, but the pulled pork that burger that I did get was amazing, I had a yummy lunch the next day too! Service was good, I was surprised by their uniforms or spaghetti strapped belly shirts, but I guess that is what adds uniqueness to an establishment. The place was packed, so obviously they are doing something right. Very upbeat establishment, but parking was hard to come by.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Porkster burger (minus a few bites ;) )

uqnWZtlQPsoAiPu79ulJRQ.text: Did I ask them to cook my burger perfectly... no, but they did!!!  As a matter of fact they never did ask me how I wanted my 10 ounce burger cooked, but when it came out and I had my first taste I knew it was love at first bight! I dont think I have ever had a better cooked or tastier burger in my life! The carmlized onions were bliss and the pretzle bun had just the right heft to hold up to this massive burger  The place was only 11 days old on our visit so when the Pig Wings didnt fly, that misfire was excused, but with a tad more work this intersting cut of pork could soar. The "wings" were just a tad dry and the sauce was one dimentional, but I like the concept.   Our server offered the wedge salad $5 and said it was good- she was flat out lying, it was amazing! By far the very best wedge I ever ate, made myself, or served any one of my customers. Our group of 3 were still talking about it 3 days later, and we are all foodies that work in the Biz.  One of the owners stopped by the table to chat, that was a nice touch and her crazy beautifull smile was a more then welcome addition to our lunch.  Is this the best restaurant in town... Heck No! it's far to cassual to compete with the very best, but its my new favorite place in Old Town. jv

9ii8cOfRHg61SST4c-T2mg.text: This seems like a place to go if you want to feel like a hipster.  Turns out, I have no desire to be a hipster.  The food was only subpar and the service matched. The only way I'd go back was if it were on a weeknight so hopefully both my food and myself would get more attention. Not worth the half hour Friday night wait.

kUQ15Lyi4toc5t2e8DtVOQ.text: OMG!! So delish. We shared the Hangover burger, salad, sweet potatoes tots and the corn. Everything was excellent. Paired with a great beer. Wish I lived here to be able to come back more often. Great decor, service and atmosphere.

uGBQ4HTFOjplecBo-JvUNQ.text: Absolutely amazing! I can't say one bad thing about this place.  The inside decor is very cute, made me feel like I was on vacation. Every menu item that came out of the kitchen looked great. This was my first time here and it will not be my last.  The portion size was big, but thats never anything that bothers me! The pictures speak for themselves!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. One half of the bar
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Club sandwich plus avocado and fries
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pulled Pork with fries

sy7oaYK4odOhPdfhoOsPIQ.text: "H-hey, man. Cou'I cop a bite of that? Nah, nah I ain't fiendin'! I mean, y-you know I got you next time..."  You tell yourself, "I could stop any time I wanted to." But you don't. You don't want to stop.  And this is how it starts.  You KNOW most people get just a cheeseburger OR a BBQ pulled pork sandwich, but you had to go and mix them, and now you can't go back. The interaction of ChB and B2Q coursing through your veins gives you the kind of rush that keeps you up at night. Your friends don't understand, but how could they?  "Just one more porkster burger... people do it all the time, right?" Once you've inevitably built up a tolerance to the BBQ pork-topped cheeseburger, and you're jonesin' for more, Rehab is there. You can start doing 10 oz. of patty a day instead of 5 oz. like it's nothin'.  As you spiral further and further out of control, speedballs of sweet potato tots mixed with BBQ pork, pineapple aoli, pretzel rolls, and brioche buns... the kinda shit you'd only heard about... it's all a part of your daily routine.  One day you're a successful young hopeful, the next you're pulling tricks for porksters.  Warning: Rehab once, Relapse forever.

AyR9UQ-7kDMAAbLNMb5mLg.text: Great place to go if you want to be adventurous and try something different. PBJ burger was good and fun to try. Boyfriend had the mac and cheese burger which was also good but the mac and cheese was kind of bland. Sweet potatoes tots are killer and come with interesting sauces. Great location. Parking can be difficult at peak times.

CaWbuuzzaJImVex2y8K_eg.text: I wish we had one of these in the SF area! The burgers are amazing!!!! I have a hard time paying over $10-12 for a burger but these burgers are so so good! Worth it, and the staff and manager are great with attention and hospitality!

MUbmb07mAitFGpDl68nPLQ.text: Okay,  ya know when you walk in before noon and it's pretty packed AND there's a table with tired,  looking,  hard-working crew (maybe landscapers) all seated looking full..it's gonna be plenty to eat!    So,  two in our party ordered the PB&J, bacon & Sriracha burger.  I ordered the Bbq burger with the chef's creation of spicy pineapple bbq sauce. So you need to know the "Rehab" burger is 10oz of flame broiled deliciousness and the "Relapse" burger much more manageable (but still plenty) with a 5oz patty.  You get a choice of a brioche or pretzel bun..we all opted for the pretzel bun which was perfectly soft but held together well for the burger that definitely is smothered & covered in the respective sauces.   A bit after ordering we realized waitress hadn't asked us of the size of burger & after checking,  she'd assumed the guys wanted the larger size (one didn't) & mine the regular size.  So,  PB&J burger had plenty of thick, crisp bacon, no skimping there!  The grape jelly & peanut butter melt with the hot burger creating a bit of a slippery handful!  One in party said too much pb...he said would order again, without the pb. The other said would absolutely order again.  Mine,  absolutely smothered in tangy bbq sauce, not too spicy & cooked perfectly!  Sauce everywhere!   They did great job with correct meat temp. All had the sweet potato tots-delish! The sweet & savory dipping sauces also very good.  We had elsewhere to be so couldn't take leftovers but was stuffed full!   Ok,  so this is a little thing but in the restrooms they had actual towels to wipe your paws off..this was very nice!   Fun,  surfer - dude decor, good music and bar! Fun place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum! Sweet potatoes &amp; Bbq burger!

BfjGXEhlNphOHwa5Xm4q0g.text: Went to rehab for a burger with the family. There is ample parking next to the restaurant in a public parking garage which is easy. We opted for burger (what else) and took the mac-n-cheese and mac gnarly burgers. I had the sweet potato tater tots as a side. The burger was super delish - cooked to order, full of taste in patty and fresh toppings and a great bun. The tatter tots were also great were sweet and well flavored. Service was attentive and prompt.  Overall - super yummy w good service. I'm hooked. Will be back every time I'm in town.

YaPcuwadAFrrQabntFEz2A.text: Met some family at Rehab Burger and was very excited to give the place a try. Upon entering, the vibe is lively and the setting is eye popping. Impressed at this point. Our server made her way over and took our orders and again, impressed to this point. She was outgoing and offered a few recommendations. We started with the guacamole and chips. Nice to see a little yelp discount on the chips but not very impressed by the item. Chips and guacamole were both just okay in my book. For our burgers, I rolled with the PB Burger and others had the Blue Cheese Burger and the Burger covered in BBQ Pork I believe (sorry forgot the name). As for my burger, I loved it. The PB was oozing out and oh so yummy. The recommended bun was on point and the fries were good. As for the other burgers, the Blue Cheese filled Burger just missed the mark. It was very dry, I mean very dry and felt bad for family who ordered it. The Burger covered in BBQ Pork was good. Again, burger was a little dry but the pork was good. Overall, the PB Burger was amazing but the others just missed. I would give the spot another try but at this time, won't be giving any super praise.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB Burger and fries were on point
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Damn good PB Burger, loved it.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yep, that is a flip flop :)

Z1es5Utw0l32AXuMR4xDTg.text: Note: Flavor Explosion  Not for the faint of heart. These unusual concoctions will leave you with an euphoric peaceful experience that may send you into a food coma.   Must try's:  *PB&J cheeseburger  *Hawaiian cheeseburger *Mac&Cheeseburger *sweet potato tots "lil pillows of goodness" - Tim Thurell  WARNING: These burgers have been proven to be additive, thus making the name of the establishment ironic.  Most drinks are not for woman who are or may become pregnant.   Enjoy the company as you may imbibe as a community at one table.  This establishment is Jason E. Lee approved
