Ps63TPBYzBmhp0xYBYiY4g.text: Excellent dinner stop my last night in town! Samm was our fantastic waitress. She really knows her stuff and is very friendly and patient! I had the backyard bbq burger with sweet potato tots and my husband got the ghost cheeseburger with fries. We both really enjoyed our food and the casual atmosphere outside on the patio. The chipotle aioli was dynamic in flavor but not overly so.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Backyard BBQ burger

EQGwL1w4Iok12X8BCPzbzA.text: Literally one of the best burger joints I've been to. Food was awesome and service was great. No complaints at all!

ZNqsxhA8N_5pivjVgwaQnA.text: I'm not a huge burger fan but I was excited to try RBT. I found the name to be quite clever and photos of the burgers and sweet potato tots looked extraordinary.   FOOD Burgers come in 5oz "Relapse" or 10oz "Rehab" for a few dollars more. I got the Philly cheese burger, which didn't have all the toppings I had seen in a photo on Yelp, but perhaps there was a change with ingredients or the customer had a special request.   The sweet potato tater tots were on point, but they seemed to be overly-sweetened. I liked how pretzel buns were an option and it came with a quarter of a large pickle.     ATMOSPHERE The place had a hipster, tavern, beach-desert, bar-like vibe. The table we were seated at was wobbly, as was my chair. Due to minimal lighting, it's not an ideal place for foodie photos.   SERVICE I thought service was going to be decent, but I wasn't impressed. Our waitress was nice but effort regarding water service was minimal. It wasn't very busy at 3 pm on a Friday but it took over 30 minutes before our meal arrived. I would suggest ordering over the phone for anyone trying to swing by for a 1-hour lunch break.     PARKING There's a public parking lot nearby. Finding the entrance was a bit tricky since most of the lanes were closed off.  OVERALL I like the concept, creativity, and presentation but I felt that service and taste could be improved. I could see how some people love this place, but I found it to be average in quality and value.

JZjTAjHWgyE70HQ4PAUk8A.text: This would be a 3.5 star review if yelp would enhance their app.  Service was great and the food was coming out at a face pace, but when you have the word "burger" in your restaurants name you better deliver a world class burger because that's what everyone is going to expect.  Our food was just good and not great.  I like the concept of a rehab burger or a relapse burger with the rehab being larger, but there wasn't anything special with their ground and was just OK.  The worst of it was their mac and cheese fell flat and had a grainy texture instead of a creamy texture like you would anticipate.  Neat place on the inside with kind of a Hawaiian theme.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wedge and Mac and cheese plate
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior

j91dqsdiPcyQHVlhcMTk_Q.text: Thinking about one right now. For big burgers made with special toppings it's fantastic. Super nice servers and bartenders, great happy hour too. I'm sure anyone can find a burger they are would enjoy here, they could make you nearly anything. High quality ingredients and beer for a great value.

JGasqbU5fJds5TQCUWUmSQ.text: After from a few rounds of Topgolf. I check my Yelp app for a local restaurant and I came across Rehab Burger Therapy.  I saw that it had 4+ stars over 1000 positive reviews. I figured I might as well give it a try. I'm so happy that I did because my guess and I was having a pretty good time. And it helped bring a good close to our  already good day.   We got there in the middle of happy hour and there was many happy people ( Lol ). Very good atmosphere mixed with good service. I really enjoyed the decor of the place from The different styles of bicycles, surfboards to the oversize model airplanes. Nice casual grunge thing going on and I liked it along with some good music.   Very good food with many options from gourmet burgers to draft beers even specialty drinks for adults was very good and many options. I started off with a Coco Nutty cocktail drink and I followed it up with the Porkster gourmet burger which has spicy pulled pork on a medium rare burger with sweet potato tater tot's. It so worked for me. I was so full. Definitely done for the day. No complaints. I will be returning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Decor...Nice
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The porkster with Sweet potato tater tot&#39;s
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coco nutty

aQ4YxNsGyIFl8I32Uvh0DA.text: Highly recommended by friends, I decided to stop here for my first meal on vacation in AZ! It really hit the spot.  Lots of outdoor and indoor seating. Super friendly and attentive servers. Extensive menu with lots of options. I ordered the pig "wings" which are really chopped pieces of ribs. I enjoyed the texture as they were fall off the bone but grilled enough to be slightly dry. However they were doused in too much sauce which was a bit overly sweet. should have skipped this. 3/5 Then I had the must have PB&J bacon burger on a pretzel bun with sweet potato tots. No regrets whatsoever here. It's messy and I had to cut my burger into fourths to eat it. And the PB&j gets everywhere so it's easier to mop it up this way with a fork. Sounds weird but it's a great flavor combo ! Especially if you like pb&j and burgers separately, you'll probably enjoy this just as much as I did. The sweet potato tots were a little softer/soggier than I would have liked but they were still super enjoyable. I ditched the other two sauces that came with it and mopped up all my remaining PB&j with the tots. Me thinks I'm gonna start eating all my fries with peanut butter from now on if possible :p so yum! The weather was perfect for sitting outside and I really enjoyed my first meal in AZ! I'm a fatty when on vacation~

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J bacon burger! Helllaaaa good. No regrets. Dip your tots in the PB&amp;j too!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork &#34;wings&#34; they&#39;re really ribs! Too much sauce that was too sweet. But fall off the bone !

S8r0CuchBO_xmEcAe8kCOA.text: It's hot out here!  Needed a place to get a cold drink and get out of the sun for a few minutes. Stepped into this little gem and ordered a cold draft. I can't say I was really hungry but she asked what i wanted to eat. I told her whatever the house specialty was.  Well I got it.   Out came a peanut butter and jelly covered bacon cheeseburger with sriracha sauce. Yeah that's what I said. My tastebuds were so confused I couldn't even tell if I liked it until the 3rd bite. So many different flavors.  However the more bites I took the more I could respect its flavors working together. By the last couple of bites I found myself putting a little of the PBJ that had squeezed out onto the bite I was about to take.   I gotta say, pretty darn good and a memorable dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

erg-vmRWoBAiD4m8pN2W3A.text: I was a huge fan of this place when they opened. Now I can say that it is not worth the price. Prices have gone out of control on some items. Not gone up a dollar or two. Doubled for the same items as when they opened a few years ago. There are a lot of burgers on the menu that are over $18! What's next a $100 burger? And that's just it. They are just burgers. No special grind of prime beef just chuck. They will surely ruin a good thing by getting too greedy. The reason this restaurant was popular in the first place was it had decent prices and good portion size. Too bad. I am so sorry to see them take this direction. Good while it lasted.

m-QAwcBJKQKxyZ5bYdfcog.text: Rehab is a fun place to go! Their ghost burger is a just have! Sweet potato anything is great and have fun with their many sauce to dip your sides in!

lfpHvOm-uummNCQ78a5AmA.text: Solidly good burgers, some creative creations and the nice choice of 5 oz or 10 oz size to suit your level of hunger.  While good, the burgers seemed to lack that flavor "pop" that really grabs you when you have a burger that really stands out.  Especially lacking was a distinct beef flavor from the burgers.  The burger itself was actually kind of bland with the toppings taking the limelight.  Definitely not disappointing but I really did expect more when I read many of the previous glowing reviews.  A plus was the fast, friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jalapeno Popper Burger
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cool beach vibe.

1Ia1oeD4pKjjCt9MvpZDeA.text: 5 stars for everything I tasted. Onion rings, know poblano burger, salad with and awesome spicy sweet vinaigrette!

2Lpk3x9i-9jgGfltxNrGWA.text: The decor is like your at the beach reminded me a lot of a beachfront So Cal location!  I love it!  Took the dare and tried the peanut butter jelly and bacon burger!  It sounds weird but once you taste it, it's freaking amazing!  One of the people with us had the hatch burger, I found it to be a little plain.  I sampled the porkster burger as well and I have to say fan freaking tastic!  The pig wings make a super tasty appetizer too!! Def will be making this my new burger hangout....sorry zenburger

c_qQ8R3rS0CcpJbWn3rnPA.text: Great atmosphere but we felt the food was average. The burgers were dry. Served without veggies (unless you ask for them). Fries and sweet potato fries were both ok. Gluten free bun was cool but so dry that I took it off. I'd recommend lettuce wrapped over the GF bun. They have lots of sauces which were fun to try. I wouldn't rush back but might try it again if we were in the area.

nIfZnlw00e2PF-vL2A6tQQ.text: Damn good burger, especially if you're nursing a hangover! Huge portions, great food!

lSfTQeYaGMopDPc4Ie9L1A.text: We went here for lunch over the weekend, having heard great things. The place was absolutely packed, which seemed a strong indicator of the quality of the food, and the service was great. Naturally, I was expecting the burger to go hard (this place does have the word "burger" in the name, after all), but, wow, what a disappointment.  I had the Know Poblano Burger. First, let me say that the combination of grilled poblano and manchego cheese was excellent. If that had been all I ate, this would be a different review, though. The problem with flavorful toppings is that you cannot use them to disguise an under-seasoned burger, and that's exactly what I got.  There was virtually no salt or pepper on the patty -- a big issue when the beef is 3/4 of the actual burger. Does anyone in the kitchen have basic culinary training? I'm not even a trained chef, and I know that if you forget to season the main ingredient and attempt to cover it up with ingredients that are seasoned, the whole dish comes out bland. You can't put spicy poblano and salty, melted cheese on top of a flavorless puck of beef and expect me to like it.  Even the bun was soggy, which is mind boggling. How does a place that specializes in burgers not know to put some sort of leafy green between the meat and the bun? This is textbook stuff.  Also, the place was hot. When there's a weekend heat advisory, you might want to turn your thermostat down a few notches -- especially when the restaurant is packed with warm bodies.  By the way, that second star is for the fries, which were perfectly cooked.

dsybJZBl428lZzEPfsmFQQ.text: As we walked in this fun 'sports bar' like restaurant, it felt like we were in California with the surf boards on the wall.   The staff was very welcoming and friendly. We were immediately offered the happy hour specials.   There were so many burger options!  We settled on the Mac Narly double burger. I split it with my sisters. I was totally satisfied with 1/3d of a burger on the pretzel bun.   We tried the sweet potato tots. They melted in my mouth.   I can't wait to come back.

M3MFldRsqJYdTYkD52TvKQ.text: Great burgers and fries, also surprisingly good fish tacos. Cocktails a bit overpriced for size and strength. Service was very friendly. Music is too loud, sit outside of you can!

nDfOEN5ZUQviDMoyOGx8iA.text: Based off of Yelp, we decided to come here. We were not disappointed:  Pros: (+) Were seated right away by a friendly hostess (+) Our waitress was very friendly and attentive (+) Had some kind of peach beer that was absolutely delicious (+) My boyfriend and I both had the porkster. He added egg and bacon on it. Both on the white bun. (I really wanted the add-ons but was trying to make it at least a little healthier, lol). Half pulled pork half beef, with a super yummy bbq sauce and cheddar cheese. mmmm so good. Absolutely no complaints. (+) The sweet potato tater tots were amazing! I could eat those all day. And I chose the spicier of the sauces, super yummy (+) Cool funky decor, nice atmosphere  Neutral: ( ) The Pig Wings (Pork on a stick doused with peachy bbq sauce) - it was just okay. The sauce was a bit too much (completely doused, the menu description wasn't lying). The pork was tender, but I wasn't blown away.  This place was delicious. Top two burger places on my list (first is Holsteins in Las Vegas if you would like to read my review).  I would definitely come here again when I'm in the area, and looking forward to it!

2lhL0gfhWzhMFNq1RGomWA.text: I've loved my food every time I've come here, I love the "normal" burgers but have also branched out and had the mac and cheese and pb&j burgers, love em all.

yTVmoTCY9jSvMme2e8Tk7g.text: As a non red meat eater, I love Rehab. They offer many of there hamburgers with chicken or turckey. I personally love the Mac Gnarly Burger and sweet potatoes.

RhoUOHHIakM_ZX3g81r_Sg.text: I'm giving Rehab Burger 5 stars, first off because their staff is awesome!  Probably the best service I've had in Old Town.  My 3rd visit, and twice Melanie has been our server, she's the best.  Wings, burgers, fish tacos, and the spinach salad, all delicious!  But you have to try the 'Chili Verde Con Pollo' appetizer!  Make sure you bring a friend to share!  Great Happy Hour & patio, cool decor, best of all, no smoking patio!!

cZv2WTLpC04ZWPZxeEprHQ.text: Huge burgers super good quality meat love the sweet potato tots and how everything tastes like its grilled

JxuC2XMgddFmZSXTCPZjYw.text: Very satisfying burger! Definitely one of the best around the old town area. Drinks were okay. I ordered a frozen margarita and it was mostly just tequila with nothing much. Overall, I've had fun experiences during the day and night and would definitely  bring family and friends.

zeN3JuCafPjCDjDs49aT4g.text: Jesus* has returned as a savior and fry cook and in Scottsdale, AZ turning ground beef into patties of bliss. I know this because no one else can make as epic a combo of perfectly cooked beef and just the pepper bite as their hatch chile burger. That more places don't have sweet potato tots is a crime against man. Do yourself a huge favor and get the tots.  *Jesus Ramirez from Tempe

mzLHTwrEm3vP5L-XLeJOPA.text: Our 10 mile drive through rush-hour traffic is so worth every mile once I bite down on your burgers.  Great servers who always care that they get my orders right, but also take a moment to chit-chat when they have time instead of hiding behind counters and only being reactive servers.  Your cooks are always on point because the many times I've visited, never once has food come out less than perfect.  And best of all, the very reasonable prices are so appreciated.  I get the best quality burger I've found here in Phoenix, jumbo wings graced with outstanding custom sauces, and at prices lower most anyone else.  I seriously can't go back to Long Wong's, or even my past favorite, Buffalo Wild Wings.  Rehab is THAT good!  If I had to complain about something (and I had to grab at straws to find something); is that I guess I'd ask that you introduce a hotter version of your hot sauce, because I typically go with people who like things a lot hotter than I do.  Oh, and that I'm still looking for a replacement for a "Wild Wing Cafe" wing sauce flavor I'd had back in Charlotte, NC a few years ago that they called Jalapeno Cheddar.  It seemed to be a mix of Velveeta, chopped jalapeno pepper, and hot sauce perhaps?  Whatever it was it was fabulous, and I miss it something fierce!

ErubiKSbjTB-v0vY3BONDQ.text: Drove 45miles for a big disappointment. After so much hype around the web about their burgers we decided to try it. It wasn't close to what we were expecting! The burgers looked poorly constructed and didn't fit the pictures online, not to mention it took them 32minutes to serve us our food, and we went on a Sunday so there wasn't much of a crowd. The taste of the burger was 3/5 the fries and tots 1/5 the customer service was 4/5 except the wait time was horrible and gets 0/5 definitely will not be returning sorry!

TdCOBZZaqu-Po24Q4eJWig.text: Excellent.  Food is outstanding, fresh and oh so tasty. New waitstaff, just as excellent as my last visit.

G14eTCEjdVW8OyWfhkXPbQ.text: Had high expectations after all the reviews and wasn't disappointed .  The mac n cheese burger is to die fir, better than PBJ one, which was amazing.  Fun and great food.

65th1FHr0c8b3BIeXlZOQg.text: Customer service was over the top . The burgers were imaginative and downright fabulous! I have never had sweet potato tator tots but now I can't wait to have them again . Ask for some of their dipping sauces or the spicy ketchup. We will be back!

gAEyYqv5P0aS9DFdqAnisQ.text: always good food and good service! My boyfriend had a hawaiian chicken sandwich and I split the wings with a friend. Soooo good! Can't wait to go back.

kqNivsNFnFHqQQh0-WD3Iw.text: Had the backyard bbq burger (pineapple bbq, onion ring, cheese) which was amazing. It is served with a choice of side and I chose Jamaican sweet corn also delicious. Also had Philly cheeseburger the best Philly cheese steak in AZ. Cannot wait to come back and try other burgers and bring the rest of the family and friends. Nice island vibe. Should play ialoharadio.com even better.

Ef94UMXqS9RKuM_hALCdDg.text: This place is officially too crowded and food quality is suffering. A recent burger eaten by dining companion was greyish, looking more fast food color than fresh meat color. My pasta dish also suffered from under seasoning and not enough alfredo flavor. Seems like every tourist that still remains in Scottsdale is trying to eat at this tiny restaurant.

Oif2RZ6w8aIWgznpRzndcA.text: OMG. Do yourself a favor and go here when you need rehab or just want a relapse.   I shared an order of chips and salsa, as they gave us a check in offer. The chips were hefty (thick goodness) and the salsa tasty. I made a comment at the time we were eating these that they were almost like pita chips.   Then my Hawaiian burger arrived. I had ordered the pretzel bun on the recommendation of our waitress (who was very helpful and attentive), and then I worried about it until the moment that I took my first bite. Wow. The blend of flavors of the Hawaiian with the pretzel bun was perfect, and those sweet potato tots were addictive!  The place was packed on a Thursday evening; maybe having happy hour all day long on Thursday had something to do with it, but my guess is the tasty food brings people here. The decor on the walls and ceiling gives the place a real beachy Ron Jon feel. I'm not a big fan of the high chairs and table arrangement, but there are "normal" tables and chairs here too; we just ended up with the high ones. Big patio outside and plenty of space inside.  I didn't see a lot of parking spaces other than a few right in front. Most people were parking on the street, and the line stretched down a few blocks.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hawaiian! Aloha!

8tgxYF3xMvsKypJwDbhHMg.text: Service was very disappointing for me a few days ago. I asked for a table and the lady pulled the menu out of my hands and told me there was no tables available outside or in and would be a twenty to thirty minute wait. I looked at my coworkers and decided to to go to another place to eat and as we approached the patio we saw two empty tables and a whole bar stool area empty ... was very upset because I was looking forward to the tator tots and onion rings.

_oatFpqqQFpSkXM-OGqobA.text: One of he best burger places in Scottsdale! Atmosphere is very beachy, makes you think that you are on a tropical island! Very friendly and helpful waiters. The food is absolutely excellent! I got the Spicy Mac n Cheese burger with the sweet potato tater tots. Both were amazing!! We came to watch football, and they turned the tv to the game we wanted. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

z7ILlfNZYbIxVWHotuflAw.text: Friggin awesome spot! Great service. Ridiculous burgers. Come hungry!!!!! We got The pulled pork burger, the ghost burger, and the dude next to us got the double decker monster. Obnoxiously large burgers. So good.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. What the fuck

6j0GLqxv5bINMgbtsx-rDA.text: Hubby had never been here before and had been wanting to try it so we decided to go on our way to the aquarium. I had already been here before and knew how good their burgers or so I was looking forward to it. I also knew to come hungry so it was a good thing that I skipped breakfast! This time around I opted for the Philly cheese burger on a pretzel bun. The shaved ribeye paired with the provolone cheese and sauteed peppers and onions was a match made in heaven. The burger was cooked perfectly and the dollop of cheese whiz they topped it with made me think I was back in Philly. Hubby ordered the Chili cheeseburger on the traditional brioche bun. We decided to split half-and-half and I'm glad we did. The chili was full of flavor and topped with cheese and sour cream. One of us got the sweet potato tots and the other opted for  onion rings and I would be hard-pressed to say which was my favorite. Both were delicious! Neither one of us could finish all of our burgers so we had a pretty good size takeout container to take back to our furry daughter back home. Service was really good and even though they were extremely crowded our server did a good job of checking up on us every now and then. Hubby enjoyed it (as I knew he would!) and can't wait to return to try one of the other many burgers that he wanted.

Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Philly cheeseburger
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

E4M4Y3W2iaEdQ4jbvSbSZA.text: I've gotta say...this place is pretty good! Huge burgers and the sweet potato tots are to die for!  Great causal beachy vibe! I had the mike tai (pretty strong) and the bacon and blue burger on a pretzel bun!  Great quick service!

HdKn50CO-Fv3atRfT_ajvw.text: So everyone in Scottsdale raves about this place, and when we by chance wandered past it, we had to stop and see what all the excitement was about.   First of all, this place feels like a bar more than a restaurant - just some to keep in mind if you're bringing the young kids.  It's not an obnoxious bar though, but possibly not a place for babies if it's a busy weekend.   Peanut butter and jelly bacon burger on a pretzel bun?  This is the standing "burger of the year?"  Definitely not something on the menu in my hometown.  Ordered the petite size with tater tots.   The food arrived quickly, after less than 15 minutes. Taste and quality were good, but perhaps less explosive than what I expected after hearing so much raving about this place. Fortunately it wasn't overly greasy, which is surprising considering it was covered in bacon. It's def not on my normal healthy diet, but this was a special weekend for friends so what the heck.    My verdict was that it was pretty good, and I can check it off the list - but don't need to go out of my way to return here again, and it's still simply a bar that sells burgers and has friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peanut butter jelly bacon burger?

9mI9A3EdMK8Oy9biIppqFg.text: I understand why this place has such a high rating. When we first walked up to the restaurant I was a little nervous. We were seated immediately and our server greeted us shortly after that. Our server was amazing, super attentive, kind and funny. He offered suggestions and recommendations for what was good.  My mom and I both started off with corona-ritas. They were delicious. You can tell they were not made with a mix, but fresh limes and lots of tequila. Very good choice and worth the price.   With each burger you get to pick a different kind of roll and either French fries or sweet potato tots. Taking our servers suggestions, I got the PBJ & bacon burger on a pretzel bun with French fries. My burger was amazing. Don't be afraid to try this burger. I made my whole family try it and it was the best burger at the table.  My sister ordered the bacon burger, my dad ordered the BBQ burger, and my mom ordered the patty melt. Everyone enjoyed their burgers and how they were cooked, but the PBJ &a bacon burger was still the best.   Overall food is delicious and the prices were reasonable! Definitely give this place a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The PBJ &amp; bacon burger - absolutely amazing
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The BBQ burger - comes with onion rings on it!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The patty melt!

Tnf_05SPUHTYapFiZKsw6w.text: Great burgers and cool environment.... Love the stuff all over th place. Super beachy.  The staff and very eager to help and make sure the dining experience is on par.  Nice large portions , so left overs for next day.  Had Hatch burger, patty melt, cheese fries and beer. Really great place, our first time here and we will be back.

RBN9SVgZo1bHX_dcZvRK7A.text: This is the second time I've been to Rehab Burger and it never disappoints. Great food, I went untraditional this time and had the BLT. Outstanding with sweet potato totes. Only reason I gave 4 out of 5 stars is waitress was a little disconnected, she seemed a little overwhelmed so her service suffered. But definitely should be on your must try list.

YVl-4sQ5NqbMt4FJtDrPXg.text: This place is great! It is by far my husband's favorite restaurant and we are here weekly. Serving sizes are huge! Even the relapse burger (the "small" one) leaves me with leftovers. Drinks are great and my favorites are the Margatini and the medium Bloody. For burgers I always go with the Spicy Mac and it never disappoints.   I'm not always in the mood for a burger so sometimes I just eat my husbands tots and get extra veggies to throw in my Bloody. The weird part is they also charge me a couple bucks for the veggies, but $2 isn't bad so it doesn't bug me, it's just weird to me. Other times I get their pastas which are great or an appetizer. My favorites are the queso dip and the calamari. I'm from CA right on the beach so I'm used to picking out your seafood from the traps on the patio and I can tell the calamari has been on ice, but I still order it so it isn't bad enough to not go back for more.  It is deceptively inexpensive too. We brought my parents and a family friend here last weekend (5 hungry adults total) and ordered a burger each, the pork wings, and a cocktail each and it only came to about $100. I expected it to be more than that so when I sprung to pick up the tab I was pleasantly surprised. They also have cash back through Yelp which is awesome because I get paid to eat somewhere I'm already going to be.  We all were pretty let down when we went on a Sunday at 5pm and they were out of pretzel buns and onion rings. They blamed it on being busy and us coming on a Sunday saying that's the norm, but why not order enough materials to accommodate the weekly needs of your guests if that is the case? One complaint my dad had was that the burgers can be a bit overloaded and busy. I think it's just a millennial thing that we do to food and I agree, but as I watch my husband devour a maple bacon donut burger dripping with Swiss cheese and all kinds of sauces, I can't fault them for it. I swear he'd leave me for that burger if you made it a normal item on the menu, lol.  Come with an appetite and be ready to walk out with leftovers.

fL-N-uqt3VW8JGCsD7WONg.text: It's a funny place - but that's it. The service is slow and the food is average. Don't order water, it tastes horrible!

knafYCltuLso0IL6dYQSUw.text: Funky looking place that is great for people watching.  The burger names are a hoot and you get good sized portions of food.  Although food was pretty good, I would rather go to  The Stand for the best burgers.

bR6HJJqKy_Bb9ACmu08Npg.text: Cute little place.  Very relaxed "beach cabana type" atmosphere.  Burgers are monstrous.  I ordered poblano burger with onion rings.  Call me old fashion or just old, but I prefer a traditional juicy flame broiled burger, which this is def. not.  Too much going on with my burger that it completely took away from my meat experience. Patty wasn't moist (I ordered Med well) was lean, I give them that.  Onion rings were meh.  Wine burger has the best onion rings to date.  Kid and family friendly.  Glad I tried it.  Friendly servers.

x80NzvNPajUJs42KKB94kA.text: Rehab burger totally lives up to the hype! They have a fairly extensive burger menu with the option of doing a larger Rehab size (two 5 oz patties) or a smaller Relapse size with just one 5 oz patty. I opted for Relapse because each burger also comes with a choice of fries or sweet potato tots (went with the tots) and your choice of buns (got the pretzel bun!)  I got the Know your Poblano burger and my boyfriend got the spicy Mac n Cheese burger. Poblano burger came with peppers and grilled onions plus a sauce of your choice (went with chipotle aioli) that comes on the side. Burgers are cooked perfectly and come out hot and juicy. Bf's mac and cheese in his burger was seasoned with jalapenos and sriracha sauce and sooo good.   I also really appreciate a place that has pretzel buns (AND doesn't charge you extra) and also has sweet potato tots.   Prices were reasonable. My burger with tots was just $8.75, which is probably how much a pretzel bun burger with fries at a generic fast food chain would cost.  Service was speedy and attentive and super friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Know your poblano burger with sweet potato tots
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy Mac n cheese burger

5HkpEmNlbxQwrznPMe2S2A.text: It's True what they say... Rehab is as good as it gets! I recently dined in for a second time, and just as the first, I was fully satisfied. I don't know what it is, but their food is spot on. The service was really great as well. You'll love this west coast vibe burger joint! A Scottsdale hidden gem, and one of the best burgers in AZ. I will keep coming here for different occasions - lunch, dinner, large groups - you name it and I'm certain they will accommodate.  For my most recent visit, I ordered a turkey burger. SO delicious! I really liked how my server asked if I was enjoying the turkey burger specifically because they can sometimes be a hit or miss with me. Thank you Rehab for another delicious dinner!

dyYarka3OR41sE-LytgZRw.text: Got in quick, so many choices for food, and loved the atmosphere.  We took our kids and it was family friendly although more of a bar atmosphere.  Friendly staff and food was great!  Huge portions, everyone took some leftover home.  Reasonable prices, would go again!

IXjBFF9zn8i42Et4dhxbww.text: Burger was so good and huge. Also got a salad which was massive. Salad was average. Great burgers fun vibes.

zT5yQQsqnOYV0Nl5_ShGeg.text: I'd had Rehab bookmarked on Yelp for awhile and finally got to go check it out this weekend. My friends and I arrived around 1pm on Saturday afternoon and were lucky enough to snag one of the last two open tables.   We were greeted right away, given waters and informed of their happy hour specials. Yes, you read that right, happy hour on a Saturday! Rehab has HH seven days a week, from 11-6 I believe. I was a little disappointed to see the discounts applied mainly to booze. All appetizers are $1 off, which isn't much, in my opinion. But that didn't deter us from ordering a huge plate of chili cheese fries for the table to share. (And we saved $1, woo!)   On to the entrees. Us girls ordered burgers, one rare and the other two medium rare. The "rare" burger came out med-rare, not really a big deal, but mine and my friend's "med-rare" were without a doubt overcooked. Mine came out mid-well, and my friend's came out well done. Mine had just enough juice/pink that I ate it anyway, but my friend sent her dish back. For a place called Rehab Burger Therapy, you'd think the cooks would know their way around a grill and proper temps?! Also, on the menu's description of our food it said our burgers were served with condiments; my Poblano burger was supposed to get spicy ketchup and my friend's was supposed to get a chipotle aioli. Both were absent from our plates and we had to ask for them. Weird. Or maybe I'm just a condiment freak.   Our server, Devon (sp?), was super nice, funny and energetic throughout our experience. He apologized for the kitchen's mistake and fixed the situation for my friend.   All in all I'd be back. The pretzel bun I chose my burger to be housed in was delish, and Rehab's fries are slightly addictive. Perhaps I'll try again at a less busy time when the cooks can pay more attention to the grill temps.

CyZfkZnQycmRGhaRq5dL7Q.text: Saw it.  Tried it.  Probably won't go back.  Bacon cheeseburger was a 4 out of 5. Big. and burger was cooked well.   Bacon was burnt.  Fries were sub par.  Server was pretty good.  Cool atmosphere.

cWDp-j_9KAZbAy1-PIo9Eg.text: Decent food and the prices are ok, The menu has some really weird things on it so go with an open mind and enjoy yourself. It is crowed and loud but what do you expect from a bar.

-afctVClNJWY_7LMhqe9Kw.text: I really want to like this place, having seen a couple restaurants come in and out of the building. It looks kind of like the Bonfire did inside (previous restaurant), but it has a surfer vibe, and upbeat atmosphere.   My boyfriend ordered a standard cheese burger, and I had a green salad and garlic bread because I wanted to eat light. My boyfriend eats A LOT of burgers, it is one of his favorite foods, and when he got the burger the bun on the bottom was soggy. As he checked out the sog, I helped myself to some of his fries, which weren't piping hot. It made me suspect that the burger had sat for awhile before they brought it (note to owners).   My salad was pretty standard, I mean, I did order a green salad so what should I suspect? But, the one thing was that I felt they could have done was sliced the tomatoes. I could tell the tomatoes were the same ones that they used on the burgers, and they just cut them in half, meaning that I had to cut them into tiny pieces myself. I also thought that the cucumbers could have used a chop too. I would suggest cutting the cucumbers and tomatoes into smaller bite sized pieces to make a better salad since that is one of the only fresh/healthy things on the menu. On the first bite of the burger my boyfriend said it was good, but 3 bites later he said something tasted funny and he was not happy. We think it was the onions. He didn't finish the burger.   I might give this place another try, but I am not sure...

Tc3Zbfd2zF51lb2lDMFWnQ.text: OMG (regarding wait time complaint). Yes it takes a few minutes to cook 10 oz of beef to perfection. Slow down, order a specialty drink and enjoy this place!! Yes, I tried the wings (I always do) They were awesome. They call them medium but they were pretty hot, I ordered a side of hot sauce and that was great,  No complaints. But you must try the PIG WINGS!!! They are like bone-in riblets, pig drumettes, whatever... with spicy sweet peach hot sauce that is just worth the trip. And the burgers are great, 10 oz is HUGE, Everything cooked as ordered. The Hatch Chile burger was especially good. Staff was fast, fun, environment was full of energy and a very ecclectic clientele which I crave here in the desert. The beer was cold, and the bartender whipped up some specialty frinks that would knock even a seasoned drinker on their A-S-S. Try the blue rufie if you're a wimpy drinker, tastes like candy. Also good is the blueberry martini. YES, FULL BAR. Burger buns were really good, maybe they flew em in from Jersey but AZ never gets bread this good. No complaints ...will be back. Oh, and girls hula hoop in the parking lot if you get bored. They will share.

79PE-z9oYwVYO3hJzIev0Q.text: The best way to describe this place is WOW!!!!! The sliders and Bacon is amazing.....if you are in the area and pass this place up......you have really missed a special treat.

78epBbdroNtTG--GbEkMeQ.text: Went here for our first time! And it was delicious totally worth it!! Good vibe and chill waitresses.. Had Ariel as a waitress, really nice and chill.. Definitely coming back and is our new burger joint!!!

qMeBdztevaX1zp4RtoWdwg.text: Beachy vibes and good burgers (including turkey and veggie menu options). The staff here (especially the waitresses) are incredibly personable and witty.  Would definitely recommend this place. Awesome service! Stop by if you're walking through Old-Town, and visit often.  We need cute, and fun places to stay downtown.    And they have a patio!  Would be perfect to come here during the evening to have a few beers and hang out.

bSST4GjCRKlunpEfT_3A5g.text: We here with a friend that had been there a week before. The way he described it put me in the mind set I was about to eat a piece of meaty heaven and a cloud like bun. So we went on a Friday night around 6 pm. The place has a nice chill atmosphere. The wait staff is very nice. We started with an appetizer of Pig Wings, which are little ribs on the bone covered in a sweet and spicy peach and hablanero bbq sauce. They were mighty tasty but took at least 20 min to come out.  Like most places in phoenix, they had Four Peaks beers on tap. This is fine with me. So we had a few beers, the ordered our burgers.  I ordered there specialty burger, The Hangover: Fried egg, bacon and a split green chili on it on a pretzel bun. As a side I choose the sweet potato tots. The burger was cook perfect to my order, but lacked seasoning. Even with a green chili on it I didn't get the heat I was expecting.  The bacon was crispy and the egg was cooked nice. The pretzel bun was excellent. It wasn't a bad burger but it didn't have that wow factor I was looking for.  The side of sweet potato tots was great. They even give you a side spicy catsup. This was good, but with sweet potato tots you need to serve them with a maple, or sweet sauce.   So overall I would go back to give this place a second chance. My friend had a BBQ burger that I want to try. So check the place out. It is worth it.

zVIpqM0U_p4aPdt7k39cUw.text: Awesome experience! The peanut butter and jelly hamburger was really good! Little scared about it when I ordered it but it was really good. Will be back again

VT_btbzOfIgMCvthx_Y9Hg.text: We USED to like this place, then ......Lunch @ 230pm, my party was all returning customers.  Good service, the waitress was very knowlegable.  I got (2patty--$14) Ghost burger, huge, made my stomach feel bad, & too spicy!  My dad got the same thing he got lasttime, Black &Blue burger. He asked the waitress "is there any bleu chz in this?"  she said "yeah it's stuffed inside the patty"---he even said "well it seems theres hardly any"---she did nothing to reconcile this.  My bf had one of the (single-patty, med-well) burgers w/peppers on it (undercooked in some parts!!)--plus he got the mushy sweet potato tots (bleh). For 40$ (no alcohol &not incl. tip) 3people, you might as well go to Carls Jr

saNjKoN1xA8pH4zz_pqmOQ.text: One of our favorite local joints. If you're feeling adventurous, try the PB&J burger, which has peanut butter, jelly, bacon, and sriracha. Sounds kinda scary but trust me -- it's amazing. Great service, cool vibes, awesome food.

GmPhYqpV4Mvmc0iCIq5h_g.text: A fine addition to the old town food scene. Top quality burgers, beer, service and decor. This is a relaxing place to hangout with friends/family. Try the chicken wings and the wedge salad (not on the menu). They also have a nice patio for the cooler months.

UJDM_aXK1mJba2qXTlmpOw.text: I had been wanting to come here for a long time because I heard really good things. I finally got the chance and came here for lunch with a co-worker today, but unfortunately I was kind of disappointed. We got there and there was a short wait which was fine and to be expected, but there was literally no where to stand to wait without being in someone's way. (It was raining outside so maybe people normally wait on the patio? There are no chairs or benches or anything.) We got our table within a few minutes and our waiter got our drink order pretty quickly. He was helpful and knowledgeable about the menu, made some recommendations for us, and we placed our order.   The lunch rush was starting to end shortly after we ordered, so there were plenty of open tables after being there for 15 minutes. But somehow it took a good 25-30 minutes to get our food. When our food did come out, our waiter dropped it off and didn't come back to check on us for quite some time. I wanted to ask for a side of mayo and another side of chipotle aioli (which was really good) but he disappeared. I finally saw him seating another group and I tried to make eye contact with him several times but he just kept going back and hanging out at the bar. I finally got him to come over and he brought my sauce quickly, but then it was the same thing again with our check. Because it took so long to get our food (which was just 2 very simple burgers and tots, nothing too fancy) we had to get back to work quickly. We finally got his attention and we asked for our checks, but it seriously took another 5 minutes for him to bring it. Kind of frustrating.   My burger wasn't that great. I got the hatch burger and it was just a green chile and a really thick piece of cheese that was not even melted. Nothing else, which made it pretty dry (hence my desire for more sauce). I wasn't really impressed at all. I love the mexican burger at Lenny's and was hoping for something similar but it's really the opposite. The sweet potato tots were pretty good though, I did like those. And I liked the atmosphere of the place, they played a lot of Pepper which is one of my favorite bands, so it wasn't all bad. Overall I wasn't impressed and I'm much more interested in trying some of the other burger places around here than coming back.

AwqLyNFQUsSbHStu9AWprQ.text: Went for son's birthday dinner special treat...there was hardly any wait...got seated quickly and orders were taken promptly...great service and attention to customers...food was decent...I tried Zinburger and was not particularly impressed with it...I am not big on eating burgers and compared to five guys; in-out this would be OK burger spot based on the taste of food...would not really seek it out to eat next time but would not be averse to trying out another time with different selection from the menu..kids friendly and ample parking outside....lines start to form after 6:30p

RgMnPTORvgNgLpbBCNrtYg.text: I heard this place had some unique burgers, and do they ever.  I tried the peanut butter, jelly and bacon burger; I know it sounds weird.  I've only heard of burgers like this on Dinners, Drive-in and Dives.  Let me tell you it was one of the best burgers I have ever had.  The service was great and the decor is laid back.  It is a small place so get there early.  If you are in Old Town Scottsdale, this is the place to go for burgers.  You can also get any of their burgers changed to a chicken or turkey burger at No Extra charge.  Now that's awesome!

pi1oI-O0sSScm4kmCMfEpw.text: Was visiting Scottsdale on vacation. We were all craving a hamburger and wanted to try somewhere new, so started doing some research of Yelp and found this gem.  Such a cute place, feels like your in Cali! The burgers are delish and the service was great! So glad we came here. We will be back the next time we come to visit Scottsdale!

Wjkr6jGmpKE0cjL3ktQhmQ.text: Service was a bit slow considering it wasn't very busy when we were there but our waitress was very friendly and helpful, giving us insights into what we might like. I ordered chicken wings and they were fantastic! Drinks were excellent. My sister had a burger, which she thought was good. I will definitely come back to try something new!

qgETCd92YVUfcZQCDgZaLw.text: Went there for lunch no wait required the wedge salad was excellent and I should have stopped with that my burger was not good at all the service was great for good service was very good what I go there again wouldn't be my first choice but I probably would give it another try it may have been an off-day however the price for what it is it's not worth it in my opinion

ybdGvB25dJQCIERmlT_7EA.text: Good burgers, fun menu, large portions and friendly service! I was there in a group of five, two of us were interested in Hatch burger, so we ordered larger portion (rehab size) to share - they didn't have a problem with it, brought an extra plate with the order and it looked like they actually added more fries.

EIxDfE-ZGPR4siai4JDlEg.text: Salad was incredible, but probably twice as large as it needed to be. Flavors were great but a little spicy. Prices normal.

2wujGfXyNVpbXbOEvOYLOQ.text: A friend  recommended this new place to try. I got the famous PBJ burger,it wasn't what I expected  it to be it was just that PBJ sandwich  with meat I don't know what all the fuss  was about. Let's talk about the waiter  it took him 10 min. before  he evan asked what we would like to  drink  and even longer to ask about our order. I guess  since this location  was in Scottsdale  he thought it would be better to attend the older ladies that were there alone rather than a  family. The service  for me means a lot about a place, but the food was ok. I would not be going there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jntkifJv13Fy4kUChWOvbA.text: Amazing!  Don't be afraid to leave your comfort zone.  I have wandered around the menu and have never been disappointed.  This is my go to place for a burger and beer (or 3).  A word of advice when deciding on relapse or rehab sizes (Rehab 10oz & Relapse 5oz)  - unless you are a competitive food eater avoid the rehab especially if you plan to have a beer or 3.   If you can only go here once try the PBJ & Bacon Burger on the pretzel bun. Don't be afraid you coward!  Order the damn PBJ & Bacon Burger.

jTnlQYesxp4ez_r8eS_SVA.text: Get the pretzel bun. I had the hatch burger, which was good, but really its all about the pretzel bun so just get whatever burger sounds the best! Also the sweet potato tater tots were good and i'm not a big sweet potato person so thats saying something.

HZGcY_byVjahtoem-SimRA.text: Definitely lived up to all the hype! We came here after receiving multiple recommendations. Husband got the PBJ & Bacon Burger and I got the Spicy Mac & Cheese Burger. And woah. We were blown away! Especially at the PBJ one, which was also widely recommended. It's one we would have never thought to order, but did because of how many people, including our server, told us it was amazing. My husband already had really high expectations for it, and it even exceeded those. The spicy Mac one was also delicious. Both the sweet potato tots and the fries were great - we got an order of each. Get the chipotle aioli with the tots!!! Their ranch is also really extra good. Highly recommend. Will be back! Oh, and it's also extremely reasonably priced! We were actually very pleasantly surprised by the prices. :)

z1283OdgxHecU19hmjuO3g.text: Just meh... The burgers my family had weren't cooked at the right temp, and when the waiter said he'd take care of the bill, he subtracted a total of $.50 for their mistake. They said the burgers were alright. The French fries and tater tots weren't anything special either. There's far better places in old Town to eat at.

kdczMzhnmeXKvAQqajMHNA.text: Food is really good. Don't miss the PBJ burger. The hangover would make a nice breakfast too. The atmosphere is chill good music not too loud thanks for that. A mix of people but more younger peeps. It's bathroom is a bit dirty but otherwise a don't miss this one place.

1bBBaS3FAFsqzUGSJyMtyw.text: Hike up Camelback Mountain, been on a super healthy kick the past 2 weeks.  Enough Turkey and chicken, I need a burger and I told my girl i knew EXACTLY where to go. I've eaten here 4 times now, good solid burgers.   Sat on the patio, ordered a couple of Hop Knot IPA and waited for our burgers. Now I don't want to under sell my poblano burger, which was good, but my wife ordered the Peanut Butter and Jelly Burger with THICK cut bacon.  WTF???  The combination of these 3 flavors work so incredibly well together it made me dizzy. I didn't even want to eat mine. Mind blowing good. All the melted peanut butter and jelly that dripped out of the burger and onto the plate made a great dipping sauce for the fries too!!  Out of all the burgers I have eaten in my 40 year old life, this will make my top 3 of all time. Shout out to our awesome waiter Pickle for being so awesome too!

ilv-U8M2eJStnNTu2Hfvlw.text: We had a late lunch here and it was delicious! The pig wings - I can't even describe how amazing they were. You must have the pig wings, they were so tasty. I wish that they serve the pig wings on the East Coast because I would have those every week. I also had the peanut butter and jelly burger which I know sounds questionable, but it works. It's different and you should try it once you get over the fact that there's peanut butter on your burger. Swing by if you're in Scottsdale because this was definitely one of my favorite restaurants we ate that during our trip.

lLM-xN5SMXoNy0JQMcFVYg.text: Came here for lunch. Had the veggie burger and was excellent really hit the spot. They have good drinks here including thirst quenching soft drinks. Love their pineapple sauce. They  have many different sources to choose from.

d_o230QFAMYg3bxZOPj7JQ.text: Good atmosphere with great sandwiches!  Try the Porkster!!  It's definitely a one of a kind burger with cheddar and pulled pork on too!  So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Porkster

oEfHrRt_cwJyA4UAPfhydQ.text: I split the Donut Burger & PB&J sriracha burger with sweet potatoe totts OMG!!! Amazing!

5aISNigovRLYheUYunMeNA.text: It's been a while since I have eaten here, but I thought I should review it anyway.   We started with the chips & salsa. Nothing special, just wanted something to munch. I wouldn't recommend getting them. For our meals, I had the Jalapeno Popper Burger and my boyfriend had the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese Burger. The star of each burger is in the name: jalapeno poppers and mac-n-cheese, respectively. I loved the creamy texture of the cream cheese in the burger. For obvious reasons, my boyfriend loved the mac-n-cheese burger (there's also bacon). Both were a good size. I don't remember the fries being remarkable. The real star of the show is the creative burger.    Good burger place. Worth trying out if you don't mind the heartburn afterwards.

qVmBfjouWc0s_F4ENTnO_w.text: This restaurant is easily five stars. The restaurant is a good burger place. Plus this place has salads if you are a vegetarian. Also this place has really good beer, and has GREAT appetizers (chips). I would recommend this restaurant to everyone. Bomb.com!!!!!!

r_sjo60gE32lxcWCnJpO7w.text: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G Burgers here.  Cute atmosphere and great service.  Will definitely be visiting again soon!!!  Wish you had a location in N. Phoenix.  THANKS!!!

ZUSK7lZHo3eOziBN5_Rj2Q.text: We found Burger Therapy quite by accident.  And although it broke very dietary rule .. it was well worth it.  I don't remember the name of the burger  I had but it was pepper jack cheese, with hot peppers, with hot sauce, with a grilled poblano on it and a stack of crispy o'rings.  2 drinks and the check and it was great.  And that outside in 120 degree weather ... the menu reads like a piece of heaven.  Very casual laid back atmosphere. Put on your list - no regrets.

CGsSdgZiXLYwo2WJtpDyVQ.text: This is such a fun place to check out and eat at. I am surprised by all the different burger combinations. The burgers are big enough to share for sure. I was blown away by how delicious they are for how weird they sound but it works. My partner had a PB and J burger and I had Jalepeno popper burger and they did not disappoint at all!

mrXE9NS1ZyPTWBWjE9HX8A.text: Wow!!! Fantastic Burgers! Helpful friendly servers! Great atmosphere! Can't go wrong here!

0L2OmcudXocB5E4P3v85fA.text: Awesome burgers and fries! The wait staff were efficient and super friendly. They have everything from a regular cheeseburger to a peanut butter and jelly burger. NIce patio to sit outside with mist blowing  to keep you cool in the heat.

uvfYTzEjsL2pTAyRN630xQ.text: Great burgers and good sized portions for an excellent value. Nice beer selection on draft. Server was friendly and knowledgable of the menu. Great area & location.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cbWiQVvousME4bXT0fG-mA.text: This place is like I designed it as my own restaurant.  Cool beachy theme. The sweetest servers in Scottsdale. Not just one server helps you they all make sure you get good service.  The food is cool too.  Burgers with hatch peppers my personal favorite.  And then sweet potato tatortots.  Who ever thought of something so cool.  And too top it off home made fresh pretzel rolls for your burger.  Now all I need is a banana shake.  Which they probably have with rum. I just didn't ask. They have dietcoke which is hard to find is most phoenix restaurants so I just had one of those. Which I think they filled twenty times.

T_xO80PNoQYuKUW7IdNAIA.text: My boyfriend and I shared the bacon cheeseburger... Delicious!! Thank god I don't live here otherwise I will be eating way too many burgers!

2mMUrg3H6z3PqpaHQXNf5g.text: OMG - such a funky cool place.  The waiter - David - was a super cool guy.  Stood there and chatted with us and made us feel super comfortable.  The food is really, really good - great burgers with different styles and toppings.  The sweet potato tots are awesome, as are the onion rings.

Jhib1la5Uf8E9Oue8oRIig.text: Really Good. Went with a buddy and his couple of younger kids. It was loud and they are loud.er. Perfect place for them. Food was good, drinks were good. Had the Hawaiian, cooked perfectly. Sweet Potato tots are always a good alternative to simple fries. Will be back

YiZmykxA6fymN6Z8rhbX2g.text: AWESOME - JUST AWESOME!! One of the best gourmet burgers I've ever had. Great service. Now.... The wings could be the best in Phoenix. We will definitely be back when visiting next time.

di28pnnxhoNjk9c6B7uAjQ.text: Arrived with a friend at 4 pm. Perfect, not busy seated on patio, greeted by waiter.  Ordered the onion rings as appetizer and they were good. Burgers next. I ordered mine rare, it came medium well. When you have a burger joint, I am the only customer, you charge $10 for a burger and you can't get it right, three stars is my max.

olGZYGfJq_BpWHpxuXq1Kg.text: Best burger in Arizona. Lots of choices. Very kid friendly, even for a 2 and 3 year old. A must if in a burger mood.

nJVLBFdWwmHEnU9dVtMmjA.text: Ok.. So let me tell you first before you get the wrong idea because I put 3 stars. It has nothing to do with the food. They may just have the best burgers I have EVER tasted!!! This is my second time coming to this restaurant. The first time I waited about 35 min to be seated. Which was annoying but! I stayed because with that long of a wait, it must've meant the food was good. I gave it 3 stars because of the wait the first time and the 2nd time was the service! Service first time was great! The guy at the bar was awesome! But the 2nd time of me going I feel like within the first 2-3 minutes I should be addressed. Asked for a drink, or acknowledged at least! And I wasn't. I waited about 8 minutes before someone came to my table. And didn't get a "sorry for the wait". It was just like... Ok what can I get you.. And even more bothersome, the couple that came in and sat next to me was addressed immediately.. Hmmm. But she did have a different waiter. Other than that. I would give 5 stars. Food is excellent!!

pgbrg65Dsz2Fawm37tLLpA.text: OMG.  there food is outrageously wonderful!  Its not just burgers.  you can replace the burger with Turkey meat or chicken.  A Must go to place.  The service is great.  everyone is friendly.

iWaMg_-orr0NLk_JJT5huw.text: burger was good and fries were even better. quick service in a casual place. pretty busy during lunch time.

RBL3SZniV8XIV_PKwE65GQ.text: Two words- the best!  Sweet potatoe tots with cajon mayo dip awesome!

jHruERrXmDgBXShj3HHINA.text: Found a shard of glass the size of a silver dollar in the bottom of my glass.  The manager took $3.50 off of our bill. I've never been so shocked by such terrible customer service

D_QqMNjAiEBU7OhVOZQtbA.text: Astounding burgers. Never had anything like it anywhere else. We are from New York, and this was worth coming out to Arizona for.

5xgRAAntQ-42ZzUdaeP38g.text: Fantastic burger and sweet potato tots. My only complaint is that I wish they had a bigger beer selection. It has great service too. Very happy I found this place.

_9fqZu3XsWyE5kO9Lk280g.text: Overrated... Pretty good burger (nothing to come back again for) and non crispy tots! Also the place is filthy and has birds inside. My silverware was much less than clean and the napkins they gave us had sauce stains on them ew! Skip unless you like eating in filth.

6lrXFzWH2pgws-jALpBWlg.text: Amazing burgers reasonable prices.   I finally find a great place to get a burger in old town.  Go here a try this place out you will thank me.

J-8TfEtAzKdMxjtRdP7_eQ.text: Great Burger!  I had the Hangover burger with the pretzel bun. Ordered medium. It was great!  I left full and satisfied.

c9MLag0vFj2xB-RsGWnZUA.text: Love this place.  Unpretentious, delicious and affordable.  Some of the best burgers in the Valley.  Ask about their secret menu!

BVNmfmdvFItrzEOnGADQqw.text: Went on a golf trip and found the best burgers ever!!!   Had the Mushrrom Swiss on a pretzel bun.   The burger was disgustingly great. The fries were fantastic and are waitress was funny and fast.  I will be back twice next year!!!       Oh, and our waitress recommended the PB&J and I thought she was just being cute, but lots of people(locals) around us were ordering it and I think I must have it.

oBJIvPI-Sxsqn33Yy09PAg.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon. This place has awesome specials!!! I ordered the "hangover burger" without bacon and without the hatch green chilli with the sweet POTotOES. Omg, you MUST have the sweet POTotOES!! Presentation, food quality, value and service were excellent. If I ever return to Scottsdale, this will be a pitstop! PLEASE OPEN SHOP IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA!!!! :)

ch7dGKoKJu8cBFTf3Gv7_A.text: Rehab Burger has a great, laidback, beach-vibe environment. The staff are friendly and seem down to earth. They have outside high-top seating that's great for any time of the day.  They have a huge menu and the burger options can be a little overwhelming if you're indecisive like me. I went with the turkey burger that had avocado, lettuce, tomato, and sprouts on top. It was huge and super tasty. The burger came with sweet potato tots that were warm and crispy and there's a unique selection of sauces to dip your tots in. Some of the burgers have the option of 5 ounces or 10 and the turkey burger only comes 10 ounces, so I wouldn't recommend eating it all, especially if you plan on drinking! I didn't drink here, but I hear the margaritas are strong and really good. I absolutely love this place and can't wait to go back!

bpkHUwAL7zkCP4rXkcFpKQ.text: This is my second day here in a row. All I have to say is WOW. First time here I had the Beefstro burger. Absolutely outrageous with Pineapples aioli on the side. The sweet potatoes tots maaaad good. Came the second day and had the Jalenpeno popper burger with the corn. Awesome as well. It's small so you may have to wait but it is so worth it. I'm sure they are going to expand even further. Stop reading my review and place your order.

6Bs7CxJySuUPFDmRyju0eA.text: I was looking forward to checking this place out after reading the reviews on Yelp.  It's decorated in a beach theme and seems like a fun atmosphere.  I sat at the bar and it took a little while to get my menu.  I ordered the bacon cheeseburger.  And then I waited.  And I waited.  A half hour after I sat down at the bar I still didn't have any food.  I put a couple bucks on the bar for my Sprite and walked out.

9AWQwgoq1k2oDvDnIU0DgA.text: Their burgers are messy and delicious! The PBJ and Bacon burger is unique, but the flavors really compliment each other. Be prepared for that burger to get all over the place. Same with the Mac and cheese burger, delicious and messy. The hatch chile burger was just the right level of spicy! Sweet potato tots are delicious as well. Large portions, delicious burgers! Note that burgers ordered medium were still pretty pink inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch chili burger on a pretzel bun with onion rings and chipotle aioli. Delicious!

9EufFC9lK1gsj1yvXxB3kA.text: I'm a huge fan of Rehab Burger! Happy hour seems to be all day, everyday, so who can complain about that?! And the burgers are really creative and delicious. I always get the peanut butter, jelly and sriracha burger, and although that sounds like a crazy combination, it is really delicious! Great vibe and service too.

EviudsiN3yj8vhFIstNTgA.text: Waited about 25 minutes to be seated which is no deal and expected on a Saturday. It was cooler outside on the patio under the mist then indoors. I ordered mac n cheese burger (med well) which was ok. The mac n cheese was good but the burger was bland and well done. My 13 y/o son ordered their hawaiin burger and he said it was very good and seasoned. His was cooked med well. Their pineapple sauce is pretty good. I would like to come back and try a different burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese burger and hawaiin burger

Kf4dlRRKgsogNXYLvhTS-w.text: Big burgers. clean restaurant. Beers for 1.75 cents during happy hour. Andy was the bar tender he did a great job knew the menu and was proactive making sure I had everything I needed.

aDoGB6QwGPnc5bQyj-Nq5A.text: This is hands down my favorite place to grab a beer and burger! The atmosphere is perfect and the music can't get any better. Their burgers are huge and amazing and food/drink prices are on par.   FYI their porkster is the best damn burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PORKSTER AND PBR!

NwK2yx_D6EfSUbmdr9x74Q.text: Rehab Burger Therapy is an example of how sometimes 2 rights can make a....not so right. Burgers? Yes! Mac and Cheese? Would doesn't love it! Jalapeno poppers? Delicious! But everything together? It's just not a burger to me, especially if you have to eat it with a knife and fork. Isn't holding in your hands a delicious piece of fresh, ground cow between buttery, fat buns half the beauty of a burger?  I had the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese burger, and our table also ordered Ghost burger and the special burger, the Loco Moco. My burger had mac n cheese spilled everywhere, and it felt like eating a decent burger with a side of mac and cheese. The Loco Moco burger had rice spilling every where...and rice in a burger? Not sure if they even thought about the logistics of it. The burger itself was mediocre....if you're a high end burger joint, you should have a very excellent burger patty as a base.   Service was ok, I think staff could use a bit of training on at least their specials (I overheard at least 2 servers not know what the daily special was). It is, however, very conveniently located in walkable distance from the Giants Scottsdale Stadium, and a nice post-game restaurant to head to. In the end the food felt like messy combinations of anything they can think of putting on a burger. Fun place, but far from being the best burger I've ever had (Fergburger takes the crown on that, and all burger joints need to take note), and not really a 4.5 rank in my book.

Co2YGf898uskNB04S4wklA.text: First of all my review is based on the service.  Not the food.  The food was AMAZING!!!!! Brought my husband and 2 kids. The drinks were not good. We had tea and soda.  Soda was thick n syrupy w little carbonation (coke) the tea looked ok but had no flavor at all.  I've seen more flavor in a Lipton used tea bag. The food came out as ordered in a timely manner. And beautiful. A feast for both the stomach and the eyes. So we start eating. And we'll our drinks was empty. For 10 mins n no refills.  Looked around the room and I also noticed that everyone else also had empty glasses with just ice. They don't check up on you during meal.  You have to get their attention and that's hard in such a loud room. So a while passes and our waitress is finally passing by and snagging her attention. But we was already done eating and also requested boxes. Note: the rehab size is a very ambitious serving, huge. So we get our boxes. And pack up the food.  But still so check.  So another 15 mins goes by.  And we finally have to ask for the check. The wait staff doesn't pay attention to their customers for drinks or checks.  Not rude. But definitely not conscientious. Or personable. We loved the food. But next time we gonna try the Tempe location. See how service is there.  As for here it's a one n done. Off note: those of you w kids that are picky, they do not have American cheese. Nothing to complain about there. Just FYI.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zMsLJyf7B7OXb8yyqxd4Vg.text: Great comfortable and everyone welcomes you like a local. Try the PJB burger may not sound like something you want but loved it.

F0MoL2RxJEfFa6t34TsYKw.text: For the number one burger in Scottsdale I was a little disappointed in the food. I ordered the hawaiian burger which came with pineapple and ham in addition to your normal hamburger. I've had hawaiian burger where the pineapple really set off the flavor chemistry but at Rehab, they didn't use a ripe pineapple and didn't properly grill it to carmelize all the sugar from the fruit.   The sweet potato fries were actually sweet potato tater tots, but I loved them with no reservations.   The service was pretty prompt and friendly, all of the servers looked younger. I really liked the atmosphere too, good music and nice decor inside (it was too hot for me outside).

7MSVMD7Rz5LcoySZu3rlIA.text: Reminds me of going to one of those places on the boardwalk that has surfer appeal. The burgers are excellent. I had my first ever ghost burger with ghost peppers because I wanted to live dangerously. Full of flavor and sneaks up on you. While I could only eat half my leftovers were just as good the next day.  The place is small and the wait can get long so get there early

DTkRuK3AcX_hA9Sc7ZznSg.text: I had the turkey burger and it was awesome! Not dry at all. Our server was really cool and the tator tots were delicious! Great atmosphere and great food! The reason for the four star was the the burger was almost too big. It was hard to take a bite because it was piled high with stuff. Most people enjoy this but I like food that I can actually bite in and not food that I have to cut down. Food was delicious though! I will be back!

OPe7jAYogIbK1DqOTOf1LQ.text: Tried this for the first time today after wanting to since I've moved to Scottsdale. It was well worth the wait! I had a bacon cheeseburger on a pretzel bun and it was fantastic. The fries are just as good but the sweet potato tots weren't the best. The service was above average but I found it impressive how much they knew about every burger on the menu. They made good recommendations to the other guests around me that I over heard. Overall, I had a great experience and will definitely be coming back.

jy4y1TmCYeXu9KRciSaN6w.text: Wasn't a huge fan of my burger. Ordered the bacon cheeseburger. Didn't think the meat had enough flavor. Really wish they offered American cheese because the cheddar didn't bring enough flavor to the already bland meat. The only "okay" part of my meal was the sweet potato tots. Those were pretty good. The fries were pretty bland as well. Nothing to write home about here.

LfslPKui2Guzo9CaCmvWzw.text: The place for a really good hamburger!  I got the taco hamburger and its enough for two people.  It cam with fries..........which seemed to be home made.  will be going back for another kind of burger.

8BARhjpXpLIhrOjO2uUKmA.text: Turkey Jalapeno Mac-n-Cheese burger with Green Chilis, Siracha Mayo, and Poblano Peppers on a Pretzel Bun. Or some combination of all of that.  This place is ridiculous!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Turkey Jalapeno Mac-n-Cheese burger with Green Chilis, Siracha Mayo, and Poblano Peppers

TXHRor3T5j9cxyzK3PE8Yg.text: Great place for beers and a burger that's above the normal.  I writing this months after the visit- I remember a great bartender and enjoyable people on either side of me at the bar. With a couple good beers- not much else is needed.  Cheers!

s4-EIAyEE27WFPh_bKkqWw.text: Brought friends from out of town.   Chips and salsa were great! Chips seemed to be homemade.   Burger was HUGE! My wife and I shared, it was AWESOME!   Parking can be nuts, and it's a small joint.

PLZXXREX40u7AVMHz0FwwQ.text: Ok... Rian was our bartender... Dude was crazy amazing... Attention to detail... Burgers were cooked perfect... cocktails were amazing... everything about this place was great... Rian anticipated our needs amazingly... (no.. I have never met Rian before today)....  HIGHLY recommend!!

fgKk7CUKQ0TV0L1l8PE-GA.text: Service - Excellent Side Salad - Nothing special Calamari - Skip it! PBJ & Bacon Burger - A MUST!!!  PBJ = Peanut Butter and Jelly, and yes, as a burger with bacon and sriracha. It sounded awful and my bf isn't a fan of peanut butter so he wasn't anxious to try it. But the reviews and our server made it hard for us not to try it and it was AMAZING. The peanut butter part is a bit decieving, it tasted more like a Thai peanut sauce that usually comes with satay. For some weird reason, this combination works very well. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. In case you want to see the happy hour menu. I didn&#39;t see a recent one posted

XN0hPUlQf57EXF80OAjRmQ.text: Love the decor and burger was great, only disappointment was the fries. Definitely been sitting around for a while. Luckily wifey got sweet tots and they are outstanding! We may give me another try.

mN-RNAXN9kN-sBP_4s_xCw.text: Am amazing mix of flavors, that are delicious. My server suggested the PB&J burger which I was not interested in. She let me know it was their most popular and her favorite. I did ask what I HAD to have there and that was the top dog.   PB&J burger sounds gross to me but I forged ahead and damn glad I did. The sweet with the kick of the Siracha was totally on point. I was totally blown away and stunned that I liked it.  I also had the Mac n cheese burger that was phenomenal. The server said "you might look weird eating two burgers!" She also didn't think I could do it. I finished the burgers in principle and was full for two days!!! The fries are great the tots are delicious and the soda cup size is large and appropriate. I also liked the Jimmy Buffet feel to the place really chill and welcoming.  This place has enough reviews but I had to put my two cents in, it is a fantastic burger spot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J burger and the Mac n cheese burger off the charts!!!

dRGrm0cOyTes4L7hjzZCeg.text: Hands down the Best Burger in Town.  Was in the mood for a burger and had to try this place.  I went for the Mac Gnarly Burger and upgraded to a side item of Jamaican Corn (grilled).  The corn was really good fresh corn on the cob.  Yummy.  The burger.  Oh my goodness.  So yummy and the ingredients tasted so fresh and healthy.  It was not a grease burger.  Lean beef that looked and tasted very fresh.  I orderded it medium and it came out perfect.  The pretzel bun was a nice touch to it.  This is a remake of the Big Mac, or should I say the way a Big Mac should be.  $12 bucks for this sandwich.  It comes with 2 5 oz. slides of beef.  None of the the burgers here are cheap.  That is the tradeoff.  These people know how to do burgers here.  The staff was wonderful.  Very friendly.  This is not a fast food burger joint.  You have to wait 15 minutes for your burger.  It's more like a bar and grill restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac Gnarly Rehab Burger with Jamaican Corn (grilled).
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac Gnarly Rehab Burger.

zaaInqjyFP7WdU5I4LgIkw.text: Bottom line: The most incredible burger I have ever eaten.  Got the Mac and cheese burger, and it far exceeded my expectations, but be ready because it comes with a lot of good homemade Mac and cheese.  Other than that the margaritas are also good and the bartender was very friendly and attentive even though the bar was packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iyAXRq6yRuPtCwVmwJ_N9A.text: Only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because my expectations for the PB&J burger were much higher than the delivery. However, the food was delicious, service was certainly exceptional, and it was jam packed at 11am on a Tuesday (which can only mean great things). I wouldn't personally get the pb&j burger here again, but I would without a doubt come back for another round of burgers. The roommate loved his burger just for the record! If you're in he area - I definitely recommend dropping in for a bite! Food is cheap, but high grade food and delivery! Thank you!!
