AJIkQhOLeF6OQWkP7fy-tA.text: The burgers are awesome and the sweet potato tots are even better! They do not have a very good beer selection and my burger always seems to come out overcooked (I request medium rare, always). But I will continue to visit, nonetheless.

HAdWks5wQ5j0LrlS5ZUGqg.text: Tina was my ideal server (friendly and attentive but not overbearing). The place is clean. The weekend special Philly burger with ghost pepper jack cheese was spectacular. My girlfriend (EXTREMELY picky) ordered the bacon bleu burger and loved it. My only complaint was a 20 min wait (packed house). Bravo Rehab Burger!

QSE_4Q9yZWAxL2xvva4UMQ.text: Solid drinks, great food. Burgers are huge, sometimes messy, but always satisfying. You'll need a nap after the food here...happy zzzz's Chicken wings are awesome here, so is the calamari. All the burgers are great here. Sweet tots are also a great side option. Vibe is chill and friendly. Small place though, so expect a wait during prime times and days. It's worth it!

fnYqKYVsBVYWxHaHbnejmg.text: the pig wings!!! those were the best things there. the charred crispy exterior, spicy taste, complimented with pineapple sweetness, and then the meat just strips clean off the bone. UGH, it's like eating mini ribs that were cooked perfectly!!!  ya, the burger is good too. is it the best i've ever had? nope. BUT would it be a place i would come back again to order a burger from? yes. the burger wasn't overly juicy, the patty wasn't super thick so u can taste the rest of the burger, and the buns were good too. maybe if i ordered a burger with one of the house sauces it would have taken the burger to another level. that is exactly what i did when the server asked if we would like additional sauces so do it. ask for additional sauces.   the sweet potato tots were pretty good. i'm not a sweet potato fan myself but my gf is so we ordered it. it wasn't as crispy as i would like it but it was crispy enough. i do like how they were perfectly bite sized though.   the mac n cheese was alright but it's not something i would order again. it wasn't bad but it wasn't exactly great either.  service was very friendly and in a great timely manner. our server was very chill and attentive which pretty much set the mood. i wish they had one of these places in the bay so i can pig out on those pig wings with a beer while i watch a game.

i131HYKaLBIdpepY7VV9Zg.text: Food was delicious, service was quick and friendly. Everyone seemed happy and satisfied. Will definitely be back!

QbH6___0zWZwCL3UZ9NSeA.text: Ordered Rehab Burger through GrubHub and was delivered fresh! Everything was fantastic! Highly recommend!

IgZ_v1lTcB00lHsIa2ZM3A.text: A nice large list of burgers to pick from although all us of thought they were just OK. Nothing was amazing and nothing was bad. The atmosphere was just like the food, sort of middle of the road. I am not sure we would be back.

tuC_70vOfPBs9E2ORRtjTA.text: My poor review of them on Facebook was deleted, and I was subsequently blocked from their page.  So here it goes...  This place had the WORST service that comes to my mind in the past two decades.  My wife and I walked in when they opened for lunch.  (Keep in mind they were not busy at the time.)  Not a single welcome from the staff, so we sat ourselves.  When some of the other staff finally decided to finish hanging-out from behind the kitchen, our order was taken from some obviously hung-over dude who was WAY too cool to take off his sunglasses.  Not only did it take forever to get our food, but the sweet potato tots were bland and terribly soggy.  The burgers were sub-par, and left on our plates not worth taking home.  Our server came to our table exactly three times; to take our order, deliver the slop, and drop-off the bill.  Our drinks were NEVER re-filled.  There is NO HYPE to checkout at this place.  They don't even deserve a single star.  Spend your money elsewhere if you want better food and service.

66PYuFZqqzZP8vUaCDjgzw.text: Some of the best burgers around! Not a thing to complain about. Good service, great food. Little spendy but what do you expect in old town Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qFw4szXY9erPIOVRj8OFxQ.text: Probably some of the best burgers in Scottsdale. I always build my own. Great place to go watch a game, get a beer, and have a burger or just bring your family to dine in.

bM5BhxdvhjkrhVhvc8p5TQ.text: Service was awful, order was wrong and we were forgotten by our server-will not be back as 3 shots your out will spend my money elsewhere

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. we were seated and forgotten, no drinks brought and order was wrong! You should not have to hunt your server down for service!

VqxXMpiSiw9tIL76GC6lqg.text: I love the atmosphere of this place. The rehab burgers themselves are huge.  We ate the MacGnarly burger from the recommendation of the waitress (she said it was their version of the Big Mac).  It seemed like everyone in the restaurant gasped when she placed it in front of me since it was easily over half a foot tall.  It was messy, difficult to eat and the flavor didn't blow me away.  Now the PBJ burger was a different story.  I ordered it on the recommendation of yelpers and was very scared to eat this burger that was dripping with hot peanut butter.  I have to say though that I was pleasantly surprised and gobbled that thing up.  I also enjoyed my friend's pulled pork sandwich which was spicy and the onion rings.  The sweet potato tots were a little bland to me.  All in all a cool place and would love to go back when I'm in town again.

VJ3dGy3niyWJmG1WXCqu9Q.text: KICK BACK and enjoy a burger.  One of best places to come in, sit back and chill out. The staff is really friendly.  The food is great.  You have a huge selection of burgers.  While, I'm still loyal to the Chili burger, they have been trying to get me to eat the PB and J burger.  95/5 quality meat.  Order with pretzel bun.  I recommend this place to everyone...even vegetarians.  Keep up the good work....

u9EQ_toAQQyZkdJ6HrN_sQ.text: Came here for Sunday funday, brunch, dinner, happy hour, and this place never seizes to satisfy! Burgers are all great, wings are to die for, let's just say everything on the menu is great, come here with my BF and friends and we always have a good time!

FKVhnGNSKO-eb6GX2T-ncw.text: Definitely a new favorite! I had the poblano burger and it was so good! My husband had the Mac Gnarly burger and even though it took some technique to eat the monster size double patty burger, he really enjoyed it.   Service was great! Our server was very nice and took care of us well. Happy hour is daily until 6pm  Definitely going back!

RF5QdYyJw2Uuvpi1db3PwA.text: My favorite burger place! I used to work near it but now I go anytime I am up near it. The food is great and the service is fun. It's a hole in the wall joint that not many people find, but I will always go for this place. I wouldn't say its health food by 10 miles, in fact I would make sure you're not on a diet and head over here, you will not regret it! The food is just so great, and the spicy ketchup is a must!

vUnzt2B6eUeXLj5mnhquSw.text: As per other reviewers and my servers recommendation, I tried the PB & J burger with sweet potato tots. I did enjoy the burger. I thought it might be too sweet but it wasn't and had a nice little heat. I guess I'm not a tot fan but I didn't really like them. Next time I think I'd get the corn as a side. Other people around me had it and it looked good. I felt it was way too much food for me.  It was one of those meals that started out great but by close to the end of it I was getting a little sick of it. Maybe I would go for the smaller burger next time.  Service was friendly and prompt.  Overall Good experience. I would recommend this place and would return.

POCjUxtWin9xBeUDIAVTcg.text: Brittany was absolutely amazing! She was so personable, friendly, and attentive- she is an absolute jem! Definitely coming back to see her!

jX6L5VVu5R_H-nSdl2wuUg.text: We are in from out of town, and despite being extremely crowded with the Spring Training/Spring Break crowd, the service was excellent and the food was delicious. I don't remember the name of the burger I had, but it was the one with ghostpepper jack cheese, and it had the perfect amount of kick. The onion rings are huge and tasty. Definitely recommend!

Pa2Z-o4oH7Oh96ylHUDY_w.text: You must try the new Chorizo-Beef Patty!!  There are rarely new flavors in the Scottsdale culinary world but today, with the discovery of the Chorizo-Beef  patty at Rehab Burger, I can honestly tell you that your taste buds are in for a brave and fantastic treat!  When I was a kid, my grandmother would wake me up with the smell of chorizo and eggs, frijoles and homemade tortillas.  Mama did not call for me, her food did.  The aroma and crackle of fresh chorizo and eggs beckoned me to the kitchen where I would enjoy the spicy flavors of her homeland. Today, with the style and flare that only Rehab Burger can muster, a new chorizo con beef patty replicates the taste that heretofore  only could be found in my grandmothers East Los Angeles kitchen.  You can order any of the burgers with the Chorizo-Beef patty, but I chose the Pablamo Burger.  Wow!!  Ken prepared my burger medium, and it arrived just as it should, with just the slightest pink in the middle. Served with an egg on top, bacon, cheese, a sweet Pablamo pepper, and sauce... the flavors were amazing!!  So many different tastes burst into my mouth, and the spicyness of the chorizo arrives late, almost as an after-taste... so subtle but unmistakable.  Normally I can't finish one of Rehabs generous plates, but this flavor was so inviting, I kept picking up that burger, bite after bite until it disappeared.  Want a burger you can truly call unique and special?  You must try the Chorizo and Beef Patty now! My Ma Ma is gone, but the special taste she produced each morning in her East Los Angeles kitchen lives on! Thank you Rehab Burger for the flavor and memories I thought were long lost!

otXUKodfXwZ3kRxMA_XCgA.text: A perfect place after a night of drinking!! Love the relaxed atmosphere! Sat on the patio on a perfect AZ 84 degree day and watched the Parada Del Sol parade. Thank goodness my husband and I share. We had the backyard bbq burger  so good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KxBrAx9BFX9pk69tCNJVug.text: Was visiting from Seattle and Rehab was our first stop. Unfortunately it was a big disappointment for us. the burgers are grossly over rated. mind you we hail from a city that hosts Paseo and Red Mill (in Seattle) and Rehab definitely tasted like much hype about nothing. Also I must say the place is relatively expensive (cashing on their popularity) and are not very kid friendly.

jjEjCpvpzdniCMKGeJPRiA.text: Super good food. Great service. They even made me a jalapeno vodka margarita. Delicious burgers.

8wPOucAf2gaHxUH4SsD9EA.text: Drove 45 minutes for a burger based on a friends high recommendation.  I ordered the bacon and blue burger on a soft pretzel bun. I added extra blue cheese crumbles on the burger.  I need to say, I am a burger snob. I know what a good burger is, in fact I've been known to drive 5 hours just to eat at one of my favorite burger joints.  This burger was one of the best burgers, if not THE best burger I've ever eaten.  The portion was huge (included fries) for $12.50 This burger has bacon and blue cheese mixed into the patty and it was outstanding.  This burger was way better than I expected and I love the fact that I only have to drive 45 minutes to get an outstanding burger.  I also need to say that the service was excellent. I went it just a lunch rush started, the server visited me at least 3 times to check in on me. She even gave me a soda refill in a "to go" cup for the road    Great burger! Great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon and blue burger, on a soft pretzel bun with extra blue cheese crumbles on top of the burger,  this was an awesome burger!

xtOUnRaTACy3qHeUg4e6pQ.text: Worst Service Ever our waitress was rude to me because I had a hard time hearing her when we were ordering.  They brought our food and no utensils or napkins. My burger was raw and my husband ordered a second cocktail that didn't show up until our bill came. We came here last year during Spring Training and thought it was wonderful my how things changed in a year!

vBkH4KmJraFlUUZHfxJhPA.text: I took my friend to dinner here, it was her first time. The food was amazing as always! However the service not so much, which is why I'm giving it three stars.   I always come during lunch and get great service and I thought it would be the same during dinner. It wasn't. We had an elderly server who seemed very forgetful and flustered. I arrived at 4:30pm this past Friday When I first walked in letting my friend, it took her about 10 mins to realize I was there to take my drink order.   We ordered our entrees right away, however when our food came out, she didn't bring any napkins or utensils. She came by and asked if everything was good and I asked for some silverware, she said she would be right back. She never came back. 15 mins later, she comes back to refill by water but no utensils. I couldn't eat my side salad cause I had no fork! Not to mention no napkins to wipe my greasy hands! I went to the hostess and asked for some.   The server took a bit to give us our check, we asked for two checks, she came back with one check. Okay fine, we'll split it no big deal. But she took a good 15 mins to get it, my friend moved it to the other side of the table for her to see we were ready. Another 10 mins go by and she hands us the check... We then realized there was no merchant or customer copy, she never swiped our cards! So we had to wait again for a while until we got her attention again to swipe our cards. Her response was, "I've done that to two other tables just now too!" Good thing we're nice people and didn't dip out due to her mistake.   I will still come back but I hope I get better service.

QwFX6XE7f0upHBth46--dQ.text: Ordered a bacon cheese burger tonight. They charged me an extra $.69 for cheese! The manager told me it was extra. Don't let them rip you off too!!! Double check you bill.

4xYWhhi_QfXOKh6C8VzP4A.text: The previous restaurant in this space didn't last long, but Rehab Burger Therapy hit the nail on the head!  They have a great menu of food and drinks and some really tasty beers. There are about a dozen different burgers on the menu and the cool part for me (not a beef eater) is that you can sub in a turkey burger or chicken breast, instead of the beef, for no charge! You also get your choice of bun, and any place that offers a pretzel bun is a winner in my book. Burgers come with skin-on fries or sweet potato tots, both of which are really tasty.  They also serve up a half dozen or so different dipping sauces for your potatoes.    I had their wings on my first visit, in 2 different flavors ... the medium and the Gold Medal sauce.  Both phenomenal!  On my next visit, the server suggested to a friend that his favorite was to mix those 2 flavors for one amazing sauce. I believe it... I'm still sorta day dreaming about those wings.  Mmmm, wings. On this visit I also had the wedge salad as a cooling agent to the spice. This was probably the largest wedge I've had in a while.  It also had about 3 pieces of bacon in large chunks all over it. So good...   Second visit I had the Porkster burger ... I felt like a porkster after eating it! This burger is topped with a heap of pulled pork in their peach-habanero bbq sauce (I subbed in the chicken breast) and cheddar cheese. It is nothing short of magnificent. I ate the whole darned thing, but had to sacrifice and not eat my tots.   The happy hour pricing could be better, but their margarita is pretty delicious and warrants me ordering it again. This is a fairly small place, but its intimate and not too noisy.  I like that they have serene underwater footage playing on the tvs and not just sports blaring at you from every angle. Its pretty peaceful.  And the service here is outstanding.  Both times my servers have been uber-friendly and eager to get you anything you need.  I will be back!!

kXx1Fn4HzQahGGURMg-VNg.text: Awesome atmosphere, great food and friendly staff. Perfect combination!  Some of the combos on the burgers will sound odd but trust me they work. Don't substitute and go for it, you'll love it!   My favorite is the PB & J Bacon burger with fried egg on pretzel bun with sweet po tots for my weekly cheat meal.  Pure heaven! Makes eating clean all week worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great White burger &amp; Corona-rita in honor of shark week.

txBTkzHMyueCnicU6NRc5g.text: Yum!! So many burger choices but everyone at my table went with the spicy mac n cheese burger. So much food, most of us ended up taking some home but it was delicious. Also tried the onion rings which were super crunchy and delicious. Hope to stop by again before leaving AZ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy Mac n Cheese Burger &amp; Sweet Potato Tots, yum!!!

3tM3sAHrftQE1UtezTe0Uw.text: This more a review of bartender "Kaye" than the food.  Ordered wings which were (actually) delicious but watching Kaye in action was great. Super attentive, communicative, enthusiastic and cheerful.  Really sets a great mood for the place.

ObYdfWq3CctJYWGWsIbkDg.text: Cool place, feels like it should be on a beach. Laid back and casual. Usually a wait to get a table. Great happy hour. It is not possible to leave hungry! The burgers are huge!

5PtpqzhycYB4dpN-IKYM_Q.text: Had company from out of state and we were looking for someplace different to eat....we found it.  We all had a different burger. The most unique was the Peanut Butter & Jelly with Bacon Burger.  Not a normal combination for a burger....but it was AWESOME! I had a Patty melt w green chili....very good.  It was a bit crowded....but it was also lunchtime on a busy Saturday in Old Town. We only had to wait about 20 mins.  Waitress we had was great and attentive. Nice family atmosphere or great for a date.  Reasonably priced and definitely enough food for your money.  I'm ready to go back and try something else from thier menu!!!

P0tiqUNynCdIh9exE6lXWQ.text: This may be the only restaurant where you can order and receive a RARE hamburger with no argument over company policy! That goes a long way with me. The taste of the meat itself is good but not quite as tasty as Red Robin's Angus beef. Two negatives: (1) The wait staff is so crazed serving drinks that they have no time to check on you once your food has been served. And (2) Like What-a-Burger, Rehab also has a strange and annoying FETISH about condiments. Like What-a-Burger, there are no ketchup bottles. Rehab gives you a little cup of ketchup which is not enough. At least What-a-Burger let's you take as many of their silly  ketchup packets as you want. At rehab, the waiters are too busy and the place is too loud to get their attention for more ketchup. Any restaurant manager who refuses to serve ketchup in bottles has a screw loose and should stop the childish nonsense. Do you hear me, Rehab??

Xro81p9HsRfvgXFoJFRCsA.text: Good-to-very-good burgers at an appropriate price.  It was mayhem to get in (don't hope for a nearby parking space on Farmer's Market mornings) but we did enjoy our burgers.  We both ordered medium well but my wife's had more pink than mine (and she shies away from pink in the burger).  Mine was unique and tasty but not blow-me-away tasty.  My wife said she thought it was very similar to Cild Beer and Cheeseburgers (the restaurant).  We may go again but are still searching for our "favorite" new burger spot since relocating to the area last summer.

EQ2kIA5rBmxzS_YHE6VaRA.text: Visiting Scottsdale this weekend and had the best burger ever!! The place was way over-crowded, the wait was long and the waitress had too many tables.... but the friendliness of the staff and the amazing food was worth the wait and the crowds. Gluten-Free option for one kid and the bun was delicious. Turkey burger for one kid and it actually tasted great. All fresh and homemade. We'll definitely be back on the next trip

DEfMmL2i5KradA6speSXpw.text: it's the best and biggest burger I had in a long long time. the sweet potato tots didn't disappoint as well. I had the pobalano burger and it rock. margaritas and beer are good

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eYCgOeXJ7KI1YSpYJIptTw.text: Rehab Burger Therapy helped me turn over a new leaf. It honestly changed my life!  My name is Bobbi Billard and I was a Boring-aholic. I went to the same restaurants and I ordered the same thing every time. I was about as vanilla and predictable as it gets. And then I went to Rehab Burger Therapy and expanded my horizons. Mind blown! BOOM!   What?!? You mean there is a place where you can go to that actually combines a burger with bacon and adds some oooey gooey peanut butter and grape jelly with sriracha sauce to it (PBJ & Bacon Burger) and you will try it out and not only will you not get sick, but instead you'll think it is out of this world AMAZING? Like it will become the stuff you dream about and can't get out of your head, until you go back and partake in it again? No flippin way, guy! I'm "Same Girl"! I go to the same places and order the same thing, every time, like a broken record... I'm scared to venture off the beaten path. I may get lost and never find my way home. Yep, I was a real snoozefest! *Zzzzzzzz!*  It took a little coaxing for them to get me to realize the errs of my ways & maybe it was the fact that I was feeling adventurous because I was on vacation, but once I got on the same page as these people, my life, as I once knew it, was never going to be the same! I've seen the light! This place was so magical that pigs can even fly here. Im not kidding! Order the Pig Wings and you'll see for yourself.   No going back to Boringville now. All it took was a little trust and faith and I've forever changed, 100% for the better. I am no longer "Same Girl" and I'm now a recovering Boring-aholic. Admitting that I was one was the first step. I owe many thanks to John (the bartender) and Rehab Burger Therapy. Special shoutout to the other Yelpers for suggesting this place and what to order in the first place! Jon... Black 13! It's on! See ya soon dude! And THANK YOU for saving me from my boring ol' self!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pig Wings... The Bomb!!!

Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PBJ &amp; Bacon Burger. Life is short, try new things! Would have NEVER ordered this normally but sure am glad I did. In LOVE! Will def be back!

ccR2vqE7tcvHdAl4-iRT3w.text: The Mac and cheese burger was fantastic. I highly recommend it! The service was attentive and the restaurant has a cool beachy vibe

5bP0MX5xr48AVvM-izou3g.text: Love the vibe and wacky-cool decor but wasn't all that impressed with the food. I got the Hawaiian chicken burger (with pineapple and ham) and it was super dry and bland. The fries were nothing fantabulous either - kinda dry and mushy. My husband got the chili burger, which he loved. My kids didn't want anything on the menu - there's nothing offered for children. The hubs and I will come back sans kids sometime and see if I just ordered the wrong thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hawaiian chicken burger with ham &amp; pineapple on gluten-free bun

88Xj7aj16UTc2sz4x6LGsA.text: We ordered burgers at the bar, the menu is extensive.  We had a BYOB and veggie burger.  The burgers were OK but the sweet potato tots were soggy and under done.  Disappointed.

E0JaRDPVsp3RrbF2URj6iQ.text: We had a work function in Scottsdale so we decided to have a late lunch/early dinner.  I was surprised when we walked in and found all the tables full but one. We were happy to take the last one. The decor has an island feel complete with the music and decor. The beer was very reasonably priced and there was a great selection. I opted for the coconut porter which was yummy.  We ordered the chili con Fritos appetizer which took a while to come but it was worth the wait. The chili was good and just spicy enough. I opted to the special burger a bacon blue cheese burger. I ordered it on the brioche bun but it came on the pretzel bun instead. I'm going to call this a happy accident because I loved it.  The service was a little slow but it was really busy in there. The food was reasonably priced and very tasty. I would definitely return and may be dreaming of that pretzel bun..

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ranch Burger

X39T8BudZeuMek36zrPjqQ.text: Absolutely love rehab burger! My family and I go every Sunday so we have gotten to know the staff and they always take great care of us.  Amazing food and the best burger in town. Love the McNarghly burger! We are so excited to see them growing to more locations.

o6lFHADkCc2il-z7hGDHvw.text: Very great service (good food takes time, so not super fast) good food and a upbeat environment!

qXhLoEH2N6eDLsqcJ6Rmmg.text: I've heard from a few friends that Rehab has some of the best burgers in town. I was in Scottsdale & decided to give it a try.  The atmosphere is beach-like and I got a table outside. The menu is pretty extensive, but I decided to get the Rehab Bacon Cheeseburger with Fries & a side of Spicy Pineapple BBQ Sauce.   The food came out and the burger was massive. It was pretty intense and I was unable to finish it. The burger was cooked medium just as I asked and had great flavor.   I would definitely go again!

03-i9CUqgyU470S5Z9PPbA.text: Awesome burger and cooked just right.  Friendly staff and excellent service on a busy Wednesday afternoon.

l9vWX0NmIcRUA_wdHidwGQ.text: I actually wasn't a huge fan of this place. The food was mediocre. They have a lot of options but I didn't think either my fiance or my burger tasted great. I had the mac and cheese burger and he had the ghost pepper burger. One plus is that the ghost pepper burger was hot. Also, the hot wings were good.   I was also disappointed that all their salads had so much junk in it. Not one single healthy salad option on the menu. I ordered a side salad with my burger and the lettuce tasted dirty and unwashed.   We also ordered a Bloody Mary which we never got. They seemed understaffed and this was a Monday night.   Wouldn't come back but didn't hate it or love it.

Kjz5NKekI0pEZaoQ14zF3A.text: PB&J burger you are life changing. Initially we came here due to the high ratings we saw on yelp. There's a wide variety of different types of burgers to choose from. Everyone raved about the PB&J one and I was skeptical at first but I figured why not...  Best decision ever. The jam and pb were oozing out every bite and it was the perfect combo of sweet and savory. I also ordered sweet potato tots and they were the best tots that I've ever had.   I'm not from Arizona but that meal is making me reconsider my residency. Jk. But you get the point it's that gooooood!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PBJ burger... You are a game changer

_7ur8TKY83j27LLs1xylFA.text: Deserves every single star. Seating was super quick despite being peak lunch hour. The hostess took us to the patio but we ended up grabbing a seat right inside the building (so still got the great breeze).   Our server (Rian) made some suggestions for drinks and pointed out the happy hour selections.   We ordered the PB&J burger- tastes like it sounds and was A LOT but definitely good. Also got the Jalapeno popper burger (substituted with black bean burger instead of meat). AWESOME!!! Both came with sweet potato bites (but there's an option of fries, etc) and a variety of sauces.   Such a great way to end a holiday weekend. Will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The PB&amp;J burger with sweet potato bites #yum

8mvin-kbI9EmJliDePFUUA.text: Been here twice before and came tonight because Paradise valley burger is closed on Sunday. Service was great the food not so much this time. 08/24/15- Wiley sent me an email and is sending me a gift card for my next visit! I am very impressed with his fast reply and eagerness to please his customers.  3/12/2016 I finally went back to use my gift card. It was a very crowded Sunday afternoon and my minis and I sat at the bar. The service was excellent the food was excellent (their wings are so amazing) and everyone was apologetic for my last visit! I met the owner and she was great as well. You have won us back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My crispy onion straws, wth?!?

8cCFVUti1f9WAGF7-W476A.text: WOW! This place is awesome!!! First of all the selection of burgers will blow your mind - super creative for any palate...and gluten and lactose friendly which usually shy's me away from enjoying a burger. I had the turkey burger on a gluten free bun and it was mouth watering! Our sever was so fun and friendly contributing to the greatness of this place. We arrived just after the lunch rush and it was packed! You know they are doing something right! Next time we are in Old Town Scottsdale we will definitely be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your burger!!!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Turkey Burger on gluten free bun...YUM!!!!

m0o51EV2J8aZeiAFwU7kWQ.text: Excellent burgers with an amazing selection.  I had the smaller (5 oz.) Poblano burger.  Outstanding.  Many of the burger joints that will prepare a rare burger (and many won't) do not know how to do it.  This was a rare burger - crispy on the outside, pink and chewy in the middle.  Perfect.  The much-discussed sweet potato tots were bland, but there were plenty of them.  The beer was cold, and Thursday was all-day happy hour.  Overall, this is an excellent place for an affordable and interesting burger experience.

H_j7KeQJjrBDzTISshMdaw.text: From the moment I walked in, I could tell this place was going to be good. Cool, open indoor/outdoor seating plan, which makes the small, crowded seating seem a little more open. Friendly staff that moves efficiently, and for it being packed when we ate there, both the appetizers and main course came out very quick. The onion rings are HUGE and probably the best I've ever had, and the burgers are mouthwatering and juicy. Would highly recommend and will definitely come back!

Dm9E4NUugYLno38RJuO5dA.text: The best burger I've had in a long time.  I ordered the rehab burger with the egg.  It was amazing.   Great menu choices to be flexible to choose your own bun and substitute for chicken and turkey as well.

wtBxfrVHi5s0RgGf__gnYg.text: This burger joint is pretty awesome. Very casual, family friendly, yet at the same time got the beach bar/sports bar vibe. Friendly staff and lots to choose from on the menu. Got some crazy burgers like spicy mac n cheese, pb&j, the hangover, etc. I went with the jalapeno popper on pretzel buns, 5oz, with potato fries. My burger came with guac and fried egg. Mm mm, SO good. 4 different sauce they give you on the side are amazing too. My favorite was the spicy ketchup. Overall, I left the restaurant feeling full, satisfied, and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

s96iiStMT5hbUhxeOySMlg.text: Hey!  Wanted to stop by and say Thank you from the bottom of our full bellies!  Last Wednesday night, I brought a friend from Colorado to rehab, as part of her journey.  She was here on business, and coming there was, as always a great visit and vibe.  We were chilled on the patio... But the staff scrambled to heat up the patio.  My guest had the pesto pasta, I had a bacon cheeseburger, subbing for blue cheese crumbles.  As always... You didn't leave room for any disappointment.  Thank you!  See you again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Michigan Family, and Arizona Friends .... What a blast!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cool vibe. Laid back atmosphere..  Best tunes.

AUBwMBtFLRnjJzVFkveoPA.text: Place is just over the top for burgers. We tried quite a but and everything was phenomenal. Extremely messy so bring some wet wipes.   I had the Mac and cheese burger and !

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1FL5FyT87wk0PaKCisgi2Q.text: Amazing food!  Here in Phoenix for a fun weekend with family. The food was amazing from this restaurant and gigantic serving sizes. I'll come back again when I'm next visiting Phoenix!

g-P7_0dRXPv7cs973cu1hA.text: Amazing burgers, great beer selection, and huge portions. This place is always a good bet for good food.

rPBUVQUtLoOfZWtbPhZvPA.text: Really 4.5 stars but the half isn't the option. Only a half because it is a little expensive for a burger.   First off, gluten free and customer service are my issues and this place is solid on both these issues. The creative manner that they can make a burger is spot on. The servers were helpful and professional.   Definitely try the spicy Mac and Cheese, my son absolutely loved it.   Parking can be a little challenging but the lot next door was available. I would also suggest the outdoor patio seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

blDw4qQNs_M81jheUi2TLA.text: Mad props to Rehab Burger!!!      My bff moved to Ohio last summer and when we were texting last night she asked me if I could do a biiiiig favor for her. Being the amazing friend I am, I told her yes of course. What was that favor you might ask? Snag an infamous Rehab Burger pen and mail it to her.  Apparently this is her favorite pen ever and she lost it and she really wanted another one. Okay little mermaid, I can oblige.   I ventured there before work this morning right as the restaurant was opening and told the server (I'm assuming she was a server) my dilemma.  I described the red pen and the server was like, "Oh yeah! Did it look like this?" *She flashes me her groovy red pen* "Yeeeees!!!!" I exclaim.  She was totally cool and happily gave me a pen I could mail to my bestie despite the fact I wasn't there to stay, eat, and spend money.   My bestie said that the restaurant had a beachy vibe and she really misses it and I need to go eat there.   I vaguely remember eating at a burger joint in Old Town a few years ago taking a picture of a hip skeleton wearing a PEANUT BUTTER AND JELLIOUS tshirt. Same skeleton, different shirt. I had been here before!!!  Thank you to the server and the manager for making my day this morning. I can hardly wait to mail my best friend allllllllllll the cool red Rehab Burger pens. ;)  ~Niki (and Ariel)

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The infamous Rehab Burger pen!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Every photo has a story. Don&#39;t make this the greatest one never told....&#34;

4iZfdvjrpG3fyydN4og1vQ.text: This restaurant had an amazing variety of burgers and a great vibe. The servers are nice and although small a great place to go with friends or family. The food was great and not overpriced which is a nice surprise for the area. Would come again!

okQzq3IfpNt7J-difEvW8g.text: Really good food that was worth the wait. We had the chili Fritos and they were amazing and super unique. The atmosphere was also really cool. Our waiter was very nice and comfortable to talk to, he gave us some info on the town since we were visiting. I had the pesto pasta with chicken and it was amazing and the portion was huge. Definitely would go back again when I'm in town.

7yoXDRCRm6QGN4ZIOlhOrA.text: Wow!  This place is great!  Excellent burger and drink selection, with attentive service.  I had the Mac and cheese burger, but added the ghost pepper cheese which I'm half I did as the spicy Mac needed the extra heat.  The shaken margaritas were a good drink at a fair price.

4r0N6-4fGUSm_u-KN62fgw.text: We all deserve a cheat meal occasionally. Too bad my new fav cheat burger is sooooo far from home.  I've cooked great burgers and I've eaten great burgers, but this place takes the cake.  The reason our meal was so great wasn't just the food.  Salyna took us on a damn burger adventure. She helped us to be bold and try the PBJ bacon Sriracha burger and encouraged us to try things that seriously sounded a little silly.  The wings were a mix of 2 sauces and she ordered them extra crispy.  I'm not gonna lie my mouth is straight up starting to water just thinking about them.  The burger was excellent. The wings were incredible. The service was heavenly.  Salyna thanks for making our day. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coronarita!!

1XhfgKZKH6RXfPQzNBvMCw.text: We ordered the B.Y.O.B and added mac and cheese, cheddar cheese, and a pretzel bun. The sweet potatoe tots were pretty good, the burger was ok, although I would not recommend adding the mac and cheese (it wasn't bad but not the best either). The staff was nice, however we did wait about 30 minutes before we were seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. B.Y.O.B with added mac and cheese, cheddar cheese, and pretzel bun, and sweet potatoe tots.

24TZKAQgeJGU_cINZ15SOg.text: Came here with my fam. And loved everything about it. Service was great (Samm was our server she was amazing) and food was even better!! Philly cheese fries were on point. Burger was delish. They don't have a kids menu, but they still managed to make a pb&j sandwich for my niece. Price was good too! (And clean restrooms lol).

59V6Bc0dFs73MYb1dMUJRw.text: One of the most delicious and huge burgers in town are here, staff are cordial and they are fast. Also they have sweet potato balls and drink specials. Highly recommended

99b1WtrbvaDuX1gMUopLKg.text: Worst food and service in all of Old Town. Cold food, burgers were supposed to be medium rare, they were well done, and tasted similar to tire.

oow0ct7rXhVXcNAfaJ3P-A.text: Great food and decent portions. Very slow service (during a non-busy time). Nice staff.

XpNlrivdLkdnqQU2KWew-Q.text: Sweet poTOToes were amazing, piineapple dipping sauce...oh so good Philly cheesesteak fries...yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JkcpWKclOreqpDrIjzAaiw.text: This place is phenomenal we decided to try a few of the different strange burgers like the PB&J burger and the different Mac n Cheese burgers! Everything came out above our expectations and their sauces made the meal extraordinary! I will definitely recommend this to others!

pwa1qh4a1P3R8A8E0PaVvg.text: Had a bacon cheeseburger on a white bun. Bum was fresh and spongy.  Yum! The burger was very juicy and delicious. Happy hour was good also. Had a Cape Cod and it was poured very well.   My husband had the The Big Beefstro and he enjoyed it. It was loaded with meat! The only thing I had a concern was the ranch sauce. It wasn't like a ranch I'm used to but it was ok. Our server was great also. For my first time here, I will come back.

dSp3jvhOmqH5OVFQXPAkCw.text: My newest obsession! The Mac and cheeseburger is out of this world. I tried the PB&J burger too and I was amazed how decadent it is. Don't be shy! Also- the wings are the best in town and totally under played.

Ro_WWpijwJM6YT3pZQR59w.text: Well worth the wait.  We arrived on a Saturday at 1:30pm for a group of 7 and we waited over 30 minutes.  Server and overall vibe was enjoyable.  The burger and the speciliteis are really huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JJlPcCiHykHAktCtKVf1MQ.text: Very good burgers and other foods. Very friendly staff and service was excellent. The decor was surf boards and bicycles hanging from the ceiling. I would go back for any casual meal

TY-6Uj8emmf40km_qoxHQg.text: A resounding yes!  I have been a couple of times and sat on the porch.  It is definitely worth the wait!  The service is spectacular and the menu is fabulous... even the pasta!  The serving sizes are huge so come hungry and come often!

NdEy_NY8Hr4w9Vel5yTKmg.text: Gotta start off with the service. Our waitress Kaye was amazing. She provided phenomenal service and there was not one thing we had to wait on or ask for. We ordered the BYOB with bacon, rib-eye, onion rings, and cheddar cheese with the tater-tots, the porkster burger (burger topped with pulled pork, BBQ sauce and cheese) with onion rings, and the philly cheesesteak fries. The burgers can be ordered either with a 5oz patty or a 10oz patty. We opted for the 10oz and they were huge. Definitely will get the 5oz next time. The shaved rib eye was so tender and flavorful and we could not stop eating it. The pulled pork on the burger was so juicy and tender that alone could have been a meal. The fries, onion rings and tater tots were all perfectly cooked and crispy. They have a few different sauce options you can order that come in the side. We tried the pesto aioli, the pineapple teriyaki, and the siracha aioli. The pesto was amazing for the burger and the pineapple sauce added a sweet one sweet combo for the tater tots that tasted great. This is a definite must when in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BYOB: beef patty, shaved rib eye, onion rings, bacon, cheddar with tater tots
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Monthly special
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa

vifD3sRSlAYUNEqFli99-Q.text: I ordered the larger chili burger which proved too much to eat,fries okay. Didn't care for the chili,it soaked the bun so it fell apart.I ordered medium but it came out medium rare center uncooked.Prices are high some burgers are $16 ! Sort of a calypso atmosphere.Very little parking so you have to find a place on the street.Good happy hour specials.I am shocked by all the 5 star ratings,nothing out of the ordinary.

YcsHSImBiS_sRh0ySz7O4g.text: Peanut butter and jelly...mac and cheese, burger sound good...welp it was! Tater tots fries are kinda a desired taste as they are kinda sweet maybe if they were paired with a spicy ketchup they'd have been better...but the mac was delicious! The drinks were good and there's a nice (when the sun is down) patio. There were lots of options and dozens of combinations yum! If you haven't tried it you should!

taTpLylOIzAhPHp4BxGghA.text: Delicious juicy fresh creative burgers. 6 ounce and 10 ounce. Up8MMofw9CaWpTsNsXlk4Q.text: Good service & good food! Waitress was on top of things & food came out in a timely manner. My burger (patty melt) was messy (2 pattys and lots of sauce) but delicious! Great and different from normal sauce choices.

b--kvFUtfZW55v0JZ-LE5w.text: The burgers here are over-the-top! So large you can't even get your mouth around them! Did I also mention the quality was fantastic? Sit at the bar, the service was terrific. I also recommend the Miketie, a not-so-sweet approach to an old Polynesian favorite.

j0EdcnyKUQdnECljgHm02w.text: Such a cool place to have a burger. Original deco. Friendly staff. And delicious food for a good price. I really enjoy their many dip flavors, especially the pineapple one.  My recommendation #1: come there when you're really hungry if you want to empty your plate ;)

cPrBpooaXNX8FyF92Jfm3g.text: As I was walking around Scottsdale Old Town, this place popped up on Yelp...probably because one of my co-workers has written about it. He recommended the PB&J Burger, which sounded like an odd combination: peanut butter and jelly on a piece of meat?   Well, I gave it a try and I have to say that I'm convinced: it's a good combo. Although, I have to say that I'd probably like to eat two smaller burgers: one with this unusual combination and the other one in a more traditional style...it was all a bit too much in the end. So, if you're here with a friend: share this one!  It's a busy place; luckily I was by myself and was seated at the bar right away, but I saw other folks who had to wait for a table for quite some time.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peanut butter and jelly burger...sounds odd, but it&#39;s actually quite tasty

2BGExDQ5I-J3MD160--Oeg.text: Pretty disappointed with the service I received tonight. I had Bariatric surgery and I am not able to eat and drink at the same time so I got to the restaurant about 4pm I was able to drink my water and then enjoy my mai tai. The rest of our party showed up and we then ordered our food. I have to say the food never disappoints PB & J hamburger still amazing. However as we sat and talked after dinner the waitress came over and took our water away one by one and literally cleared our table as we sat and talked. We had intended to buy dessert but the feeling of not wanting us there made us leave.

pj5qKS-UbnqQUO6poo6M-Q.text: Tough rubbery burgers, completely gross. Side salad of limp lettuce, a sprinkle of shredded cheese, tasteless tomato, couple of croutons snd a slice of cucumber...

4Z7qshxPV5Be_M_Pe-IBlQ.text: I forgot about this place until my friend suggested it as a less busy dinner option. We still had to wait 20 minutes on a Saturday night but that was probably less than other spots.  We decided to get the chicken wings appetizer and our server suggested we mix the medium sauce and Gold Medal sauce, a Southern BBQ mix of vinegar and mustard. Those were delicious and we finished them. For our burger, we ordered and split  the jalapeno popper with the veggie patty. The description sounded promising: guacamole, cream cheese, cheddar, and jalapeno poppers on a pretzel bun. However, all together it was bland. The flavors didn't stand out and there was no kick, the jalapenos weren't spicy and I had to add salt but it didn't help. It needed spice and heat for sure, maybe something sweet to balance too.  Not sure I'd rush back anytime soon, considering how many other dining options there are in Old Town, but the wings were worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken wings with a mix of the medium and gold medal sauces
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jalapeño poppers burger with a veggie patty

CkV4_jbOx5uqhhaL8BCuhA.text: I'm a huge fan of burgers but this place takes the top champion spot.    Does the pb&j and bacon burger look and sound like a mess?  It is...but oh my goodness who knew that something so basic could be the secret sauce! I'm going to just guess that it's creamy Jiff peanut butter. They really load that sucker up to where I'm using it to redip my burger and even try it with my sweet potato tater tots.    The bacon itself was incredibly thick with a slight sweet and smokey flavor.  Although my tastebuds could be confused because of the jam as well. Who cares just know it's good!  This is all wrapped up in a delicious pretzel bun.   The burger wasn't the only thing that was delicious. The sweet potato tots itself was the cherry on top!  Yum!  I do want to note that the a/c didn't work.  It is Phoenix so everyone's A/C breaks down. However I did overhear a customer say "this place is always hot!"  I tried ordering something on tap but they said the beer was warm because the refrigerator/cooler where the kegs were was broken. I did end up ordering a Modello instead which was on happy hour.   Would this place be worth it if there was no A/C ever in the hot desert? Still yep!

2Z7qwnNHDFaZ8wqCsRkGfA.text: Burgers were delicious... sweet potato tater tots also delicious. Very cool laid back ambience.

wJH_mtjiFtvJ0xeX3F1rcg.text: 4.5 stars, rounded up.  I'm a huge fan of burgers, and the food here is quite delicious. Their burgers are HUGE, and I very much enjoyed my meal. We ordered the Backyard BBQ Burger (swapped out the colby jack for cheddar cheese) with sweet poTOToes (so good!), and the Mushroom & Swiss Burger with a side caesar salad.   The BBQ burger was amazing - the flavors were on point, the burger was juicy, and the onion rings added nice texture.  Mushroom & Swiss burger - good cook on the burger, but it lacked flavor. The meat was quite bland and under seasoned, especially since Swiss cheese and mushrooms are both very mild in taste. Not as good as the BBQ burger.   The service is good, portions are very generous, and the prices are reasonable. The menu is extensive and there are SO many burgers, drinks, sides, etc. to choose from. I would definitely come back!

rCQduH404KDHj2sQ16TmYA.text: Over priced chips and salsa. They weren't that great either. They were as thick as a tostada and had no real flavor to them. The salsa wasn't even a bit spicy. So skip that even if there's a yelp coupon for it.  Burger was okay, I had better.  Service was also just okay. Took a long time for our server to greet us but he was very attentive after that. He's was probably the best thing about it.  Being in old town Scottsdale I would try something else next time.

O1bkZ_5QYbmzKlvk9wv2nQ.text: This place is super fun and delicious! I got the hangover burger with the mistake of ordering 10oz, but I brought the other half home. My boyfriend got the burger that is infused with blue cheese and bacon; and note that it only comes in a 10oz burger. The sweet potato tots is where it's at though! The pineapple aioli sauce to dip them in was amazing!   We also ordered the pork ribs and those just slid off into your mouth and were mouth watering delicious.   The pot brownie though was the best part of dinner. It came with peanut butter and marshmallow and came out warm and melted in your mouth. You can add ice cream as well, but the brownie itself is more than enough to split for two people!

PLCLg13CcDW54xfgs4HOQg.text: Cool spot, good service and above average burgers and great onion rings. A better selection of draught beers would make it a 5 star burger joint.

pUReobmgEPQ_P7iC3DEISA.text: Food was good but the lack of proper A/C in June in Phoenix made it a poor experience. I've never eaten a meal inside of a sauna but I imagine this was as close as one would want to get.

4VjwASS4g0WrmgI0suPjZA.text: 4.5 stars So we arrived here for lunch after getting off a plane from Detroit.  With surfboards on the wall and TV's with videos of the beach looping on flat-screen TV's, it felt like we had landed in Hawaii and not the middle of the desert! Loved the open-wall style of the restaurant, so you could eat inside but still feel warm breezes.   Hawaiian and Know Poblano Burgers were tasty.  Almond vodka margarita was strong and helped to reinforce the island theme.  :)  Chipotle aioli was fantastic with the fries.  Sweet potato tots tasted like fried bits of sweet potato pie (too rich for me, and I have a sweet tooth).  I'd recommend if you get a smaller burger ("relapse" portion) you make sure to get it medium-rare or rare, not medium, if you like your burger juicy.  Service was somewhat slow at the early side of the lunch rush on a Friday (40 min or so to get food).  Our server was attentive and did a good job with recs.

AFsui7_9kAwQCr9maNMvFA.text: This place was freakin AWESOME! Came here for the first time  after a baseball game and  was totally worth it! Burgers are delicious, corn on the cob was sooo good must have like crack in the seasoning cause I want more lol! Wish we had this in Vegas! I can't wait to come back down for spring training, definitely a must go to place!

KeoVMVqKLp7YJ4Tsc8K7TA.text: Some of the best gourmet burgers around, made and served by people who care. We've heard of Rehab Burger Therapy for a while now, and finally got a chance to try it out. Wow! The service and the food are absolutely top notch.  We went on a Sunday night and parking was not a big issue - there is a large free lot right next door. Located in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale, Rehab gives off a relaxing beach vibe with the decor - it's like a cantina in Montego Bay that serves hamburgers unlike any you've had before. Great laid-back ambiance that is enhanced by the friendliness and approachability of the staff. The place is not that big, but the table arrangements are so that you never feel cramped, there is room for everyone to be comfortable. We told the hostess it was our first time, and they just jumped at the opportunity to treat us like VIP's - even the owner, a super cool dude named Wiley stopped by to say hello. You can tell this is a place where management truly cares about every guest that walks through the door. It's not a corporate or franchise atmosphere - it's a local family-style atmosphere, where you feel like they care more about you as the diner, than just getting you to pay the check. This is rare in today's fast-paced high-turnover restaurant industry, and it sets Rehab apart from the others. Our server, who was very attentive and funny, took our orders promptly and got us our beers really fast. We enjoyed the funny stories he told us, especially about some guy who ordered 3 10oz patties and topped that burger off with pulled pork & a fried egg and ate the whole thing! Yikes! While I will never order anything like that, I wasn't quite prepared for the monstrous sized portions you get here. While the prices are in the $10-15 range for the burgers, you definitely get value for your money. We started with some yummy appetizers - chicken wings and "pig wings". The chicken wings were the smaller sportsbar variety but they were nice and crispy with a delicious spicy pineapple bbq sauce. I like that the sauce was more of a zesty kick than a burn-your-mouth hot wing. It was perfectly balanced. The pig wings are basically bone-in pork knuckles and are out of this world! The meat was incredibly tender and tasty. We also got a side of the pineapple teriyaki aioli, which was fantastic. I would definitely order those again without thinking twice.  My girlfriend ordered the Chili burger - it was cooked medium as she asked, and she loved it. While I'm not a chiliburger guy, I tried a spoonful of the just the chili and it was quite good, perfectly seasoned. I ordered the Mac Gnarly burger, medium well and it arrived cooked-to-order (this is important as so many places either under or over cook their patties), and omg this thing was a MONSTER. It was two 5 oz patties, with a bun in the middle too, smothered in aged cheddar & 1000 island dressing. Seriously the largest burger I have ever seen in my life - it was a masterpiece. You'd think this was a fork n knife meal, but being the experienced burger eater that I am, I was able to eat most of it with my two hands. I cannot overemphasize how hugely massive and tasty this burger was. Definitely one of the best I've had. Wow factor x1000.  The dessert menu has 1 item, and after tasting the pot brownie, they don't need anything else. This was a supremely decadent and carefully prepared delicacy. As stuffed as I was after the Mac Gnarly, this brownie was just too darn good to let my girlfriend eat alone! Needless to say, we went home absolutely satisfied with our meal.  I highly recommend Rehab Burger Therapy - the quality of the food, the value for the money paid, the quality of service, and the fun relaxing ambiance make this one of the best burger joints in the Southwest. No surprise they keep racking up the awards! When you go...arrive hungry!

z0H216ddjdapBygGg6icGw.text: OMG I love this place...I finally found a place where I can have my baby brother, who has an appetite of football player, Tapout....hahah....burgers are huge....the taste is the bomb.com will be bringing all my visitors from out of state here!!!!! Servers are awesome!!!! Great service!!!!

HtEd35RcTXMx8e_EJeNR6Q.text: Best burger in Phoenix. The PB&J Siracha burger is delicious, even though it sounds weird, it's the best burger ever.

FHD9LhvyzI8NVWMNWUg3kg.text: This place is great!!! The customer service is fantastic and the food is great. I bring any friends visiting out of town here and they're always impressed. Also rian was our waiter this last time and he was great

dVsByGWfRHH4bpXNjvN6EQ.text: The burger here is one of best I ever had, my wife and son both had a salad which they raved about, service was excellent. Bottom line this is a True five star.

Lr6ek-GLPH2XtBwjGQ9hoQ.text: A must try & unique menu offerings. Portions are huge & we couldn't finish our meals but everything we ordered was delicious.

_hhegFWyF9iBaYtUOQW39Q.text: Creative and amazingly delicious food!  Get the sweet potato tots with teriyaki dipping sauce.  I love the peanut butter and jelly, bacon and sirracha burger.  So good!

JuEgCDLk4opqYiNCCqBzIg.text: Burger was good, nice big 10 ouncer with fries. Very pricey, but kinda worth it. Was a bit busy for the lunch rush so the food wasn't gonna come out sizzling. Service was good, bar tender was very kind and polite. It was a good fix. Gives off a Hawaiian/Californian vibe with the reggae music and interior decor. Appealing to the board enthusiast. Gives off the indication that the owner like skateboarding, snowboarding and surfing. Carry a few $20s in yer' pocket because a Heiniken in a bottle will cost you almost $6. Them Cali/Hawaii prices. Maybe when I come back on my next visit my review will be a bit more enthusiastic.

IQ7xC6Dc75yWKA_Zk3jhfA.text: Can I give this place 6 stars?  We had a great experience here the other night. We arrived with a toddler who was really hungry and the owner bent over backwards to accommodate his needs despite having a packed house on a Thursday night.  I had the PBJ burger and my wife had poblano and both were excellent. At first I thought PBJ would be a little gimmicky, and though I'm always seeking out highly-regarded burgers wherever I go, I felt this was something genuinely innovative and well executed.  Visiting from Austin, this place reminded me of a many of our local favorites: Hut's Hamburgers (menu), Hula Hut (tiki bar atmosphere) and Freebirds (decor/quirkiness) with an extensive bar on top of that.   I returned to get something to go on a Sunday at 3p and every seat at the bar was full along with half the tables so it's no secret that this place rocks.

MtEPQ57-viTthqGI1RD2dA.text: Waking up with a hangover from the night drinking before, my friend and I scoured Yelp to try and find some food that would catch our eye.  Upon seeing a highly rated burger joint with 'Rehab' in the name, we knew it was meant to be so off we went.    I wasn't sure what to expect but on first glance it seemed like a restaurant I'd find on the beach, with colorful decor and reggae playing throughout.  Our waitress (and hostess) immediately greeted us with a smile and asked where we wanted to sit, and being how perfect it was outside, we chose the patio.    The first thing that caught my eye was cheap beer for happy hour.  $2 domestic and $3 imports had me rethinking my hangover from the night before but I stuck with a soda instead.  Next thing was to peruse the menu.  Based off recommendations on here, I knew I HAD to try the Sweet PoTOToes with whatever I got (I love me some sweet potato fries whenever possible) so that was one less thing to worry about.  I ended up going with the Porkster burger (BBQ pork on top of a 5oz burger) and it was EXACTLY what I needed.  I ordered Chipotle Aioli with the poTOToes and, as always, that is a killer combination.  The meal was the perfect cure and it helped that the service was top-notch.  The waitress had a smile, joked and seemed to know the right things to say and was speedy as can be.  I can't wait to go back and give it a go again, as they have won a customer for life!

1RajQp4kExjOzKEvn2vwtg.text: Great atmosphere, good food and service, prices are reasonable...but why not GREAT ? My friend ordered her chili hatch  burger cooked medium and it was served rare. She did not notice until I did and was so hungry that she decided to eat it and  only bring it to the server's attention versus complain.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich and it came piled high on "Beach" toast with layers of avocado, tomato, havarti cheese and sprouts...it was a delicious monster of flavors and came with sweet tater tots (you also have the choice of french fries) which were to die for. Shame on me,  I also ordered a chocolate lava shake which was delicious and not too sweet. The shake was served in a tall glass topped with whipped cream and M&M's.  The restaurant itself is not pretentious at all and rather casual in atmosphere sporting surfboards against the wall and cycles hanging from the ceiling.  Overall, it was a nice experience, a good discovery and a nice change from the other burger joints. I enjoyed the fact that RBT is more of a sit down place versus standing in line to have to order your food. It's also nice that the burgers and sandwiches come with a choice of fries versus having to pay extra for them. The restaurant also has a full bar and a heated patio.

DiUl0B3G2xs3Y8vwTsU-nw.text: The burgers are awesome. They have so many unique options and all the ones we have tried so far are great!!! The service is always good. Their sweet potato tots are Amazing!!

blWKBsFUaeIOO2vYZtoAIQ.text: I have dreams when I am out of town about the Cuban here...I realize how ridiculous that sounds but I literally crave it. The service here has always been top notch and they have great drinks. You really do have to try it once and then you will be like the rest of us.....5 pounds heavier because you keep coming back! The burgers are amazing too, cooked to perfection.

QDAacg9AkKlAZEgfbZK59Q.text: I have been to Rehab a couple of times, the burger place not the real kind, and each time I have enjoyed my meal and the excellent service.  The owners are always around and will stop by to chat, they really want the experience to be a good one for their customers.  The sweet potato tots are awesome, especially with the special dipping sauce that has some heat to it.  I always get the smaller sized burger, and with all the toppings and the tots, it is more than enough food.  My favorite one is the Hatch Chile Cheeseburger, just enough heat and they always cook them perfect (I like mine medium rare and I am always getting them overcooked!)  The Turkey Burger is also a solid choice with avocado and pepper jack.  And, unlike many of the other burger places, they have other stuff on their menu too, pastas, sandwiches, and salads.  If I need a burger fix in the Old Town area, Rehab is my top choice.

j-K_hX1ymu166_5qfosg6g.text: Visiting family and we were looking for a place to grab some food in the Scottsdale area.  Found Rehab Burger Therapy on Yelp and decided to hit it.   Very cool place.  Definitely has personality here.  Bicycles hanging on the ceiling.  The staff was great, lots of beer selection.  The burgers were fantastic!  I had the Hangover Burger Relapse with their taters.  Let me tell you, the relapse size was perfect bc then I had room to eat the taters dipping them into the various sauces they have.  The spicy ketchup is delicious!  Everyone at our table were very happy with their choice of burgers.  Big, juicy, and perfectly cooked all of them.  This place is great if you want a casual burger joint in the Scottsdale area.

c36CRRzJrEwkJUL9s3WjKQ.text: After researching burgers spot, I found this place. One of the best burger joints in town and they did not disappoint! I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and it came with fries. The burger was delicious. The problem came with the service. I watched the gal take my check and money and run back to the cash register. Then I watch her chop it up with staff and just kid of stand around. So I had to go and get her to get my change. She goes, oh yeah your change. I was thinking, how can you forget that. Then she asked her coworker to give her some change  for my bill and hands me 8 bucks no receipt. I then ask for a receipt. As I was walking out, I looked at the receipt and it showed total charge, $9.45. I gave her a twenty and got 8 bucks back! I go back and say how did you short change me so much? So, then she hands me ten dollars...and I look at her like, where's the other 45 cents? She and her coworker told me that they don't keep or give our CHANGE! I said, well your not keeping it! Then she hands me a whole dollar and I look at her like, Are you serious? I hand her back the dollar and told her to keep it. I then called and complained to management which said, shes been here for a long time and we haven't had any problems with her service. Really?? I'm scared to go back for fear of my food being harmed...#Rehabbing from being pissed right now!

WQEv8sLbk7zGj-zve9Zhaw.text: With friends visiting, we don't usually try new places, but take visitors to our old favorites, but being that we are all new parents, out to lunch with the babies, some of the usual Old Town hangouts were off the list. We walked up, and there were quite a few other families inside, so decided to give it a try. The staff was incredible.  The 2 hosts were above and beyond. Having babies with you comes with a lot of accessories...diaper bags, stroller, shopping bags, and the crazy kids! They were unscathed by all of it, and helped us out. The hosts went out of the way for us, and made our whole experience terrific. They were attentive, made small talk, and played with the babies.   The food was good.  The Bloody Mary's need some work. But the overall experience was above & beyond for us. Would highly recommend!

0HTko-bxV42GqRL_I7Ikcw.text: This was my first time here and I was so impressed. Amazing food and atmosphere. I had bacon burger on a pretzel bun with fresh avocado and sweet potato tots with two awesome dipping sauces. Can't wait to go back with friends.

bK1esO-Ilht-djeSbuv_OQ.text: Visiting Phoenix for a Cardinals game and my husband found this place on YELP!  When we drove by it looked a bit sketchy and I was a bit leery to go inside.  I checked out the pics on YELP and boy was I glad I did!  The burgers are fabulous!  The place is small but the atmosphere was fun and the food did not disappoint!  I would definitely make Rehab Burger a go to spot when we are back in town!
