UWUJ9M0GZTUHDB6BfJd4Ew.text: Awesome- sums it all. Great food, great atmosphere and great burgers. Happy every time we visit!

qhDRK5Z5LQCxBJl1GDbFkA.text: We had an hour to kill so went in on a Saturday around 12:30pm. Definitely a popular place and we were able to secure a spot at the bar. Great service to get cold beers and onion rings out fast. They followed up with constant checks on water refills and to make sure the food was to our liking. We split a Patty Melt....at the suggestion of the bartender/waiter who said it came with 2 large patties of beef ( he wasn't kidding!). Thank goodness....it was all we could eat! Would have loved to try their desserts. Everything reasonably priced and served fresh. Only dig was that bathroom only had one spot and the party prior to me.....took forever. Aside from that, great time!

zQwPGPQ5zzhyU47SUScEfA.text: Caribbean Island themed restaurant tucked away in the middle of Old Scottsdale. The menu had alot of interesting choices for those craving a burger that would easily add a few inches to anyone's waist size. I went with the Bacon and blue Rehab Burger on a pretzel bun. ( 10oz. burger with bacon and blue cheese cooked inside of it) and I had normal fries. I've had better blue cheese burgers than this at other places.. I couldnt put my finger on it but something just tasted a little off with this one. So I was disappointed with that. I should have just got the same thing my wife ordered. She opted with the spicy macaroni and cheese Burger. With sweet potato tots. She gave me the rest of her's and I enjoyed it much better. So I'm not doubting that this place has good burgers, I just made the wrong choice off their menu. But if your looking for good food that will make your gut feel guilty then look no further.

Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon and blue Burger w/fries . tamato lettuce,onions on the side

uFi2gZTsS8_R7mrrfGXU9g.text: This is more of a novelty place than anything else. While their burgers are good, I wouldn't go here repeatedly just to eat their food. The other items on their menu are pretty average in comparison to most other restaurants you find in the area. Definitely hit this up if you like wacky, unusual burgers, but if you're looking for an every day fantastic burger joint this may not be the spot.

R0UQMC49tWVO4fCupNENtw.text: Pretty good burgers. Their influence from Oregano's is clear. Good food, fair price.  Limited seating We have been here several times.  One block off of Scottsdale Road.  Fresh bread makes the burgers good.  Many toppings available from cheese to peanut butter!

rcXCy-nIxm9G7NAs_ofsWw.text: Once again Yelp comes through. Over 1100 reviewers rate this place 4 1/2 star average. They were right on. One of my Yelp friends wrote a review that convinced me to come in for Therapy. My wife and I came here for lunch. First of all let me say parking shouldn't be a problem as there is a parking corral just behind the restaurant. The decor is tropical leaning toward a beach theme. We showed up around noon on a weekday and were seated immediately. Right away I got a coupon when I checked in for $3.99 salsa and chips. Our waiter brought them right out with our drinks.  I got the Ghost Burger. This comes in 2 sizes. The relapse size which is like a quarter pounder, and the rehab sized which is like the half pounder. After reading other reviews I knew I should only order the relapse size. The Ghost Burger rehab size comes with two relapse burgers grilled to order, blanketed in ghost pepper jack cheese and topped with crispy onions and fresh guacamole. The relapse size comes with one burger.  The chips and salsa were amazing. They use flour tortillas and deep fry them making the chips a crispy golden brown. The salsa is made fresh and has a little bite to it. The Ghost Burger is a fire ball of deliciousness. The burger was juicy and grilled to me specification perfectly. For a little added kick I asked for some siracha. I chose to have mine on a Kaiser roll. It's a little larger and held all the toppings well. We were planning to get dessert, but had no room. I will have to return to try some other unique burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ghost Burger and fries
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tropical decor

CWVAq58Wko8WGsLMc_8_EQ.text: Best burger place ever! I love the whole experience. Creative new burgers every week and the best margaritas I've had. Ok now I'm hungry...

1RPdCW53hleFoRUvmHkXow.text: Boom!   A big ol burger, funky flavors, something a little different and great service.   You gotta try this place.     I've heard about this place that mixed peanut butter and jelly, sriracha sauce on a burger made of choice, and no, it wasn't from someone who was pregnant.    I scoffed, but the look on their face showed they were serious about how much they liked it.   I had to try.      We rolled in and gave it a try.    The place has atmosphere, which I liked immediately.    The service was johnny on the spot;   friendly, and fast at the end of a work day.    Our waitress was funny and was spot on.   We liked her immediately.   Then the food came out.    BP&J Bacon Burger:   its ridiculous.    I like to think I know my way around a kitchen, and am a bit creative bit this thing changed my life.   It was epic.   I didn't even know you could do that, but they did.    It was seriously sloppily delicious.   I'll go back, but next time with a knife,  fork and a giant napkin that won't be big enough to to wipe  the smile off my face.   The only star I can knock off, is the chef wasn't quite paying attention to the difference between medium rare and well done.   A couple burgers had to go back, and still weren't right.  Don't ask how you want your burger, if you're not going to cook it that way (or the chef doesn't know what the difference is as it pertains to his brain and when to flip the burger).   You guys almost have it nailed!  Nicely Done Rehab Burger!

F2qA2Q-K-R97hxVURoZQMg.text: Either table service or sit at the bar to enjoy lunch, dinner or a late night meal.

R4s1SOmEaIukBvsvLzJvLg.text: GREAT FOOD!! Great service!! Relaxed atmosphere/bar setting. I had asked the waitress what was good and she praised the PB&J bacon burger on a pretzel bun, so I ordered it with with sweet potato tots, it was good but def have to love pb&j to enjoy it, next time I'd say light PB! The tots were great! My husband ordered the Ghost Burger, BEST BURGER EVER!!!! I can't even!!!! The grill taste of the patty and oh the CHEESE!!!! He had onion rings with his, they were huge. We're from Texas and LOVE hot and spicy food, I got the chips and salsa and it was HOT and the chips were so crispy and yummy!!! We would def eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZDMFdW9YvkTjqFatOxjErA.text: If you've been around Scottsdale for a while you might remember Pischke's Paradise which was a casual, beach theme, Jimmy Buffett, style restaurant where you could go without having to feel like you were in "Snobsdale". Rehab has that same vibe, although it focuses almost exclusively on burgers and doesn't have the same menu selection that Pischke's had.  However, the burgers are really good, so that makes up for it. If you're really hungry, get the Rehab size burger and if you're not so hungry get a Relapse. However, either way, get a side of sweet potato tater tots to go with them and you'll thank me later.  Service is fast and friendly, seating is ample, and there's rarely a wait to get a table. If the weather is nice, go ahead and sit on the patio. But most of all, just relax, rehab, and have a great time.

Hx6a6PEZQ4JSop7wbhMFYw.text: Was so excited to try the PBJ burger and was super bummed with it! It tasted like a jar of jelly with a hamburger patty in it! My husband got his own and his was nothing but peanut butter and when I say nothing but i was like 1cup of peanut butter! I'm sticking to state 48 PB&j burger

PpXVdSYrp4y_hirwCys6hw.text: Second time coming here and won't be my last! This time I had the wings.. did not take a pic but let me say they are juicy and flavorful! We got the spicy pineapple I believe. And the burger in the picture is the spicy Mac and cheese burger! Second time getting that burger!! This place is so cute! Waitresses are so sweet. The menu has a lot of choices and the alcohol as well! If you're in Scottsdale and want great food, come on over!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JOz8HV1MIGHLcTdq3AW-Ag.text: THE BOMB!! PERIOD love it, love it, love it. Love it and did I say how killer the service is!!!

1yYgO6-0tkOuSlVTLTYdZw.text: Great Food! Went with a large party, they had us seated and our drink orders done pretty fast. They then came around for food orders and that's where the service was a little slow... However when I visited, they had just opened, but I would give them another shot! I couldnt decide what I wanted to eat, there is a lot of great choices to choose from.

aeFhZ-7e8P0dJtfqhyMQ1A.text: If you go home hungry, its your fault.  This place reminds me a little bit of Hodad's, a hugely popular burger joint in the Ocean Beach neighborhood of San Diego that emphasizes a laid back beach style atmosphere with crazy burger concoctions.  Seems like owners Ken Likewise, Denise Nelson, and Wiley Arnett had something like that in mind when they opened this place in 2012.  And being that all three owners are former Oregano's execs, the food portions at Rehab are (like Oregano's) somewhat ludicrous.  Seeing that so many fellow Yelpers have been here with such positive results, a lunchtime stopover seemed long overdue.  Located in Old Town Scottsdale on 2nd Street just east of Scottsdale Road, Rehab is hard to miss.  The beach style decor, outdoor patio, chill background music, and stacked bar all beckon you in (you could be forgiven for at least initially thinking you were walking into a tourist trap).  I came at opening expecting the Saturday lunch crowd would quickly swell (which it did), and grabbed a spot at the bar inside.  There's seating for probably 75 inside and another 25 out on the patio out front altogether.  Plenty of TVs here if you want to come and watch a big game.  Otherwise you can just admire the surfboards, beach cruisers, and other beach themed decor on the walls and ceiling.  As other Yelpers have noted, Happy Hour extends from opening all the way to 6pm so plenty of opportunities for cheap eats and drinks earlier in the day.  They also have a $4 chips and salsa Yelp check-in deal (just over $1 cheaper than their normal price), but I wasn't here for chips and salsa.  I did grab a $1.75 can of PBR, well, just because.  But the burgers were the real driving force here.  Take your time deciding though as there's at least two dozen burger options by my count.  And that doesn't even count the different burger sizes, buns, and sides options.  One burger that immediately leaped off the menu for me was the Porkster.  I like pulled pork, I like BBQ sauce, I like beef, and I like cheddar cheese.  And yes I would very much like to try all four at once in between a bun, thank you very much.  I chose the house brioche for my bun as I love brioche.  My side of choice was the sweet potato tater tots.  Total cost for the beer, the food, tax and tip came to $20.  I should note that I ordered the Relapse size burger, which is the smallest size they offer. The Rehab size is twice the size of the Relapse for only $2 more, but after seeing my meal, I'm sure glad I stuck with the regular.  This thing was huge.  Overloaded with pulled pork and copious amounts of cheddar cheese.  The bartender alertly gave me a big stack of napkins with my meal knowing this would be messy.  I had to chip away at some of the loose pulled pork (which was solid by the way), before I could attempt to grab the buns with two hands.  That first big bite was awesome.  Great mix of beef flavors and the bun was perfect.  I also liked the tater tots (including the sauce it came with, which I believe was a chipotle ranch).  I had absolutely no room for dessert this go around as I was totally stuffed.  So I'll reiterate what other Yelpers have said and confirm that yes, the hype is well deserved.  The portions are huge, the staff is friendly, the atmosphere is super chill, and the menu is as inventive as it is expansive.  If this is what Oregano's looks like in burger form, chances are the owners of Rehab will be here for a long time (and likely opening more locations in the near future).  Time for me to go to rehab, for a food coma.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Relapse size Porkster Burger with sweet potato tots &amp; a PBR.  You want pulled pork &amp; beef on one sandwich?  Get this

0y-Did0GSSMzBEPEqntWAw.text: Burger, wings, fries, dipping sauces were all spectacular. Definitely should stop by!

rROFOID5TTk7MXVV6QhDHg.text: We started the meal with onion rings which were perfectly crispy on the outside with moist non-stringy onions inside.  I then ordered the veggie burger, being from CA I'm a sucker for a tasty, in-house made veggie burger.  It wasn't the best I've ever had since it had a two bean base without veggies but I enjoyed ever last bite of it on a pretzel bun.  If I had anymore room in my stomach I would have definitely gone for the "pot" brownie.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Surfer vibes

FQzIZdfbQNyLvaM7oX9nFw.text: We've been going here for years, it's the best burger I've ever had. My husband, whose favorite food is burgers, agrees. I get the 5oz Jalapeno Popper burger (best one!) with pretzel bun and either fries or onion rings. Onion rings are great with the spicy pineapple bbq sauce. It's not good for you but man is it tasty!

TRoFVPS1qy2fx_8HGpsFJg.text: First impressions mean a lot to me and when I went there I was disappointed. The flamboyant guy who sat us down was rude  to us. First he skipped us and waited on the people behind us. (Mind you that there's always a long line to get in.) I simply asked him how seating works and he raised his voice to us, then he sat us in the back by the restroom isle.  Our waiter was extremely great though. He introduced us to the place and went over the menu with us. He's the only reason why I'm giving it 2 stars.  The food wait wasn't that long given the huge amount of people in there, so that wasn't an issue. Now the food just lacks flavor. I am from New Orleans and I am used of flavor. My bacon burger on a pretzel bun was just bland. I only enjoyed the side order of onion rings. Overall my burger was messy.  I'm going to stick to David's Hamburgers and Mexican Food on Main Street.

k0frdH04VZfnheJ330Hkeg.text: Was hoping for more. Had the Ghost burger. Was expecting something more spicy. Burger itself didn't have much flavor or seasonings. Guacamole also didn't have much flavor. Everything was just very average for me.   We also tried Mac n cheese with bacon and it was pretty good but still average.

fxueYlYFy1Ht6Rn-R8QIUA.text: Visited Scottsdale for the first time, went here with 4 adults 2 kids ages 4 and 1... everyone was impressed... small place,  but I am sure when it's not as cold the patio is great.  Hubby had the PBJ burger and couldn't believe how great the combo was. I had the spicy mac burger and it was also amazing... and I don't usually care for Jalepeno!   Definitely a stop for anyone who likes good burgers!!

gGAn8s9swNvolwrGBAMA5g.text: I've been to this establishment a few times, not sure what all the service complaints are about. The service here has never been shitty but it's possibly because I choose to eat at this pretty popular and tiny restaurant at non-peak hours or take my food to go.   My personal favorite, the peanut butter jelly bacon sriracha burger, sounds gross but i've recommended it to people before and the daring few who have tried it, enjoyed it. Their spicy mac n cheese is pretty good, not the best but definitely worth the price and if you like a kick of heat with your cheese. I've tried several of their burgers and none have been a disappointment, so I feel this place is worth trying especially if you enjoy trying weird burger combinations or just want a tasty gourmet burger in general.  They also have a good happy hour.

z76kx_RGrrBXWtj_fCpSCA.text: Loved this place and the atmosphere!! The Mac and cheese burger really hit the spot! I also suggest getting some nacho cheese on the French fries that come with the burgers! Would definitely go back!

e6d-suP701w4LMWT1pIKhA.text: Just awesome! We started with the pig wings which were just the best! I had the poblano burger, which I subbed for chicken. It was so tasty and spicy, I loved it. My bf had the pescado sandwich. I took a bite and I could actually smell and taste the beer. It was so good! Lo was our waitress and she was awesome! We will be back very soon!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8HRbdYtKJpLPrAtT3feTsQ.text: This place rock super hard . Try out the PB&J burger sandwich , it will blow your mind. They have a variety of burgers, so come in here and blow your burger mind away.

0pcy2cw_qeAMZ_qaQhPc7g.text: This is a must hit when I visit Scottsdale. Awesome little place in Old Town, which is a super attraction in its own right. I've always sat outside and since I'm from MN I consider this a distinct pleasure. They usually have New Belgium "Ranger" on draft. Love that beer. The burgers never fail. I had the "Hangover" on this visit, but I can swear by several others too. Then there's the chill atmosphere with an impeccable music playlist. Restrooms with towels ...awesome and very clean. Can't wait to see you again in late March.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4kDMf9HFi_RNhAlrRIEqIg.text: Pretty disappointing. $17 burger I had to eat with a fork and knife, the buns came out so soggy it was gross. The meat would have been pretty good if it was seasoned better. The water tasted so terrible I had to order a soda, the bartender agreed with me, lol...gross. I'd give this place a second try but for a $17.50 burger it's just not worth it, should be top notch.

CShqEV7AJpH9ieFHNimuzA.text: Seriously some of the most unique and delicious burgers I've had. They should come with a warning sign that you're going to need about 40 napkins and maybe a fork, because some of these burgers are really stacked. Mac and cheese burger was exactly as awesome as it sounds. If you've never had a PB&J burger, this is the place to try it. Sounds weird but was really good. Fries and sweet potato tots are both amazing. Went back multiple nights in a row just to try different burgers.  Decor is really fun, too. It's small so it gets crowded fast. I tried to go early, around 4PM for dinner thinking it would be emptier but it was just as packed.   Staff was super friendly and attentive. The only thing I didn't understand were the way they set up the drink specials because it was like a "pick your own" alcohol plus soda but it never really worked for me. I'd stick to the regular drink menu.

_f3ddXd46KyW3bHXQEmZaw.text: Ok... This may be my second review for this place, but all I can say is AMAZING!!!  The food, the atmosphere, and Kay... Was amazing!!!  She could sell ice to an Eskimo.   I had the Elvis burger.... Bananas, peanut butter, chocolate on a bacon hamburger.  It was like cocaine & whiskey on the toilet... To die for!!!!  Thank you Kay for an amazing time at Rehab Burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 48 oz of AMAZING!!!  Thank you Kay!!!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6z75unEdlR_jFKa0UzT7pg.text: We have tried this place twice to give it an honest review and both times we were very disappointed in the food.

QeT0JZjPwuMYYxpxZrZ54A.text: Extremely disappointing.  I am really surprised by the good reviews.  The 5 of us were seated.  No napkins, silverware, etc.  We ordered 3 burgers, 1 chicken sandwich and 1 hot dog.  All three burgers were cooked above ordered level.  All three burgers were so dry, you thought  you were eating saw dust.  Also the flavor of the meat was nothing special.  Seriously people, you must be kidding if you think this is a good burger.  I bet if you try just the burger, without all the toppings, you will realize the burger is not so good.  Maybe this is why they offer so many burgers with toppings.  Oh, after our burgers came, and asking twice, our napkins and silverware came.  My son liked the hot dog.  My daughter thought the chicken was overcooked and dry (I could see burnt pieces).  The onion rings were excellent.  The sweet potato tots were really good.  This is why I gave it 2 stars, otherwise, I would have given this place a 1 star.    We planned on ordering dessert.  The waitress came by, in passing, and dropped off our check while our main plates were still on the table.  We thus assumed she did not want us to order dessert, and we left.

r599J3555ykhmatx8ZhPNQ.text: Sometimes the food I have here is 5 stars worthy, sometimes not as much. I really think it depends on the day but overall good burger experience. They have unique combos.

IoHl_tfXRmkAqHRwebQINw.text: So I went to Rehab Burger Therapy... I really liked the name and the burgers looked DELICIOUS on other yelpers photos. My hotel is close by and it was walking distance, but for some reason I didn't know where anything was because it was so dark out in Old Town. I'm from Houston, and we like a lot of light.  Anyway I walked in and loved the decor.. It kinda gave me that fun playhouse surfer type beachy feel. (sometimes when I explain stuff it sounds weird, but you'll get it when you see it)  I sat at the bar and read the menu, I decided to order the Bacon Bleu on a Pretzel bun togo.  It took like maybe 10 minutes.   When I got back to my hotel. the burger was okay... It was my fault for not asking for lettuce and tomato, but the burger was okay... Not the best but not the worst either. I'll go back again to try a different burger, and give you guys feedback on it!!  I also wish hey had given me napkins for my togo order though.. :-(  Sidebar: there was this girl that worked there, she sounded like and kinda looked a little like Lindsay Lohan... (I'm random I know).

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

obJRzej4Hz59egbiZjERvA.text: I expected a lot more for the hype. My sweet potato tots were a bit burnt, and the service was just okay. The waitress seemed like she really didn't want to be there. She wasn't rude or anything, but she wasn't particularly helpful.  The decor and ambiance of the place are really dingy. You'd expect from such a popular place that they could put a bit more effort into presentation. It wasn't like the food was cheap, either. I think I've been in nicer McDonald's, actually. The whole restaurant was uncomfortably hot, everyone smelled like they'd been in the sun all day, and it was as loud as a bar you go to find a one-night-stand. But it was 1pm on a Sunday, so that was really bizarre. Would it kill them to turn up the A/C? It is Arizona, after all.  I wanted to order one of their spicier menu choices, but I could barely stomach any food at all because of how stuffy the place was. I stuck with a fairly bland cheddar burger with thousand island dressing. I did not have any complaints about the burger, but it wasn't anything to write home about.  My brother ordered a frozen strawberry margarita to cool off. I'm glad I held off ordering one myself until I tasted it, because it tasted like that cheap corn syrup mixes you get on the bottom shelf in the liquor aisles at Walmart. I can make better at home, thanks.  I really expect better from Scottsdale than this, especially when this place has so much hype. Maybe it was an off day, or maybe not. There's dozens of awesome places in town to get a burger, and this one -- despite all the raves -- doesn't make my list.

Y--Ai9vtp55J_xuAAgsJyQ.text: Holy smokes where do I begin? We were lucky enough to bypass the line and sit at the bar.  The two bartenders that waited on us were super awesome sweet and chipper. Happy hour is very reasonable with pretty great options. The corn on the cob may as well be called crack on the cob I could have done a dozen.  This mermaid dust they put on everything is bananas good. The pb&j burger on a pretzel roll was indescribably good. Sweet potato tater tots yum!!!!

o8tj_B9KHoMR9m04asFcfQ.text: This place is a gem in the southwest...We Buffalo people know food and this place rocks...I would suggest the pbj burger...phenomenal... just saying

J7Sahee1kABzqhjMxp65SQ.text: The food was good not great and the place was busy for a Sunday. If you are in the area it's worth checking out.

AcMQiizll0GjKAuQN9uNNA.text: Was in the Scottsdale, AZ area and heard people raving about this place figured I had to stop by and check it out for myself.  First of all definitely not what I expected, to be honest I was expecting more of a "Five Guys" setup but to much pleasure it was a more intimate, personal and relaxed environment.. The surfboard outside kind of hints at the environment inside.  But wait I was in basketball shorts cross trainers and a tank top normally I wouldn't wear this to a sit down restaurant just personal preference but the very nice lady informed me they do take out as well. Perfect. I paid after settling with "The Hangover Burger" which sounded amazing. It was about $14 not the cheapest but I'm from CT and that's what I would expect to pay for a good burger.   I waited outside in my car since she said it would be 15 minutes, called a friend and in 12 minutes she came out with my food without me asking. That was very sweet of her to do so. I drove back to the hotel go to my room then remember I didn't ask for any utensils or condiments! To my surprise though it was all there paper plate, utensils, napkins and even an assortment of condiments. Wow, I was pretty impressed with the customer service and I haven't even tried the burger yet.   Since I know this review is getting lengthy let me just say the above and beyond customer service was not let down by the phenomenal food. Cooked a perfect medium as requested with some sweet potato tots I have never tried that were simply put, addicting.    I will definitely be recommending this place to friends and those who love to get lost in different cities and try great food. Bravo Rehab Burger bravo.

MAaLCNgTavQwM2gzF__j_A.text: My friends and I set a goal of eating at a different restaurant each week. Each of us rate the restaurant from 1-10 on service, atmosphere, and of course the food. This week we choose the Rehab... all three of us rated it a solid 10, 10, and 10. We recommend the Rehab Burger Therapy in that it inexpensive and it will provide a lasting memorable experience that will bring you back again.

TEYvFbluekZ_r5sYKNR2jQ.text: Found this place on Yelp. We had the mushroom and Swiss and the poblano burgers. Both were very tasty and yummy. The interior has a beach like atmosphere that makes you feel like you are on vacation.

Yesterday I had the Ghost burger, I love spicy and this wasn't super spicy but it was just right. Get the sweet potato tots with their jalapeno dipping sauce I believe the waitress told me (wish they had honey mustard but this sauce was delicious.).  Our waitress was on point and I plan to go here again for sure.

gxicdJNjMF9y1ybqbs03bg.text: This place has a great atmosphere.  This place has A great variety of burgers and beverages.   Is a great place to have some food and some beverages and a good conversation.

SqTs5yknFYZo_vhPdyy98g.text: First let me say that I don't think this place is worth the hype.  I had a BYOB today with bacon, hatch chilies, cheese on a pretzel bun with fries.  The meat lacked seasoning, bacon was a little under cooked and I thought that the chilies should have been diced.  The fries were cooked and seasoned well but the two dipping sauces where store bought, kinda lame in my opinion.  I will not be going back to Rehab!   Food Guy Out!

SmOOBbdc0yov4lUbNorgmw.text: Wow. So many choices here. I ended having the jalapeno popper burger, very good. Hubby had fish tacos, huge and couldn't finish.  The caramel shake was delicious. I had onion rings, average.

wPvG1SDhap7lmm2g9v67Cw.text: This place is simply amazing! I came here during lunch, luckily the lunch rush had not hit yet, so there was plenty of room. The service was friendly enough, and the food was beyond good.  I ordered the PB J burger medium rare. When it came out I cut it into 4 pieces just to make sure I wouldn't make a mess (this is one messy burger) It was cooked perfectly medium rare, which is apparently harder to do than it sounds. Words can not describe how good this burger was, its a must try. The fries were pretty good as well.   If your looking for a good burger and your in the area, stop by, you will not be disappointed.

MPt4SamCTOdeA8rYus2iww.text: I love the wide selection of burgers and the service is always on point! I always make sure to get the jalapeno martini! There's two valley locations to check out and i always have an awesome time here!

bQCzpOA7PDGL0LvDEQdjNQ.text: Amazing!! Finally went there today after talking about going for a long time. The food was so good but unfortunately we had to take home boxes because we just couldn't eat everything  we even brought home a hatch turkey burger for my mom and she LOVED it! Hands down we will be back for sure!!

k8CcPQ8rsXjiKnumxH2zsw.text: Best burgers in Arizona! Can't go wrong with the jalepeno popper burger with a pretzel bun

KwelIfpI8_PI6S8sWtLd9w.text: Expensive and One hour waiting time but told only 30 minutes and then took nearly 50 minutes for 4 burgers and 1 hotdog to go to the table. I will not be back. The waiter was not friendly either. Not a good experience and was really expensive. Food is ok but not special.

FxOi1Q_dHpHf99KuEO5A0g.text: This place has the best burgers around, with an awesome variety. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but I would definitely recommend an order of sweet potato tots...best I've ever had. Service at times is slow, but the food is worth the wait!

8DgBi8ZENQVzpUJ7WzZR6Q.text: Awesome burgers and pleasant staff. It does get crowded,  so recommended checking it out weekdays.

kmflnFHrMBPqLOjjloGJnQ.text: Three stars is good by my standard and worth the experience.  Hit: Fun, energetic Saturday afternoon atmosphere. Great people watching with an essence of Mission Beach (San Diego).  Burgers were great, I had the hatch green chili burger and it was phenom. Service was quick and to the point. .  Missed: Wasn't as big a fan of hubby's PB&J burger, but it was definitely a fun experience to try. They were out of the famed tater tot so we had to miss out. Also, worth noting that it definitely feels more like a bar than a restaurant - "not that there's anything wrong with that..." but make sure you get in the mindset.   All said, a good experience and fun to try something different. .

i_aBT8Ti-jsl0xmN7UdBIw.text: We were in the area and I wanted a burger, so I checked Yelp and I found this great burger place that had great reviews. Now that I ate here, I know why..... The burgers are cooked to order, which is something I haven't gotten in a while. We sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and informative. A glass of red wine and a delicious burger is perfect on a Friday night. This place is hopping tonight. Good food and fun atmosphere. Highly recommend it! We will be back.

6RIwRBiqxA5VQNA61Ihctg.text: they have great service, great burgers and phenomenal wings! we go here all the time, even for take out :)

hwY6a7pSmHGJjF67dt-6Kw.text: Great burgers, awesome sweet potato tater tots! And great service! They have gluten free options too. We have eaten here 2 times and will definitely be back.

LI4QxYJWyEmnT-0Gol4EPQ.text: Great place!  All four of us went and everyone loved their burgers.  Three of us had the McNalrly burger which reminds you of the old Bobs Big Boy but much better. Thank goodness I got the small size but it was interesting to watch my brother in law eat the full double burger.   One had the chilli burger which was great as well.  The fries are great as well as the sweet potatoe tots. I'm didn't care for the onion rings but everyone else did.  We came from Glendale and will most definitely be back!

bo1OpUVyUOzAl-dM_bn_zw.text: Pleased to help this place edge closer to 1,000 great reviews.  And it was the reviews that drew us here, although we were a little suspicious at first.  Next door to a pawn shop?  Check.  On the very outer edge of Old Scottsdale?  Check.  Looks like a bar room?  Check.  Twenty to thirty minute wait on a Tuesday evening even though it looked like there were some empty tables left?  Check.  Would we be disappointed??  NO!  It was FANTASTIC!  Our waitress was very attentive and the food was all great.   The onion rings were some of the best we have had and the burgers were cooked perfectly.  I had the chili cheeseburger and my husband had the bacon cheeseburger.  The sweet potato tots are delicious, as are all of the various dipping sauces they offer.    Caution:  the burgers come in two sizes.  Do not overestimate the size of your appetite.  We both brought a good chunk of our meals home, too stuffed to continue.

SPbg669yvcgBLHaBpw2H-g.text: Love this place. Been here twice-once for lunch, once for dinner. The surfer/beach atmosphere sets a great mood. Love the reggae music! Staff has never let us down... Friendly & Attentive. The food is just off the wall. My husband always gets the McNarly burger which is what the McDonald's Big Mac in a 5star restaurant would be. I personally am addicted to the sweet potato tots. And they let you have whatever signature sauces you want. I love this place.

x55JXp3Rw5Q25DF__Yq8bA.text: Nice ambience, great variety of appetizers, burgers, sandwiches, etc. I had the chili cheese fries - very good! Followed that up with a bacon cheeseburger - also very good. Had a couple glasses of Kilt Lifter beer as well. The place was fairly crowded at 1 pm when I arrived but the crowd thinned out a little by the time we left. There are also large and smaller sizes for each burger.

rWP3Vi-D3mDUuZbHvEFKtw.text: This is the place to get the best burgers in Old Town. Great location, well staffed, and awesome food. Never had a bad thing come out to our table from here. Will be coming back for as long as they keep their doors open. Keep up the great work!

chBZsA7U-sfsK1e8n_MEiA.text: I had the mac burger. with fries. I thought the burger was just OK. The bun was a little hard and the burger itself was bland. The fries are nothing special, undercooked and droopy. With all the proliferation of burger places, I expect a burger that is above average. With that being said, my wife ordered the Cobb salad which was huge and that was only the smaller size...she liked it. My son and daughter both had burgers and said it was good. The place is small, hot and kind of cramped and can get noisy. I thought the service was good and they even brought out drinks while we waited outside for a table. I probably won't go back but one can do worse.

7RZW-_JdWCZn7i-O4IUk-g.text: my only problem with the place is the Margarita's were way over priced and should be in a Margarita glass not a tall soda glass bartending 101 the food and service was perfect

nEr2O6GaGDORpxF7R3u9mg.text: Ridiculously good burger, added the Chipoltle aioli sauce. Should have ordered the 5oz and not the 10oz as it was massive. nice bar atmosphere, can't go wrong here.

32iHTfxUTbofpDDUX4fu8g.text: Didn't start off so well (they forgot my friend, and my order)...so they compt our meal, which we didn't expect cuz it was no big deal.  Atomosphere is great, burger is great,...will definitly go back, well runned restaurant and friendly.

hLSFXydeo7Dde-3MpYC_IQ.text: Been there twice. First time would give it 3.5 stars. Was decent. Was there last week. Took forever to get our food and there may have been at most three other groups there ( of maybe a total of 12 people) so it was dead.  Finally got food and every order was wrong. When they finally corrected and got our food, it was below average.   There are far too many other places to go and get burgers, so this place needs to step up their game or they will be done.

w5tSSsURTEHtWzuQc1xJbw.text: Great burgers! Fab onion rings! Great servi ce. I would make this a definite return place. We started with sweet potato tots and dips. The know poblano burger was great...best burger ice had in years.

AXyfu8Plvx1V3aaGPxnRWw.text: Fantastic! We ate on a weekday evening. Staff was phenomenal and explained everything to us (gave us free samples). Pretzel buns are amazing. Sweet potato tots with the pineapple-based sauce were very good. Lots to choose from!

dcebSA-_PqqU3novOCIV6g.text: I'm not really a burger guy, but I was with a bunch of guys who were probably not into "ethnic" food.  We were in Old town Scottsdale, and as much as I was trying to steer everyone to italian food, they weren't going for it.  We ended up here.  It's kind of weird place, I thought it had a great vibe, but the rest of my group didn't.  One guy ordered the peach beer which was terrible.  I got the sweet tots for an appetizer, which were really good.  You could also get it as a side for a burger.  I ended up with a turkey burger, which was okay.  I got a side of onion rings with it as well.   The rings were only alright.  The rest of my group had burgers, which they said tasted pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary for the cost of the burger.  My group didn't like the beer selection, I'm a fan of the four peaks beer, so I wasn't complaining about that.  All in all, it was a pretty average experience.

j25vgtqIf4glsAwtItIg4Q.text: Service was very prompt tonight & food very good.. Excellent drinks..menu is large with many choices..different size burgers available is always a plus

IE8KDM99SEz7uZTngoOs9g.text: I can literally say that I don't have one complaint about this place. I don't eat red meat but I can tell you that their turkey burger is to die for and the pretzel bun is one of the best things I have ever eaten. Also, best bloody mary I have ever had in my life, and let me tell you I have had my share of bloody marys. I even get virgin ones because they are just THAT good. The sweet potato tots are out of this world, I'm getting hungry just thinking about them. All food aside, the service is amazing! The servers are so nice and friendly and accommodating, I was absolutely stunned. One day I came in extremelyyyyy hungover, so obviously hungry and the waitress took one look at me and knew I was dying. She literally whispered and purposely sat me at the furtherest table away from the bar so I wouldn't have to see any alcohol. LIKE REALLY? Talk about going above and beyond. Not to mention that we got our food in like 10 minutes! Sooo basically: amazing food, amazing service, and amazing price. My favorite place to eat in Scottsdale!

nlJeVnPP8wjnjYl7bGA03Q.text: Burgers are great, relaxed and casual environment and great service. Kaye our server was terrific! Great place for a burger and fries!  Also the Portabello burger really hit the spot.

7qcaSEAnd8h4BnVRNoHYSw.text: Service was slow and the burger came out on a soggy bun.  Asked for a fresh bun but took forever so ended up just eating the meat.  Also, the place was super hot.  Everyone at our table was sweating.  Maybe they were just having a bad night but I wouldn't go back to this place after this experience.

YlCT6gG4b8zqWevTo_2oTw.text: I've driven past this place a number of times.  This evening my wife and I decided not to drive past.  Glad we did.  I have the Hawaiian Burger with Jamaican corn.  Fries are usually pretty hard to beat but the corn was a stunning surprise.   Wow.  And the burger?  Couldn't put it down.  Definitely a new favorite to add to the rotation.

2yW03XXa8LePj9aXzSWp9g.text: A. Great barbecue burger. B. Great service from Megan. C. Fun atmosphere inside and on the patio. D. Kilt LIfter draft beer was perfect !

V6yS3NehX4Iok5gdm4Tg_Q.text: Tried the PBJ Burger on a recommendation from our server and wow. It was amazing I will definitely be back when I am in Scottsdale next time. Also the sweet potato tots are great as well as their onion rings. I was impressed to see a lot of the locals there as well as visitors like myself. Great burgers and cold beer.

446jHP2j3CkXONlgeIVwhw.text: Yum, yum! Food was delicious and the all day Happy Hour on a Saturday didn't suck either. Had the PB & J & Bacon burger... Ridiculous! I'll be back FOR SURE!

gnwjeOdtKxGFmwaRxk-xeQ.text: I wish I could eat here more often.  I'm rarely in a good enough mood to buy a $15 burger.  When I am, I go to Rehab.  You can't make a burger like they do over at Rehab, unless you decide to put on your burger whatever you can find in the fridge.  That's pretty much how their Sunday specials work, but you won't make a Sunday special as good as theirs.  And always get your burgers with the pretzel buns.

qPck_hjtbsUGVtJgBDT46A.text: I've been to this place several times and I'm never disappointed. It's become my go-to place when people come to visit. The portions are kinda large so it's nice to share or take home the extra.  I've had the burgers and the salads...all very good!

hiC4IXdRrJQzh5BVgV348w.text: Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend had the Mac n cheese Siracha burger and I had a regular cheeseburger, but both were amazing. Definitely a must try place!

ydXkVXg8j5lPbsczSXy_jQ.text: I  LOVE LOVE LOVE Rehab Burger!! The food is awesome, there are two sizes, Rehab (bigger) and Relapse (smaller), the smaller burger is really big! I always get the Bacon cheeseburger, mainly because I am to scared to try new things....but....the other day my friend tried the PB&J burger...I know, that's what I was thinking too, how gross peanut butter and jelly on a hamburger, disgusting.  OMGawd!!!!!  IT WAS AHHHHHH-MAZING!!!!  It was so good! The sweet potato taster tots are awesome too.  Feels like it's always super busy when I go there, but I guess that speaks to how good it is.  The wait staff is not the best, every time I go no matter what day or time of day, the wait staff is pretty slow and sometimes forgetful.  If you can overlook the so so waitstaff (they are always friendly) and go solely for the food...you will NOT be disappointed !!

wb-xpeFiNZXvnwyL75XKHw.text: Had the turkey burger with avocado and aioli and it was great! They also have a decent beer selection.  If you really like burgers and beers, give this place a shot!

Ov_iExhbDjvo_YmY9z5wDQ.text: This place doesn't seem like much from the outside but GO HERE! The spivey Mac n Cheese burger is out of this world. Service was top notch. Highly recommend this place for a casual dinner!

VeXwVikGkvvqlYTfiSgDpA.text: Quality of food combined with amazing service makes this place a new family favorite. We were out and about exploring Scottsdale, i told my husband I was in the mood for a burger and so we ended up here. The food is amazing and we will be going back for sure!!! I really wish they had a location closer but we will make the drive for this place!!!

P3bybLcGL1h0Yk9EgV-Hww.text: Went last Saturday night with a bunch of friends. (thank goodness we made reservations - there was a decent crowd waiting to get in!)  We had a variety of burgers and sandwiches and everyone enjoyed their meals. Service was fine. Sat outside and it was a perfect night for it. Glad we were outside as inside gets really loud. Only complaints -  the appetizers came out with the meals, and our burgers were inconsistently done. Three of us ordered medium, and they were all three different - from well done to rare. Guess I expect more from a place that specializes in burgers... It won't keep me from going back though!

iJZYD1QAN3-t8R102juS2w.text: If you like thick beef patties, then maybe you'd like this place. I asked for well done for my beef patty, not burn it so that it's bitter and nasty. The chocolate shake tastes like it was made from Hershey's chocolate syrup and low quality shake base (disgusting). I prefer sweet potato fries over sweet potato tots. The tots taste like regular potatoes to me. We got the BBQ pork wings and some of it was good, some were dry. It was also way to barbecue-ee for my taste. The place was way too loud.

ULMUENpPMjesO_sZwxOwhQ.text: So, the reviews are spot on...this place is amazing!  We stopped by today right when they opened and snagged a great table on the patio with our pooch...the host recommended a super dog friendly table and brought out some water for her.  Our server was great - friendly, efficient and so nice to our dog.  The food was fantastic too...we tried the chili cheese fries to start (don't judge...we went to the gym that morning) and each of us had the hawaiian turkey burger - one on a pretzel bun and one on a wheat bun with sides of fries.  The portions were really large (I took half of my burger home) and everything was made fresh.  This is a great spot to enjoy the nice weather on the patio with some good food and drinks or inside to catch the games.  Definitely worth a visit!

EQtfklOTM6EFRby8-cn5vA.text: The food was great, however, when deciding what size burger to get, our watress (knowing I really wanted to try the dessert) suggested the bigger burger. Unfortunately after sharing an appetizer and burger, we were too full for dessert. I also feel like since we didn't want the extra food to go to waste that we over stuffed ourselves and couldn't really enjoy the meal as a result. Some day soon I would like to go back there and get a smaller meal so I can fully enjoy it. Over all the quality of food was great and I LOVED the "dive bar" atmosphere!!

ggqJsty4RYbCLsPNov6mew.text: 1st time here but DEF not our last! Food was fresh and delicious. Not a quiet or peaceful restaurant but the service was adequate. Never thought I'd be ok with a $11 burger but is was really good. Feels like a vacation destination.

G5S9iP26SWM_VAfOxf9Yhw.text: Try the porkster burger, just remember to bring some wet naps

ivVBHyt9F0dfAT2wb8w4xg.text: Wow is all I can say. Huge burgers, great food. Bring your appetite. Lots of options to choose from. Not just burgers. Alcohol for this whom choose to drink. Great atmosphere. We went during weekday. Can't imagine them at night or on weekends.

JoFx4XGb285-PXgkVtm-bA.text: I have eaten lots of burgers in my travels, and I have to say that Burger Rehab Therapy is one of the best I have ever had. The meat is fresh, seasoned and cooked perfectly, the buns are fresh and soft, the toppings are fresh and the service is great. This is the burger that I will forever judge all burgers by. The other patrons are very friendly too. Lots of burger knowledge in this place.

ZrmzVWN3gus6u4AH7KIq9A.text: I must be a traditional burger kind of guy because this place really was just "OK" to me. If you're the type that likes a regular burger, this burger joint might not be the best for you. It didn't really stand out as amazing or wow, but I have to say that I would gladly recommend it to those who enjoy the new style of New American foods. The party I went with really enjoyed their PB&J burger so I'll go ahead and recommend that if you're into that kind of stuff.

HR6W7xeTTrrKDfDeNDrJLg.text: The peanut butter and jelly burger was life changing! Mac and cheese burger was also good. Pretty cramped inside, more bar atmosphere than restaurant.
